qualified volunteer emergency response o.rest: any volunteer organization— which is organized and operated to provide firefighting or emergency medical services for persons in the State or political subdivision, as the case may be, and which is required (by written agreement) by the State or political subdivision to furnish firefighting or emergency medical services in such State or political subdivision.
qualified volunteer emergency response o.sentence: The term “qualified volunteer emergency response organization” means any volunteer organization— which is organized and operated to provide firefighting or emergency medical services for persons in the State or political subdivision, as the case may be, and which is required (by written agreement) by the State or political subdivision to furnish firefighting or emergency medical services in such State or political subdivision.

Indian tribe.sentence: For purposes of this section— The term “Indian tribe” has the meaning given such term by section 45A(c)(6).

dependent.rest: given such term by section 152, determined without regard to subsections (b)(1), (b)(2), and (d)(1)(B) thereof.
dependent.sentence: The term “dependent” has the meaning given such term by section 152, determined without regard to subsections (b)(1), (b)(2), and (d)(1)(B) thereof.

qualified Indian health care benefit.rest: — any health service or benefit provided or purchased, directly or indirectly, by the Indian Health Service through a grant to or a contract or compact with an Indian tribe or tribal organization, or through a third-party program funded by the Indian Health Service, medical care provided or purchased by, or amounts to reimburse for such medical care provided by, an Indian tribe or tribal organization for, or to, a member of an Indian tribe, including a spouse or dependent of such a member, coverage under accident or health insurance (or an arrangement having the effect of accident or health insurance), or an accident or health plan, provided by an Indian tribe or tribal organization for medical care to a member of an Indian tribe, include a spouse or dependent of such a member, and any other medical care provided by an Indian tribe or tribal organization that supplements, replaces, or substitutes for a program or service relating to medical care provided by the Federal government to Indian tribes or members of such a tribe.
qualified Indian health care benefit.sentence: For purposes of this section, the term “qualified Indian health care benefit” means— any health service or benefit provided or purchased, directly or indirectly, by the Indian Health Service through a grant to or a contract or compact with an Indian tribe or tribal organization, or through a third-party program funded by the Indian Health Service, medical care provided or purchased by, or amounts to reimburse for such medical care provided by, an Indian tribe or tribal organization for, or to, a member of an Indian tribe, including a spouse or dependent of such a member, coverage under accident or health insurance (or an arrangement having the effect of accident or health insurance), or an accident or health plan, provided by an Indian tribe or tribal organization for medical care to a member of an Indian tribe, include a spouse or dependent of such a member, and any other medical care provided by an Indian tribe or tribal organization that supplements, replaces, or substitutes for a program or service relating to medical care provided by the Federal government to Indian tribes or members of such a tribe.

tribal organization.rest: given such term by section 4(l) of the Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance Act.
tribal organization.sentence: The term “tribal organization” has the meaning given such term by section 4(l) of the Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance Act.

Indian general welfare benefit.rest: any payment made or services provided to or on behalf of a member of an Indian tribe (or any spouse or dependent of such a member) pursuant to an Indian tribal government program, but only if— the program is administered under specified guidelines and does not discriminate in favor of members of the governing body of the tribe, and the benefits provided under such program— are available to any tribal member who meets such guidelines, are for the promotion of general welfare, are not lavish or extravagant, and are not compensation for services.
Indian general welfare benefit.sentence: For purposes of this section, the term “Indian general welfare benefit” includes any payment made or services provided to or on behalf of a member of an Indian tribe (or any spouse or dependent of such a member) pursuant to an Indian tribal government program, but only if— the program is administered under specified guidelines and does not discriminate in favor of members of the governing body of the tribe, and the benefits provided under such program— are available to any tribal member who meets such guidelines, are for the promotion of general welfare, are not lavish or extravagant, and are not compensation for services.

Indian tribal government.rest: any agencies or instrumentalities of an Indian tribal government and any Alaska Native regional or village corporation, as defined in, or established pursuant to, the Alaska Native Claims Settlement Act (43 U.S.C.
Indian tribal government.sentence: For purposes of this section— For purposes of this section, the term “Indian tribal government” includes any agencies or instrumentalities of an Indian tribal government and any Alaska Native regional or village corporation, as defined in, or established pursuant to, the Alaska Native Claims Settlement Act (43 U.S.C.

dependent.rest: given such term by section 152, determined without regard to subsections (b)(1), (b)(2), and (d)(1)(B).
dependent.sentence: The term “dependent” has the meaning given such term by section 152, determined without regard to subsections (b)(1), (b)(2), and (d)(1)(B).

covered offense.rest: any criminal offense under Federal or State law, and includes any criminal offense arising from the same course of conduct as that criminal offense.
covered offense.sentence: For purposes of this section, the term “covered offense” means any criminal offense under Federal or State law, and includes any criminal offense arising from the same course of conduct as that criminal offense.

wrongfully incarcerated individual.rest: an individual— who was convicted of a covered offense, who served all or part of a sentence of imprisonment relating to that covered offense, and who was pardoned, granted clemency, or granted amnesty for that covered offense because that individual was innocent of that covered offense, or for whom the judgment of conviction for that covered offense was reversed or vacated, and for whom the indictment, information, or other accusatory instrument for that covered offense was dismissed or who was found not guilty at a new trial after the judgment of conviction for that covered offense was reversed or vacated.
wrongfully incarcerated individual.sentence: For purposes of this section, the term “wrongfully incarcerated individual” means an individual— who was convicted of a covered offense, who served all or part of a sentence of imprisonment relating to that covered offense, and who was pardoned, granted clemency, or granted amnesty for that covered offense because that individual was innocent of that covered offense, or for whom the judgment of conviction for that covered offense was reversed or vacated, and for whom the indictment, information, or other accusatory instrument for that covered offense was dismissed or who was found not guilty at a new trial after the judgment of conviction for that covered offense was reversed or vacated.

applicable DC area.rest: the area consisting of— the census tracts located in the District of Columbia which are part of an enterprise community designated under subchapter U before the date of the enactment of this subchapter, and all other census tracts— which are located in the District of Columbia, and for which the poverty rate is not less than than 11 So in original.
applicable DC area.sentence: For purposes of subsection (a), the term “applicable DC area” means the area consisting of— the census tracts located in the District of Columbia which are part of an enterprise community designated under subchapter U before the date of the enactment of this subchapter, and all other census tracts— which are located in the District of Columbia, and for which the poverty rate is not less than than 11 So in original.

DC Zone asset.rest: — any DC Zone business stock, any DC Zone partnership interest, and any DC Zone business property.
DC Zone asset.sentence: For purposes of this section— The term “DC Zone asset” means— any DC Zone business stock, any DC Zone partnership interest, and any DC Zone business property.

DC Zone asset#.rest: any property which would be a DC Zone asset but for paragraph (2)(A)(i), (3)(A), or (4)(A)(i) or (ii) in the hands of the taxpayer if such property was a DC Zone asset in the hands of a prior holder.
DC Zone asset#.sentence: The term “DC Zone asset” includes any property which would be a DC Zone asset but for paragraph (2)(A)(i), (3)(A), or (4)(A)(i) or (ii) in the hands of the taxpayer if such property was a DC Zone asset in the hands of a prior holder.

DC Zone business.rest: any enterprise zone business (as defined in section 1397C), determined— after the application of section 1400(e), by substituting “80 percent” for “50 percent” in subsections (b)(2) and (c)(1) of section 1397C, and by treating no area other than the DC Zone as an empowerment zone or enterprise community.
DC Zone business.sentence: For purposes of this section, the term “DC Zone business” means any enterprise zone business (as defined in section 1397C), determined— after the application of section 1400(e), by substituting “80 percent” for “50 percent” in subsections (b)(2) and (c)(1) of section 1397C, and by treating no area other than the DC Zone as an empowerment zone or enterprise community.

DC Zone business property.rest: tangible property if— such property was acquired by the taxpayer by purchase (as defined in section 179(d)(2)) after December 31, 1997, and before January 1, 2012, the original use of such property in the DC Zone commences with the taxpayer, and during substantially all of the taxpayer’s holding period for such property, substantially all of the use of such property was in a DC Zone business of the taxpayer.
DC Zone business property.sentence: The term “DC Zone business property” means tangible property if— such property was acquired by the taxpayer by purchase (as defined in section 179(d)(2)) after December 31, 1997, and before January 1, 2012, the original use of such property in the DC Zone commences with the taxpayer, and during substantially all of the taxpayer’s holding period for such property, substantially all of the use of such property was in a DC Zone business of the taxpayer.

DC Zone business stock.rest: any stock in a domestic corporation which is originally issued after December 31, 1997, if— such stock is acquired by the taxpayer, before January 1, 2012, at its original issue (directly or through an underwriter) solely in exchange for cash, as of the time such stock was issued, such corporation was a DC Zone business (or, in the case of a new corporation, such corporation was being organized for purposes of being a DC Zone business), and during substantially all of the taxpayer’s holding period for such stock, such corporation qualified as a DC Zone business.
DC Zone business stock.sentence: The term “DC Zone business stock” means any stock in a domestic corporation which is originally issued after December 31, 1997, if— such stock is acquired by the taxpayer, before January 1, 2012, at its original issue (directly or through an underwriter) solely in exchange for cash, as of the time such stock was issued, such corporation was a DC Zone business (or, in the case of a new corporation, such corporation was being organized for purposes of being a DC Zone business), and during substantially all of the taxpayer’s holding period for such stock, such corporation qualified as a DC Zone business.

DC Zone partnership interest.rest: any capital or profits interest in a domestic partnership which is originally issued after December 31, 1997, if— such interest is acquired by the taxpayer, before January 1, 2012, from the partnership solely in exchange for cash, as of the time such interest was acquired, such partnership was a DC Zone business (or, in the case of a new partnership, such partnership was being organized for purposes of being a DC Zone business), and during substantially all of the taxpayer’s holding period for such interest, such partnership qualified as a DC Zone business.
DC Zone partnership interest.sentence: The term “DC Zone partnership interest” means any capital or profits interest in a domestic partnership which is originally issued after December 31, 1997, if— such interest is acquired by the taxpayer, before January 1, 2012, from the partnership solely in exchange for cash, as of the time such interest was acquired, such partnership was a DC Zone business (or, in the case of a new partnership, such partnership was being organized for purposes of being a DC Zone business), and during substantially all of the taxpayer’s holding period for such interest, such partnership qualified as a DC Zone business.

qualified capital gain.rest: any gain recognized on the sale or exchange of— a capital asset, or property used in the trade or business (as defined in section 1231(b)).
qualified capital gain.sentence: For purposes of this section— Except as otherwise provided in this subsection, the term “qualified capital gain” means any gain recognized on the sale or exchange of— a capital asset, or property used in the trade or business (as defined in section 1231(b)).

qualified capital gain#.rest: any gain attributable to periods before January 1, 1998, or after December 31, 2016.
qualified capital gain#.sentence: The term “qualified capital gain” shall not include any gain attributable to periods before January 1, 1998, or after December 31, 2016.

qualified capital gain##.rest: any gain which would be treated as ordinary income under section 1245 or under section 1250 if section 1250 applied to all depreciation rather than the additional depreciation.
qualified capital gain##.sentence: The term “qualified capital gain” shall not include any gain which would be treated as ordinary income under section 1245 or under section 1250 if section 1250 applied to all depreciation rather than the additional depreciation.

qualified capital gain###.rest: any gain which is attributable to real property, or an intangible asset, which is not an integral part of a DC Zone business.
qualified capital gain###.sentence: The term “qualified capital gain” shall not include any gain which is attributable to real property, or an intangible asset, which is not an integral part of a DC Zone business.

qualified capital gain####.rest: any gain attributable, directly or indirectly, in whole or in part, to a transaction with a related person.
qualified capital gain####.sentence: The term “qualified capital gain” shall not include any gain attributable, directly or indirectly, in whole or in part, to a transaction with a related person.

first-time homebuyer.rest: any individual if such individual (and if married, such individual’s spouse) had no present ownership interest in a principal residence in the District of Columbia during the 1-year period ending on the date of the purchase of the principal residence to which this section applies.
first-time homebuyer.sentence: For purposes of this section— The term “first-time homebuyer” means any individual if such individual (and if married, such individual’s spouse) had no present ownership interest in a principal residence in the District of Columbia during the 1-year period ending on the date of the purchase of the principal residence to which this section applies.

modified adjusted gross income.rest: the adjusted gross income of the taxpayer for the taxable year increased by any amount excluded from gross income under section 911, 931, or 933.
modified adjusted gross income.sentence: For purposes of paragraph (1), the term “modified adjusted gross income” means the adjusted gross income of the taxpayer for the taxable year increased by any amount excluded from gross income under section 911, 931, or 933.

purchase.rest: any acquisition, but only if— the property is not acquired from a person whose relationship to the person acquiring it would result in the disallowance of losses under section 267 or 707(b) (but, in applying section 267(b) and (c) for purposes of this section, paragraph (4) of section 267(c) shall be treated as providing that the family of an individual shall include only his spouse, ancestors, and lineal descendants), and the basis of the property in the hands of the person acquiring it is not determined— in whole or in part by reference to the adjusted basis of such property in the hands of the person from whom acquired, or under section 1014(a) (relating to property acquired from a decedent).
purchase.sentence: The term “purchase” means any acquisition, but only if— the property is not acquired from a person whose relationship to the person acquiring it would result in the disallowance of losses under section 267 or 707(b) (but, in applying section 267(b) and (c) for purposes of this section, paragraph (4) of section 267(c) shall be treated as providing that the family of an individual shall include only his spouse, ancestors, and lineal descendants), and the basis of the property in the hands of the person acquiring it is not determined— in whole or in part by reference to the adjusted basis of such property in the hands of the person from whom acquired, or under section 1014(a) (relating to property acquired from a decedent).

purchase price.rest: the adjusted basis of the principal residence on the date such residence is purchased.
purchase price.sentence: The term “purchase price” means the adjusted basis of the principal residence on the date such residence is purchased.

local government.rest: — any county, city, town, township, parish, village, or other general purpose political subdivision of a State, and any combination of political subdivisions described in subparagraph (A) recognized by the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development.
local government.sentence: The term “local government” means— any county, city, town, township, parish, village, or other general purpose political subdivision of a State, and any combination of political subdivisions described in subparagraph (A) recognized by the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development.

renewal community.rest: any area— which is nominated by 1 or more local governments and the State or States in which it is located for designation as a renewal community (hereafter in this section referred to as a “nominated area”), and which the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development designates as a renewal community, after consultation with— the Secretaries of Agriculture, Commerce, Labor, and the Treasury; 11 So in original.
renewal community.sentence: For purposes of this title, the term “renewal community” means any area— which is nominated by 1 or more local governments and the State or States in which it is located for designation as a renewal community (hereafter in this section referred to as a “nominated area”), and which the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development designates as a renewal community, after consultation with— the Secretaries of Agriculture, Commerce, Labor, and the Treasury; 11 So in original.

qualified capital gain.rest: any gain recognized on the sale or exchange of— a capital asset, or property used in the trade or business (as defined in section 1231(b)).
qualified capital gain.sentence: For purposes of this section— Except as otherwise provided in this subsection, the term “qualified capital gain” means any gain recognized on the sale or exchange of— a capital asset, or property used in the trade or business (as defined in section 1231(b)).

qualified capital gain#.rest: any gain attributable to periods before January 1, 2002, or after December 31, 2014.
qualified capital gain#.sentence: The term “qualified capital gain” shall not include any gain attributable to periods before January 1, 2002, or after December 31, 2014.

qualified community asset.rest: — any qualified community stock, any qualified community partnership interest, and any qualified community business property.
qualified community asset.sentence: For purposes of this section— The term “qualified community asset” means— any qualified community stock, any qualified community partnership interest, and any qualified community business property.

qualified community business property.rest: tangible property if— such property was acquired by the taxpayer by purchase (as defined in section 179(d)(2)) after December 31, 2001, and before January 1, 2010, the original use of such property in the renewal community commences with the taxpayer, and during substantially all of the taxpayer’s holding period for such property, substantially all of the use of such property was in a renewal community business of the taxpayer.
qualified community business property.sentence: The term “qualified community business property” means tangible property if— such property was acquired by the taxpayer by purchase (as defined in section 179(d)(2)) after December 31, 2001, and before January 1, 2010, the original use of such property in the renewal community commences with the taxpayer, and during substantially all of the taxpayer’s holding period for such property, substantially all of the use of such property was in a renewal community business of the taxpayer.

qualified community partnership interest.rest: any capital or profits interest in a domestic partnership if— such interest is acquired by the taxpayer after December 31, 2001, and before January 1, 2010, from the partnership solely in exchange for cash, as of the time such interest was acquired, such partnership was a renewal community business (or, in the case of a new partnership, such partnership was being organized for purposes of being a renewal community business), and during substantially all of the taxpayer’s holding period for such interest, such partnership qualified as a renewal community business.
qualified community partnership interest.sentence: The term “qualified community partnership interest” means any capital or profits interest in a domestic partnership if— such interest is acquired by the taxpayer after December 31, 2001, and before January 1, 2010, from the partnership solely in exchange for cash, as of the time such interest was acquired, such partnership was a renewal community business (or, in the case of a new partnership, such partnership was being organized for purposes of being a renewal community business), and during substantially all of the taxpayer’s holding period for such interest, such partnership qualified as a renewal community business.

qualified community stock.rest: any stock in a domestic corporation if— such stock is acquired by the taxpayer after December 31, 2001, and before January 1, 2010, at its original issue (directly or through an underwriter) from the corporation solely in exchange for cash, as of the time such stock was issued, such corporation was a renewal community business (or, in the case of a new corporation, such corporation was being organized for purposes of being a renewal community business), and during substantially all of the taxpayer’s holding period for such stock, such corporation qualified as a renewal community business.
qualified community stock.sentence: Except as provided in subparagraph (B), the term “qualified community stock” means any stock in a domestic corporation if— such stock is acquired by the taxpayer after December 31, 2001, and before January 1, 2010, at its original issue (directly or through an underwriter) from the corporation solely in exchange for cash, as of the time such stock was issued, such corporation was a renewal community business (or, in the case of a new corporation, such corporation was being organized for purposes of being a renewal community business), and during substantially all of the taxpayer’s holding period for such stock, such corporation qualified as a renewal community business.

renewal community business.rest: any entity or proprietorship which would be a qualified business entity or qualified proprietorship under section 1397C if references to renewal communities were substituted for references to empowerment zones in such section.
renewal community business.sentence: For purposes of this subchapter, the term “renewal community business” means any entity or proprietorship which would be a qualified business entity or qualified proprietorship under section 1397C if references to renewal communities were substituted for references to empowerment zones in such section.

commercial revitalization agency.rest: any agency authorized by a State to carry out this section.
commercial revitalization agency.sentence: For purposes of this section, the term “commercial revitalization agency” means any agency authorized by a State to carry out this section.

qualified allocation plan.rest: any plan— which sets forth selection criteria to be used to determine priorities of the commercial revitalization agency which are appropriate to local conditions, which considers— the degree to which a project contributes to the implementation of a strategic plan that is devised for a renewal community through a citizen participation process, the amount of any increase in permanent, full-time employment by reason of any project, and the active involvement of residents and nonprofit groups within the renewal community, and which provides a procedure that the agency (or its agent) will follow in monitoring compliance with this section.
qualified allocation plan.sentence: For purposes of this subsection, the term “qualified allocation plan” means any plan— which sets forth selection criteria to be used to determine priorities of the commercial revitalization agency which are appropriate to local conditions, which considers— the degree to which a project contributes to the implementation of a strategic plan that is devised for a renewal community through a citizen participation process, the amount of any increase in permanent, full-time employment by reason of any project, and the active involvement of residents and nonprofit groups within the renewal community, and which provides a procedure that the agency (or its agent) will follow in monitoring compliance with this section.

qualified revitalization building.rest: any building (and its structural components) if— the building is placed in service by the taxpayer in a renewal community and the original use of the building begins with the taxpayer, or in the case of such building not described in subparagraph (A), such building— is substantially rehabilitated (within the meaning of section 47(c)(1)(C)) by the taxpayer, and is placed in service by the taxpayer after the rehabilitation in a renewal community.
qualified revitalization building.sentence: For purposes of this section— The term “qualified revitalization building” means any building (and its structural components) if— the building is placed in service by the taxpayer in a renewal community and the original use of the building begins with the taxpayer, or in the case of such building not described in subparagraph (A), such building— is substantially rehabilitated (within the meaning of section 47(c)(1)(C)) by the taxpayer, and is placed in service by the taxpayer after the rehabilitation in a renewal community.

qualified revitalization expenditure.rest: any amount properly chargeable to capital account for property for which depreciation is allowable under section 168 (without regard to this section) and which is— nonresidential real property (as defined in section 168(e)), or section 1250 property (as defined in section 1250(c)) which is functionally related and subordinate to property described in clause (i).
qualified revitalization expenditure.sentence: The term “qualified revitalization expenditure” means any amount properly chargeable to capital account for property for which depreciation is allowable under section 168 (without regard to this section) and which is— nonresidential real property (as defined in section 168(e)), or section 1250 property (as defined in section 1250(c)) which is functionally related and subordinate to property described in clause (i).

qualified revitalization expenditure#.rest: any expenditure which the taxpayer may take into account in computing any credit allowable under this title unless the taxpayer elects to take the expenditure into account only for purposes of this section.
qualified revitalization expenditure#.sentence: The term “qualified revitalization expenditure” does not include any expenditure which the taxpayer may take into account in computing any credit allowable under this title unless the taxpayer elects to take the expenditure into account only for purposes of this section.

qualified renewal property.rest: any property to which section 168 applies (or would apply but for section 179) if— such property was acquired by the taxpayer by purchase (as defined in section 179(d)(2)) after December 31, 2001, and before January 1, 2010, and such property would be qualified zone property (as defined in section 1397D) if references to renewal communities were substituted for references to empowerment zones in section 1397D.
qualified renewal property.sentence: For purposes of this section— The term “qualified renewal property” means any property to which section 168 applies (or would apply but for section 179) if— such property was acquired by the taxpayer by purchase (as defined in section 179(d)(2)) after December 31, 2001, and before January 1, 2010, and such property would be qualified zone property (as defined in section 1397D) if references to renewal communities were substituted for references to empowerment zones in section 1397D.

5-year property.rest: any qualified New York Liberty Zone leasehold improvement property.
5-year property.sentence: For purposes of section 168, the term “5-year property” includes any qualified New York Liberty Zone leasehold improvement property.

New York Liberty Zone.rest: the area located on or south of Canal Street, East Broadway (east of its intersection with Canal Street), or Grand Street (east of its intersection with East Broadway) in the Borough of Manhattan in the City of New York, New York.
New York Liberty Zone.sentence: For purposes of this section, the term “New York Liberty Zone” means the area located on or south of Canal Street, East Broadway (east of its intersection with Canal Street), or Grand Street (east of its intersection with East Broadway) in the Borough of Manhattan in the City of New York, New York.

New York Liberty Zone business.rest: any trade or business which is— located in the New York Liberty Zone, or located in the City of New York, New York, outside the New York Liberty Zone, as a result of the physical destruction or damage of such place of business by the September 11, 2001, terrorist attack.
New York Liberty Zone business.sentence: The term “New York Liberty Zone business” means any trade or business which is— located in the New York Liberty Zone, or located in the City of New York, New York, outside the New York Liberty Zone, as a result of the physical destruction or damage of such place of business by the September 11, 2001, terrorist attack.

New York Liberty Zone business employee.rest: , with respect to any period, any employee of a New York Liberty Zone business if substantially all the services performed during such period by such employee for such business are performed in the New York Liberty Zone.
New York Liberty Zone business employee.sentence: For purposes of this subsection— The term “New York Liberty Zone business employee” means, with respect to any period, any employee of a New York Liberty Zone business if substantially all the services performed during such period by such employee for such business are performed in the New York Liberty Zone.

New York Liberty Zone business employee#.rest: any employee of such business (not described in subparagraph (A)) if substantially all the services performed during such period by such employee for such business are performed in the City of New York, New York.
New York Liberty Zone business employee#.sentence: In the case of a New York Liberty Zone business described in subclause (II) of subparagraph (C)(i), the term “New York Liberty Zone business employee” includes any employee of such business (not described in subparagraph (A)) if substantially all the services performed during such period by such employee for such business are performed in the City of New York, New York.

New York Liberty Zone business#.rest: any trade or business for any taxable year if such trade or business employed an average of more than 200 employees on business days during the taxable year.
New York Liberty Zone business#.sentence: The term “New York Liberty Zone business” shall not include any trade or business for any taxable year if such trade or business employed an average of more than 200 employees on business days during the taxable year.

qualified New York Liberty Bond.rest: any bond issued as part of an issue if— 95 percent or more of the net proceeds (as defined in section 150(a)(3)) of such issue are to be used for qualified project costs, such bond is issued by the State of New York or any political subdivision thereof, the Governor or the Mayor designates such bond for purposes of this section, and such bond is issued after the date of the enactment of this section and before January 1, 2014.
qualified New York Liberty Bond.sentence: For purposes of this subsection, the term “qualified New York Liberty Bond” means any bond issued as part of an issue if— 95 percent or more of the net proceeds (as defined in section 150(a)(3)) of such issue are to be used for qualified project costs, such bond is issued by the State of New York or any political subdivision thereof, the Governor or the Mayor designates such bond for purposes of this section, and such bond is issued after the date of the enactment of this section and before January 1, 2014.

qualified New York Liberty Zone leasehol.rest: qualified leasehold improvement property (as defined in section 168(k)(3) 1) if— such building is located in the New York Liberty Zone, such improvement is placed in service after September 10, 2001, and before January 1, 2007, and no written binding contract for such improvement was in effect before September 11, 2001.
qualified New York Liberty Zone leasehol.sentence: For purposes of this section, the term “qualified New York Liberty Zone leasehold improvement property” means qualified leasehold improvement property (as defined in section 168(k)(3) 1) if— such building is located in the New York Liberty Zone, such improvement is placed in service after September 10, 2001, and before January 1, 2007, and no written binding contract for such improvement was in effect before September 11, 2001.

qualified New York Liberty Zone property.rest: property— which is described in section 168(k)(2)(A)(i), or which is nonresidential real property, or residential rental property, which is described in subparagraph (B), substantially all of the use of which is in the New York Liberty Zone and is in the active conduct of a trade or business by the taxpayer in such Zone, the original use of which in the New York Liberty Zone commences with the taxpayer after September 10, 2001, which is acquired by the taxpayer by purchase (as defined in section 179(d)) after September 10, 2001, but only if no written binding contract for the acquisition was in effect before September 11, 2001, and which is placed in service by the taxpayer on or before the termination date.
qualified New York Liberty Zone property.sentence: For purposes of this subsection— The term “qualified New York Liberty Zone property” means property— which is described in section 168(k)(2)(A)(i), or which is nonresidential real property, or residential rental property, which is described in subparagraph (B), substantially all of the use of which is in the New York Liberty Zone and is in the active conduct of a trade or business by the taxpayer in such Zone, the original use of which in the New York Liberty Zone commences with the taxpayer after September 10, 2001, which is acquired by the taxpayer by purchase (as defined in section 179(d)) after September 10, 2001, but only if no written binding contract for the acquisition was in effect before September 11, 2001, and which is placed in service by the taxpayer on or before the termination date.

qualified New York Liberty Zone property.rest: any property described in section 168(k)(2)(D)(i).11 See References in Text note below.
qualified New York Liberty Zone property.sentence: The term “qualified New York Liberty Zone property” shall not include any property described in section 168(k)(2)(D)(i).11 See References in Text note below.

qualified New York Liberty Zone property.rest: given such term by subsection (b)(2), determined without regard to subparagraph (C)(i) thereof.
qualified New York Liberty Zone property.sentence: For purposes of this subsection, the term “qualified New York Liberty Zone property” has the meaning given such term by subsection (b)(2), determined without regard to subparagraph (C)(i) thereof.

qualified project costs.rest: the cost of acquisition, construction, reconstruction, and renovation of— nonresidential real property and residential rental property (including fixed tenant improvements associated with such property) located in the New York Liberty Zone, and public utility property (as defined in section 168(i)(10)) located in the New York Liberty Zone.
qualified project costs.sentence: For purposes of this subsection— The term “qualified project costs” means the cost of acquisition, construction, reconstruction, and renovation of— nonresidential real property and residential rental property (including fixed tenant improvements associated with such property) located in the New York Liberty Zone, and public utility property (as defined in section 168(i)(10)) located in the New York Liberty Zone.

qualified wages.rest: wages paid or incurred by the employer to individuals who are New York Liberty Zone business employees of such employer for work performed during calendar year 2002 or 2003.
qualified wages.sentence: For purposes of applying subpart F of part IV of subchapter A of this chapter to wages paid or incurred to any New York Liberty Zone business employee— section 51(a) shall be applied by substituting “qualified wages” for “qualified first-year wages”, the rules of section 52 shall apply for purposes of determining the number of employees under this paragraph, subsections (c)(4) and (i)(2) of section 51 shall not apply, and in determining qualified wages, the following shall apply in lieu of section 51(b): The term “qualified wages” means wages paid or incurred by the employer to individuals who are New York Liberty Zone business employees of such employer for work performed during calendar year 2002 or 2003.

termination date.rest: December 31, 2006 (December 31, 2009, in the case of nonresidential real property and residential rental property).
termination date.sentence: The term “termination date” means December 31, 2006 (December 31, 2009, in the case of nonresidential real property and residential rental property).

Hurricane Katrina disaster area.rest: an area with respect to which a major disaster has been declared by the President before September 14, 2005, under section 401 of such Act by reason of Hurricane Katrina.
Hurricane Katrina disaster area.sentence: The term “Hurricane Katrina disaster area” means an area with respect to which a major disaster has been declared by the President before September 14, 2005, under section 401 of such Act by reason of Hurricane Katrina.

Hurricane Rita disaster area.rest: an area with respect to which a major disaster has been declared by the President before October 6, 2005, under section 401 of such Act by reason of Hurricane Rita.
Hurricane Rita disaster area.sentence: The term “Hurricane Rita disaster area” means an area with respect to which a major disaster has been declared by the President before October 6, 2005, under section 401 of such Act by reason of Hurricane Rita.

Hurricane Wilma disaster area.rest: an area with respect to which a major disaster has been declared by the President before November 14, 2005, under section 401 of such Act by reason of Hurricane Wilma.
Hurricane Wilma disaster area.sentence: The term “Hurricane Wilma disaster area” means an area with respect to which a major disaster has been declared by the President before November 14, 2005, under section 401 of such Act by reason of Hurricane Wilma.

Rita GO Zone.rest: that portion of the Hurricane Rita disaster area determined by the President to warrant individual or individual and public assistance from the Federal Government under such Act by reason of Hurricane Rita.
Rita GO Zone.sentence: The term “Rita GO Zone” means that portion of the Hurricane Rita disaster area determined by the President to warrant individual or individual and public assistance from the Federal Government under such Act by reason of Hurricane Rita.

Wilma GO Zone.rest: that portion of the Hurricane Wilma disaster area determined by the President to warrant individual or individual and public assistance from the Federal Government under such Act by reason of Hurricane Wilma.
Wilma GO Zone.sentence: The term “Wilma GO Zone” means that portion of the Hurricane Wilma disaster area determined by the President to warrant individual or individual and public assistance from the Federal Government under such Act by reason of Hurricane Wilma.

Gulf Opportunity Zone public utility cas.rest: any casualty loss of public utility property (as defined in section 168(i)(10)) located in the Gulf Opportunity Zone if— such loss is allowed as a deduction under section 165 for the taxable year, such loss is by reason of Hurricane Katrina, and the taxpayer elects the application of this subsection with respect to such loss.
Gulf Opportunity Zone public utility cas.sentence: For purposes of this subsection, the term “Gulf Opportunity Zone public utility casualty loss” means any casualty loss of public utility property (as defined in section 168(i)(10)) located in the Gulf Opportunity Zone if— such loss is allowed as a deduction under section 165 for the taxable year, such loss is by reason of Hurricane Katrina, and the taxpayer elects the application of this subsection with respect to such loss.

Gulf Opportunity housing amount.rest: , for any calendar year, the amount equal to the product of $18.00 multiplied by the portion of the State population which is in the Gulf Opportunity Zone (as determined on the basis of the most recent census estimate of resident population released by the Bureau of Census before August 28, 2005).
Gulf Opportunity housing amount.sentence: For purposes of subparagraph (A), the term “Gulf Opportunity housing amount” means, for any calendar year, the amount equal to the product of $18.00 multiplied by the portion of the State population which is in the Gulf Opportunity Zone (as determined on the basis of the most recent census estimate of resident population released by the Bureau of Census before August 28, 2005).

Gulf tax credit bond.rest: any bond issued as part of an issue if— the bond is issued by the State of Alabama, Louisiana, or Mississippi, 95 percent or more of the proceeds of such issue are to be used to— pay principal, interest, or premiums on qualified bonds issued by such State or any political subdivision of such State, or make a loan to any political subdivision of such State to pay principal, interest, or premiums on qualified bonds issued by such political subdivision, the Governor of such State designates such bond for purposes of this subsection, the bond is a general obligation of such State and is in registered form (within the meaning of section 149(a)), the maturity of such bond does not exceed 2 years, and the bond is issued after December 31, 2005, and before January 1, 2007.
Gulf tax credit bond.sentence: For purposes of this subsection— The term “Gulf tax credit bond” means any bond issued as part of an issue if— the bond is issued by the State of Alabama, Louisiana, or Mississippi, 95 percent or more of the proceeds of such issue are to be used to— pay principal, interest, or premiums on qualified bonds issued by such State or any political subdivision of such State, or make a loan to any political subdivision of such State to pay principal, interest, or premiums on qualified bonds issued by such political subdivision, the Governor of such State designates such bond for purposes of this subsection, the bond is a general obligation of such State and is in registered form (within the meaning of section 149(a)), the maturity of such bond does not exceed 2 years, and the bond is issued after December 31, 2005, and before January 1, 2007.

bond.sentence: For purposes of this subsection— The term “bond” includes any obligation.

credit allowance date.sentence: For purposes of this subsection, the term “credit allowance date” means March 15, June 15, September 15, and December 15.

eligible public utility property loss.rest: any loss with respect to public utility property located in the Gulf Opportunity Zone and attributable to Hurricane Katrina.
eligible public utility property loss.sentence: For purposes of this subsection— The term “eligible public utility property loss” means any loss with respect to public utility property located in the Gulf Opportunity Zone and attributable to Hurricane Katrina.

gambling or animal racing property.rest: — any equipment, furniture, software, or other property used directly in connection with gambling, the racing of animals, or the on-site viewing of such racing, and the portion of any real property (determined by square footage) which is dedicated to gambling, the racing of animals, or the on-site viewing of such racing.
gambling or animal racing property.sentence: For purposes of subparagraph (A)(ii)— The term “gambling or animal racing property” means— any equipment, furniture, software, or other property used directly in connection with gambling, the racing of animals, or the on-site viewing of such racing, and the portion of any real property (determined by square footage) which is dedicated to gambling, the racing of animals, or the on-site viewing of such racing.

moving expenses.rest: given such term by section 217(b), except that the taxpayer’s former residence and new residence may be the same residence if the initial vacating of the residence was as the result of Hurricane Katrina.
moving expenses.sentence: For purposes of this clause, the term “moving expenses” has the meaning given such term by section 217(b), except that the taxpayer’s former residence and new residence may be the same residence if the initial vacating of the residence was as the result of Hurricane Katrina.

public utility property.rest: given such term by section 168(i)(10) without regard to the matter following subparagraph (D) thereof.
public utility property.sentence: The term “public utility property” has the meaning given such term by section 168(i)(10) without regard to the matter following subparagraph (D) thereof.

qualified GO Zone repair or reconstructi.rest: any repair of damage caused by Hurricane Katrina, Hurricane Rita, or Hurricane Wilma to a building located in the Gulf Opportunity Zone, the Rita GO Zone, or the Wilma GO Zone (or reconstruction of such building in the case of damage constituting destruction) if the expenditures for such repair or reconstruction are 25 percent or more of the mortgagor’s adjusted basis in the residence.
qualified GO Zone repair or reconstructi.sentence: For purposes of subparagraph (A), the term “qualified GO Zone repair or reconstruction” means any repair of damage caused by Hurricane Katrina, Hurricane Rita, or Hurricane Wilma to a building located in the Gulf Opportunity Zone, the Rita GO Zone, or the Wilma GO Zone (or reconstruction of such building in the case of damage constituting destruction) if the expenditures for such repair or reconstruction are 25 percent or more of the mortgagor’s adjusted basis in the residence.

qualified Gulf Opportunity Zone Bond.rest: any bond issued as part of an issue if— 95 percent or more of the net proceeds (as defined in section 150(a)(3)) of such issue are to be used for qualified project costs, or such issue meets the requirements of a qualified mortgage issue, except as otherwise provided in this subsection, such bond is issued by the State of Alabama, Louisiana, or Mississippi, or any political subdivision thereof, such bond is designated for purposes of this section by— in the case of a bond which is required under State law to be approved by the bond commission of such State, such bond commission, and in the case of any other bond, the Governor of such State, such bond is issued after the date of the enactment of this section and before January 1, 2012, and no portion of the proceeds of such issue is to be used to provide any property described in section 144(c)(6)(B).
qualified Gulf Opportunity Zone Bond.sentence: For purposes of this subsection, the term “qualified Gulf Opportunity Zone Bond” means any bond issued as part of an issue if— 95 percent or more of the net proceeds (as defined in section 150(a)(3)) of such issue are to be used for qualified project costs, or such issue meets the requirements of a qualified mortgage issue, except as otherwise provided in this subsection, such bond is issued by the State of Alabama, Louisiana, or Mississippi, or any political subdivision thereof, such bond is designated for purposes of this section by— in the case of a bond which is required under State law to be approved by the bond commission of such State, such bond commission, and in the case of any other bond, the Governor of such State, such bond is issued after the date of the enactment of this section and before January 1, 2012, and no portion of the proceeds of such issue is to be used to provide any property described in section 144(c)(6)(B).

qualified Gulf Opportunity Zone casualty.rest: any uncompensated section 1231 loss (as defined in section 1231(a)(3)(B)) of property located in the Gulf Opportunity Zone if— such loss is allowed as a deduction under section 165 for the taxable year, and such loss is by reason of Hurricane Katrina.
qualified Gulf Opportunity Zone casualty.sentence: For purposes of paragraph (2)(B)(i), the term “qualified Gulf Opportunity Zone casualty loss” means any uncompensated section 1231 loss (as defined in section 1231(a)(3)(B)) of property located in the Gulf Opportunity Zone if— such loss is allowed as a deduction under section 165 for the taxable year, and such loss is by reason of Hurricane Katrina.

qualified Gulf Opportunity Zone casualty.rest: any loss with respect to any property described in paragraph (3).
qualified Gulf Opportunity Zone casualty.sentence: For purposes of subsection (k)(2)(B)(i), the term “qualified Gulf Opportunity Zone casualty loss” shall not include any loss with respect to any property described in paragraph (3).

qualified Gulf Opportunity Zone clean-up.rest: any amount paid or incurred during the period beginning on August 28, 2005, and ending on December 31, 2007, for the removal of debris from, or the demolition of structures on, real property which is located in the Gulf Opportunity Zone and which is— held by the taxpayer for use in a trade or business or for the production of income, or property described in section 1221(a)(1) in the hands of the taxpayer.
qualified Gulf Opportunity Zone clean-up.sentence: For purposes of this subsection, the term “qualified Gulf Opportunity Zone clean-up cost” means any amount paid or incurred during the period beginning on August 28, 2005, and ending on December 31, 2007, for the removal of debris from, or the demolition of structures on, real property which is located in the Gulf Opportunity Zone and which is— held by the taxpayer for use in a trade or business or for the production of income, or property described in section 1221(a)(1) in the hands of the taxpayer.

qualified Gulf Opportunity Zone loss.rest: the lesser of— the excess of— the net operating loss for such taxable year, over the specified liability loss for such taxable year to which a 10-year carryback applies under section 172(b)(1)(C), or the aggregate amount of the following deductions to the extent taken into account in computing the net operating loss for such taxable year: Any deduction for any qualified Gulf Opportunity Zone casualty loss.
qualified Gulf Opportunity Zone loss.sentence: For purposes of paragraph (1), the term “qualified Gulf Opportunity Zone loss” means the lesser of— the excess of— the net operating loss for such taxable year, over the specified liability loss for such taxable year to which a 10-year carryback applies under section 172(b)(1)(C), or the aggregate amount of the following deductions to the extent taken into account in computing the net operating loss for such taxable year: Any deduction for any qualified Gulf Opportunity Zone casualty loss.

qualified Gulf Opportunity Zone property.rest: property— which is described in section 168(k)(2)(A)(i), or which is nonresidential real property or residential rental property, substantially all of the use of which is in the Gulf Opportunity Zone and is in the active conduct of a trade or business by the taxpayer in such Zone, the original use of which in the Gulf Opportunity Zone commences with the taxpayer on or after August 28, 2005, which is acquired by the taxpayer by purchase (as defined in section 179(d)) on or after August 28, 2005, but only if no written binding contract for the acquisition was in effect before August 28, 2005, and which is placed in service by the taxpayer on or before December 31, 2007 (December 31, 2008, in the case of nonresidential real property and residential rental property).
qualified Gulf Opportunity Zone property.sentence: For purposes of this subsection— The term “qualified Gulf Opportunity Zone property” means property— which is described in section 168(k)(2)(A)(i), or which is nonresidential real property or residential rental property, substantially all of the use of which is in the Gulf Opportunity Zone and is in the active conduct of a trade or business by the taxpayer in such Zone, the original use of which in the Gulf Opportunity Zone commences with the taxpayer on or after August 28, 2005, which is acquired by the taxpayer by purchase (as defined in section 179(d)) on or after August 28, 2005, but only if no written binding contract for the acquisition was in effect before August 28, 2005, and which is placed in service by the taxpayer on or before December 31, 2007 (December 31, 2008, in the case of nonresidential real property and residential rental property).
For purposes of subsections (d), (e), and (k)(2)(B)(iv), the term “qualified Gulf Opportunity Zone property” shall not include any property described in paragraph (3).

qualified bond.rest: any obligation of a State or political subdivision thereof which was outstanding on August 28, 2005.
qualified bond.sentence: For purposes of this subsection— The term “qualified bond” means any obligation of a State or political subdivision thereof which was outstanding on August 28, 2005.

qualified project costs.rest: — the cost of any qualified residential rental project (as defined in section 142(d)) located in the Gulf Opportunity Zone, and the cost of acquisition, construction, reconstruction, and renovation of— nonresidential real property (including fixed improvements associated with such property) located in the Gulf Opportunity Zone, and public utility property (as defined in section 168(i)(10)) located in the Gulf Opportunity Zone.
qualified project costs.sentence: For purposes of this subsection, the term “qualified project costs” means— the cost of any qualified residential rental project (as defined in section 142(d)) located in the Gulf Opportunity Zone, and the cost of acquisition, construction, reconstruction, and renovation of— nonresidential real property (including fixed improvements associated with such property) located in the Gulf Opportunity Zone, and public utility property (as defined in section 168(i)(10)) located in the Gulf Opportunity Zone.

qualified section 179 Gulf Opportunity Z.rest: section 179 property (as defined in section 179(d)) which is qualified Gulf Opportunity Zone property (as defined in subsection (d)(2) without regard to subsection (d)(6)).
qualified section 179 Gulf Opportunity Z.sentence: For purposes of this subsection— The term “qualified section 179 Gulf Opportunity Zone property” means section 179 property (as defined in section 179(d)) which is qualified Gulf Opportunity Zone property (as defined in subsection (d)(2) without regard to subsection (d)(6)).

qualified timber property.sentence: The term “qualified timber property” has the meaning given such term in section 194(c)(1).

specified Gulf Opportunity Zone extensio.rest: property— substantially all of the use of which is in one or more specified portions of the GO Zone, and which is— nonresidential real property or residential rental property which is placed in service by the taxpayer on or before December 31, 2011, or in the case of a taxpayer who places a building described in subclause (I) in service on or before December 31, 2011, property described in section 168(k)(2)(A)(i) if substantially all of the use of such property is in such building and such property is placed in service by the taxpayer not later than 90 days after such building is placed in service.
specified Gulf Opportunity Zone extensio.sentence: For purposes of this paragraph, the term “specified Gulf Opportunity Zone extension property” means property— substantially all of the use of which is in one or more specified portions of the GO Zone, and which is— nonresidential real property or residential rental property which is placed in service by the taxpayer on or before December 31, 2011, or in the case of a taxpayer who places a building described in subclause (I) in service on or before December 31, 2011, property described in section 168(k)(2)(A)(i) if substantially all of the use of such property is in such building and such property is placed in service by the taxpayer not later than 90 days after such building is placed in service.

specified Gulf Opportunity Zone extensio.rest: any property to which section 168(k) applies.
specified Gulf Opportunity Zone extensio.sentence: The term “specified Gulf Opportunity Zone extension property” shall not include any property to which section 168(k) applies.

specified portion.rest: — in the case of qualified timber property any portion of which is located in the Gulf Opportunity Zone, that portion of the taxable year which is on or after August 28, 2005, and before the termination date, in the case of qualified timber property (other than property described in clause (i)) any portion of which is located in the Rita GO Zone, that portion of the taxable year which is on or after September 23, 2005, and before the termination date, or in the case of qualified timber property (other than property described in clause (i) or (ii)) any portion of which is located in the Wilma GO Zone, that portion of the taxable year which is on or after October 23, 2005, and before the termination date.
specified portion.sentence: For purposes of this subsection— The term “specified portion” means— in the case of qualified timber property any portion of which is located in the Gulf Opportunity Zone, that portion of the taxable year which is on or after August 28, 2005, and before the termination date, in the case of qualified timber property (other than property described in clause (i)) any portion of which is located in the Rita GO Zone, that portion of the taxable year which is on or after September 23, 2005, and before the termination date, or in the case of qualified timber property (other than property described in clause (i) or (ii)) any portion of which is located in the Wilma GO Zone, that portion of the taxable year which is on or after October 23, 2005, and before the termination date.

specified portions of the GO Zone.rest: those portions of the GO Zone which are in any county or parish which is identified by the Secretary as being a county or parish in which hurricanes occurring during 2005 damaged (in the aggregate) more than 60 percent of the housing units in such county or parish which were occupied (determined according to the 2000 Census).
specified portions of the GO Zone.sentence: For purposes of this paragraph, the term “specified portions of the GO Zone” means those portions of the GO Zone which are in any county or parish which is identified by the Secretary as being a county or parish in which hurricanes occurring during 2005 damaged (in the aggregate) more than 60 percent of the housing units in such county or parish which were occupied (determined according to the 2000 Census).

termination date.rest: — for purposes of paragraph (1), January 1, 2008, and for purposes of paragraph (2), January 1, 2007.
termination date.sentence: The term “termination date” means— for purposes of paragraph (1), January 1, 2008, and for purposes of paragraph (2), January 1, 2007.

qualified tuition and related expenses.rest: any costs which are qualified higher education expenses (as defined in section 529(e)(3)), each of the dollar amounts in effect under subparagraphs (A) and (B) of section 25A(b)(1) shall be twice the amount otherwise in effect before the application of this subsection, and section 25A(c)(1) shall be applied by substituting “40 percent” for “20 percent”.
qualified tuition and related expenses.sentence: In the case of an individual who attends an eligible educational institution (as defined in section 25A(f)(2)) located in the Gulf Opportunity Zone for any taxable year beginning during 2005 or 2006— in applying section 25A, the term “qualified tuition and related expenses” shall include any costs which are qualified higher education expenses (as defined in section 529(e)(3)), each of the dollar amounts in effect under subparagraphs (A) and (B) of section 25A(b)(1) shall be twice the amount otherwise in effect before the application of this subsection, and section 25A(c)(1) shall be applied by substituting “40 percent” for “20 percent”.

qualified employee.rest: , with respect to any month, an individual— who had a principal residence (as defined in section 121) in the Gulf Opportunity Zone on August 28, 2005, and who performs substantially all employment services— in the Gulf Opportunity Zone, and for the qualified employer which furnishes lodging to such individual.
qualified employee.sentence: For purposes of this section, the term “qualified employee” means, with respect to any month, an individual— who had a principal residence (as defined in section 121) in the Gulf Opportunity Zone on August 28, 2005, and who performs substantially all employment services— in the Gulf Opportunity Zone, and for the qualified employer which furnishes lodging to such individual.

qualified employer.rest: any employer with a trade or business located in the Gulf Opportunity Zone.
qualified employer.sentence: For purposes of this section, the term “qualified employer” means any employer with a trade or business located in the Gulf Opportunity Zone.

applicable period.rest: — with respect to any qualified Katrina distribution, the period beginning on August 25, 2005, and ending on February 28, 2006, with respect to any qualified Rita distribution, the period beginning on September 23, 2005, and ending on February 28, 2006, and with respect to any qualified Wilma distribution, the period beginning on October 23, 2005, and ending on February 28, 2006.
applicable period.sentence: For purposes of this subsection, the term “applicable period” means— with respect to any qualified Katrina distribution, the period beginning on August 25, 2005, and ending on February 28, 2006, with respect to any qualified Rita distribution, the period beginning on September 23, 2005, and ending on February 28, 2006, and with respect to any qualified Wilma distribution, the period beginning on October 23, 2005, and ending on February 28, 2006.

controlled group.rest: any group treated as a single employer under subsection (b), (c), (m), or (o) of section 414.
controlled group.sentence: For purposes of subparagraph (B), the term “controlled group” means any group treated as a single employer under subsection (b), (c), (m), or (o) of section 414.

qualified Hurricane Katrina individual.rest: an individual whose principal place of abode on August 28, 2005, is located in the Hurricane Katrina disaster area and who has sustained an economic loss by reason of Hurricane Katrina.
qualified Hurricane Katrina individual.sentence: The term “qualified Hurricane Katrina individual” means an individual whose principal place of abode on August 28, 2005, is located in the Hurricane Katrina disaster area and who has sustained an economic loss by reason of Hurricane Katrina.

qualified Hurricane Rita individual.rest: an individual (other than a qualified Hurricane Katrina individual) whose principal place of abode on September 23, 2005, is located in the Hurricane Rita disaster area and who has sustained an economic loss by reason of Hurricane Rita.
qualified Hurricane Rita individual.sentence: The term “qualified Hurricane Rita individual” means an individual (other than a qualified Hurricane Katrina individual) whose principal place of abode on September 23, 2005, is located in the Hurricane Rita disaster area and who has sustained an economic loss by reason of Hurricane Rita.

qualified Hurricane Wilma individual.rest: an individual (other than a qualified Hurricane Katrina individual or a qualified Hurricane Rita individual) whose principal place of abode on October 23, 2005, is located in the Hurricane Wilma disaster area and who has sustained an economic loss by reason of Hurricane Wilma.
qualified Hurricane Wilma individual.sentence: The term “qualified Hurricane Wilma individual” means an individual (other than a qualified Hurricane Katrina individual or a qualified Hurricane Rita individual) whose principal place of abode on October 23, 2005, is located in the Hurricane Wilma disaster area and who has sustained an economic loss by reason of Hurricane Wilma.

qualified Katrina distribution.rest: any distribution— described in section 401(k)(2)(B)(i)(IV), 403(b)(7)(A)(ii) (but only to the extent such distribution relates to financial hardship), 403(b)(11)(B), or 72(t)(2)(F), received after February 28, 2005, and before August 29, 2005, and which was to be used to purchase or construct a principal residence in the Hurricane Katrina disaster area, but which was not so purchased or constructed on account of Hurricane Katrina.
qualified Katrina distribution.sentence: The term “qualified Katrina distribution” means any distribution— described in section 401(k)(2)(B)(i)(IV), 403(b)(7)(A)(ii) (but only to the extent such distribution relates to financial hardship), 403(b)(11)(B), or 72(t)(2)(F), received after February 28, 2005, and before August 29, 2005, and which was to be used to purchase or construct a principal residence in the Hurricane Katrina disaster area, but which was not so purchased or constructed on account of Hurricane Katrina.

qualified Rita distribution.rest: any distribution (other than a qualified Katrina distribution)— described in section 401(k)(2)(B)(i)(IV), 403(b)(7)(A)(ii) (but only to the extent such distribution relates to financial hardship), 403(b)(11)(B), or 72(t)(2)(F), received after February 28, 2005, and before September 24, 2005, and which was to be used to purchase or construct a principal residence in the Hurricane Rita disaster area, but which was not so purchased or constructed on account of Hurricane Rita.
qualified Rita distribution.sentence: The term “qualified Rita distribution” means any distribution (other than a qualified Katrina distribution)— described in section 401(k)(2)(B)(i)(IV), 403(b)(7)(A)(ii) (but only to the extent such distribution relates to financial hardship), 403(b)(11)(B), or 72(t)(2)(F), received after February 28, 2005, and before September 24, 2005, and which was to be used to purchase or construct a principal residence in the Hurricane Rita disaster area, but which was not so purchased or constructed on account of Hurricane Rita.

qualified Wilma distribution.rest: any distribution (other than a qualified Katrina distribution or a qualified Rita distribution)— described in section 401(k)(2)(B)(i)(IV), 403(b)(7)(A)(ii) (but only to the extent such distribution relates to financial hardship), 403(b)(11)(B), or 72(t)(2)(F), received after February 28, 2005, and before October 24, 2005, and which was to be used to purchase or construct a principal residence in the Hurricane Wilma disaster area, but which was not so purchased or constructed on account of Hurricane Wilma.
qualified Wilma distribution.sentence: The term “qualified Wilma distribution” means any distribution (other than a qualified Katrina distribution or a qualified Rita distribution)— described in section 401(k)(2)(B)(i)(IV), 403(b)(7)(A)(ii) (but only to the extent such distribution relates to financial hardship), 403(b)(11)(B), or 72(t)(2)(F), received after February 28, 2005, and before October 24, 2005, and which was to be used to purchase or construct a principal residence in the Hurricane Wilma disaster area, but which was not so purchased or constructed on account of Hurricane Wilma.

qualified distribution.rest: any qualified Katrina distribution, any qualified Rita distribution, and any qualified Wilma distribution.
qualified distribution.sentence: For purposes of this subsection— The term “qualified distribution” means any qualified Katrina distribution, any qualified Rita distribution, and any qualified Wilma distribution.

qualified hurricane distribution.rest: — any distribution from an eligible retirement plan made on or after August 25, 2005, and before January 1, 2007, to an individual whose principal place of abode on August 28, 2005, is located in the Hurricane Katrina disaster area and who has sustained an economic loss by reason of Hurricane Katrina, any distribution (which is not described in clause (i)) from an eligible retirement plan made on or after September 23, 2005, and before January 1, 2007, to an individual whose principal place of abode on September 23, 2005, is located in the Hurricane Rita disaster area and who has sustained an economic loss by reason of Hurricane Rita, and any distribution (which is not described in clause (i) or (ii)) from an eligible retirement plan made on or after October 23, 2005, and before January 1, 2007, to an individual whose principal place of abode on October 23, 2005, is located in the Hurricane Wilma disaster area and who has sustained an economic loss by reason of Hurricane Wilma.
qualified hurricane distribution.sentence: For purposes of this subsection— Except as provided in paragraph (2), the term “qualified hurricane distribution” means— any distribution from an eligible retirement plan made on or after August 25, 2005, and before January 1, 2007, to an individual whose principal place of abode on August 28, 2005, is located in the Hurricane Katrina disaster area and who has sustained an economic loss by reason of Hurricane Katrina, any distribution (which is not described in clause (i)) from an eligible retirement plan made on or after September 23, 2005, and before January 1, 2007, to an individual whose principal place of abode on September 23, 2005, is located in the Hurricane Rita disaster area and who has sustained an economic loss by reason of Hurricane Rita, and any distribution (which is not described in clause (i) or (ii)) from an eligible retirement plan made on or after October 23, 2005, and before January 1, 2007, to an individual whose principal place of abode on October 23, 2005, is located in the Hurricane Wilma disaster area and who has sustained an economic loss by reason of Hurricane Wilma.

qualified individual.rest: any qualified Hurricane Katrina individual, any qualified Hurricane Rita individual, and any qualified Hurricane Wilma individual.
qualified individual.sentence: For purposes of this subsection— The term “qualified individual” means any qualified Hurricane Katrina individual, any qualified Hurricane Rita individual, and any qualified Hurricane Wilma individual.

eligible employee.rest: with respect to an eligible employer an employee whose principal place of employment on August 28, 2005, with such eligible employer was in the GO Zone.
eligible employee.sentence: The term “eligible employee” means with respect to an eligible employer an employee whose principal place of employment on August 28, 2005, with such eligible employer was in the GO Zone.

eligible employee#.rest: with respect to an eligible employer an employee whose principal place of employment on September 23, 2005, with such eligible employer was in the Rita GO Zone.
eligible employee#.sentence: The term “eligible employee” means with respect to an eligible employer an employee whose principal place of employment on September 23, 2005, with such eligible employer was in the Rita GO Zone.

eligible employee##.rest: with respect to an eligible employer an employee whose principal place of employment on October 23, 2005, with such eligible employer was in the Wilma GO Zone.
eligible employee##.sentence: The term “eligible employee” means with respect to an eligible employer an employee whose principal place of employment on October 23, 2005, with such eligible employer was in the Wilma GO Zone.

eligible employer.rest: any employer— which conducted an active trade or business on August 28, 2005, in the GO Zone, and with respect to whom the trade or business described in clause (i) is inoperable on any day after August 28, 2005, and before January 1, 2006, as a result of damage sustained by reason of Hurricane Katrina.
eligible employer.sentence: For purposes of this subsection— The term “eligible employer” means any employer— which conducted an active trade or business on August 28, 2005, in the GO Zone, and with respect to whom the trade or business described in clause (i) is inoperable on any day after August 28, 2005, and before January 1, 2006, as a result of damage sustained by reason of Hurricane Katrina.

eligible employer#.rest: any employer— which conducted an active trade or business on September 23, 2005, in the Rita GO Zone, and with respect to whom the trade or business described in clause (i) is inoperable on any day after September 23, 2005, and before January 1, 2006, as a result of damage sustained by reason of Hurricane Rita.
eligible employer#.sentence: For purposes of this subsection— The term “eligible employer” means any employer— which conducted an active trade or business on September 23, 2005, in the Rita GO Zone, and with respect to whom the trade or business described in clause (i) is inoperable on any day after September 23, 2005, and before January 1, 2006, as a result of damage sustained by reason of Hurricane Rita.

eligible employer##.rest: any employer— which conducted an active trade or business on October 23, 2005, in the Wilma GO Zone, and with respect to whom the trade or business described in clause (i) is inoperable on any day after October 23, 2005, and before January 1, 2006, as a result of damage sustained by reason of Hurricane Wilma.
eligible employer##.sentence: For purposes of this subsection— The term “eligible employer” means any employer— which conducted an active trade or business on October 23, 2005, in the Wilma GO Zone, and with respect to whom the trade or business described in clause (i) is inoperable on any day after October 23, 2005, and before January 1, 2006, as a result of damage sustained by reason of Hurricane Wilma.

qualified wages.rest: wages (as defined in section 51(c)(1), but without regard to section 3306(b)(2)(B)) paid or incurred by an eligible employer with respect to an eligible employee on any day after August 28, 2005, and before January 1, 2006, which occurs during the period— beginning on the date on which the trade or business described in subparagraph (A) first became inoperable at the principal place of employment of the employee immediately before Hurricane Katrina, and ending on the date on which such trade or business has resumed significant operations at such principal place of employment.
qualified wages.sentence: The term “qualified wages” means wages (as defined in section 51(c)(1), but without regard to section 3306(b)(2)(B)) paid or incurred by an eligible employer with respect to an eligible employee on any day after August 28, 2005, and before January 1, 2006, which occurs during the period— beginning on the date on which the trade or business described in subparagraph (A) first became inoperable at the principal place of employment of the employee immediately before Hurricane Katrina, and ending on the date on which such trade or business has resumed significant operations at such principal place of employment.

qualified wages#.rest: wages (as defined in section 51(c)(1), but without regard to section 3306(b)(2)(B)) paid or incurred by an eligible employer with respect to an eligible employee on any day after September 23, 2005, and before January 1, 2006, which occurs during the period— beginning on the date on which the trade or business described in subparagraph (A) first became inoperable at the principal place of employment of the employee immediately before Hurricane Rita, and ending on the date on which such trade or business has resumed significant operations at such principal place of employment.
qualified wages#.sentence: The term “qualified wages” means wages (as defined in section 51(c)(1), but without regard to section 3306(b)(2)(B)) paid or incurred by an eligible employer with respect to an eligible employee on any day after September 23, 2005, and before January 1, 2006, which occurs during the period— beginning on the date on which the trade or business described in subparagraph (A) first became inoperable at the principal place of employment of the employee immediately before Hurricane Rita, and ending on the date on which such trade or business has resumed significant operations at such principal place of employment.
