employee.rest: an individual who is an employee within the meaning of section 401(c)(1), and the employer of such individual is the person treated as his employer under section 401(c)(4); the term “earned income” has the meaning assigned to it by section 401(c)(2); the contributions to such plan on behalf of an individual who is an employee within the meaning of section 401(c)(1) shall be considered to satisfy the conditions of section 162 or 212 to the extent that such contributions do not exceed the earned income of such individual (determined without regard to the deductions allowed by this section) derived from the trade or business with respect to which such plan is established, and to the extent that such contributions are not allocable (determined in accordance with regulations prescribed by the Secretary) to the purchase of life, accident, health, or other insurance; and any reference to compensation shall, in the case of an individual who is an employee within the meaning of section 401(c)(1), be considered to be a reference to the earned income of such individual derived from the trade or business with respect to which the plan is established.
employee.sentence: In the case of a plan included in paragraph (1), (2), or (3) which provides contributions or benefits for employees some or all of whom are employees within the meaning of section 401(c)(1), for purposes of this section— the term “employee” includes an individual who is an employee within the meaning of section 401(c)(1), and the employer of such individual is the person treated as his employer under section 401(c)(4); the term “earned income” has the meaning assigned to it by section 401(c)(2); the contributions to such plan on behalf of an individual who is an employee within the meaning of section 401(c)(1) shall be considered to satisfy the conditions of section 162 or 212 to the extent that such contributions do not exceed the earned income of such individual (determined without regard to the deductions allowed by this section) derived from the trade or business with respect to which such plan is established, and to the extent that such contributions are not allocable (determined in accordance with regulations prescribed by the Secretary) to the purchase of life, accident, health, or other insurance; and any reference to compensation shall, in the case of an individual who is an employee within the meaning of section 401(c)(1), be considered to be a reference to the earned income of such individual derived from the trade or business with respect to which the plan is established.

employee stock ownership plan.sentence: The term “employee stock ownership plan” has the meaning given such term by section 4975(e)(7).

employer securities.sentence: For purposes of this subsection— The term “employer securities” has the meaning given such term by section 409(l).

stock bonus or profit-sharing trust.rest: any trust designed to provide benefits upon retirement and covering a period of years, if under the plan the amounts to be contributed by the employer can be determined actuarially as provided in paragraph (1).
stock bonus or profit-sharing trust.sentence: For purposes of this subparagraph, the term “stock bonus or profit-sharing trust” shall not include any trust designed to provide benefits upon retirement and covering a period of years, if under the plan the amounts to be contributed by the employer can be determined actuarially as provided in paragraph (1).

aircraft museum.rest: an organization— described in section 501(c)(3) which is exempt from income tax under section 501(a), operated as a museum under charter by a State or the District of Columbia, and operated exclusively for the procurement, care, and exhibition of aircraft of the type used for combat or transport in World War II.
aircraft museum.sentence: For purposes of this subsection, the term “aircraft museum” means an organization— described in section 501(c)(3) which is exempt from income tax under section 501(a), operated as a museum under charter by a State or the District of Columbia, and operated exclusively for the procurement, care, and exhibition of aircraft of the type used for combat or transport in World War II.

energy equivalent of a gallon of diesel.rest: , with respect to a liquefied natural gas fuel, the amount of such fuel having a Btu content of 128,700 (lower heating value).
energy equivalent of a gallon of diesel.sentence: For purposes of this paragraph, the term “energy equivalent of a gallon of diesel” means, with respect to a liquefied natural gas fuel, the amount of such fuel having a Btu content of 128,700 (lower heating value).

energy equivalent of a gallon of gasolin.rest: , with respect to a liquefied petroleum gas fuel, the amount of such fuel having a Btu content of 115,400 (lower heating value).
energy equivalent of a gallon of gasolin.sentence: For purposes of this paragraph, the term “energy equivalent of a gallon of gasoline” means, with respect to a liquefied petroleum gas fuel, the amount of such fuel having a Btu content of 115,400 (lower heating value).
For purposes of this paragraph, the term “energy equivalent of a gallon of gasoline” means 5.66 pounds of compressed natural gas.

nonprofit educational organization.rest: an educational organization described in section 170(b)(1)(A)(ii) which is exempt from income tax under section 501(a).
nonprofit educational organization.sentence: For purposes of paragraph (4), the term “nonprofit educational organization” means an educational organization described in section 170(b)(1)(A)(ii) which is exempt from income tax under section 501(a).

off-highway business use.rest: given to such term by section 6421(e)(2); except that such term shall not, for purposes of subsection (a)(1), include use in a diesel-powered train.
off-highway business use.sentence: For purposes of this subsection, the term “off-highway business use” has the meaning given to such term by section 6421(e)(2); except that such term shall not, for purposes of subsection (a)(1), include use in a diesel-powered train.

partially exempt methanol or ethanol fue.rest: any liquid at least 85 percent of which consists of methanol, ethanol, or other alcohol produced from natural gas.
partially exempt methanol or ethanol fue.sentence: The term “partially exempt methanol or ethanol fuel” means any liquid at least 85 percent of which consists of methanol, ethanol, or other alcohol produced from natural gas.

qualified methanol or ethanol fuel.rest: any liquid at least 85 percent of which consists of methanol, ethanol, or other alcohol produced from coal (including peat).
qualified methanol or ethanol fuel.sentence: The term “qualified methanol or ethanol fuel” means any liquid at least 85 percent of which consists of methanol, ethanol, or other alcohol produced from coal (including peat).

commercial waterway transportation.rest: any use of a vessel on any inland or intracoastal waterway of the United States— in the business of transporting property for compensation or hire, or in transporting property in the business of the owner, lessee, or operator of the vessel (other than fish or other aquatic animal life caught on the voyage).
commercial waterway transportation.sentence: For purposes of this section— The term “commercial waterway transportation” means any use of a vessel on any inland or intracoastal waterway of the United States— in the business of transporting property for compensation or hire, or in transporting property in the business of the owner, lessee, or operator of the vessel (other than fish or other aquatic animal life caught on the voyage).

inland or intracoastal waterway of the U.rest: any inland or intracoastal waterway of the United States which is described in section 206 of the Inland Waterways Revenue Act of 1978.
inland or intracoastal waterway of the U.sentence: The term “inland or intracoastal waterway of the United States” means any inland or intracoastal waterway of the United States which is described in section 206 of the Inland Waterways Revenue Act of 1978.

person.rest: the United States, a State, a political subdivision of a State, or any agency or instrumentality of any of the foregoing.
person.sentence: The term “person” includes the United States, a State, a political subdivision of a State, or any agency or instrumentality of any of the foregoing.

dry-lease aircraft exchange.rest: an agreement, documented by the written program agreements, under which the fractional program aircraft are available, on an as needed basis without crew, to each fractional owner.
dry-lease aircraft exchange.sentence: The term “dry-lease aircraft exchange” means an agreement, documented by the written program agreements, under which the fractional program aircraft are available, on an as needed basis without crew, to each fractional owner.

fractional owner.rest: any person owning any interest (including the entire interest) in a fractional program aircraft.
fractional owner.sentence: The term “fractional owner” means any person owning any interest (including the entire interest) in a fractional program aircraft.

fractional ownership aircraft program.rest: a program under which— a single fractional ownership program manager provides fractional ownership program management services on behalf of the fractional owners, there are 1 or more fractional owners per fractional program aircraft, with at least 1 fractional program aircraft having more than 1 owner, with respect to at least 2 fractional program aircraft, none of the ownership interests in such aircraft are— less than the minimum fractional ownership interest, or held by the program manager referred to in subparagraph (A), there exists a dry-lease aircraft exchange arrangement among all of the fractional owners, and there are multi-year program agreements covering the fractional ownership, fractional ownership program management services, and dry-lease aircraft exchange aspects of the program.
fractional ownership aircraft program.sentence: The term “fractional ownership aircraft program” means a program under which— a single fractional ownership program manager provides fractional ownership program management services on behalf of the fractional owners, there are 1 or more fractional owners per fractional program aircraft, with at least 1 fractional program aircraft having more than 1 owner, with respect to at least 2 fractional program aircraft, none of the ownership interests in such aircraft are— less than the minimum fractional ownership interest, or held by the program manager referred to in subparagraph (A), there exists a dry-lease aircraft exchange arrangement among all of the fractional owners, and there are multi-year program agreements covering the fractional ownership, fractional ownership program management services, and dry-lease aircraft exchange aspects of the program.

fractional ownership interest.rest: — the ownership of an interest in a fractional program aircraft, the holding of a multi-year leasehold interest in a fractional program aircraft, or the holding of a multi-year leasehold interest which is convertible into an ownership interest in a fractional program aircraft.
fractional ownership interest.sentence: The term “fractional ownership interest” means— the ownership of an interest in a fractional program aircraft, the holding of a multi-year leasehold interest in a fractional program aircraft, or the holding of a multi-year leasehold interest which is convertible into an ownership interest in a fractional program aircraft.

fractional program aircraft.rest: , with respect to any fractional ownership aircraft program, any aircraft which— is listed as a fractional program aircraft in the management specifications issued to the manager of such program by the Federal Aviation Administration under subpart K of part 91 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, and is registered in the United States.
fractional program aircraft.sentence: For purposes of this section— The term “fractional program aircraft” means, with respect to any fractional ownership aircraft program, any aircraft which— is listed as a fractional program aircraft in the management specifications issued to the manager of such program by the Federal Aviation Administration under subpart K of part 91 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, and is registered in the United States.

minimum fractional ownership interest.rest: , with respect to each type of aircraft— a fractional ownership interest equal to or greater than 1/16 of at least 1 subsonic, fixed wing, or powered lift aircraft, or a fractional ownership interest equal to or greater than 1/32 of at least 1 rotorcraft aircraft.
minimum fractional ownership interest.sentence: The term “minimum fractional ownership interest” means, with respect to each type of aircraft— a fractional ownership interest equal to or greater than 1/16 of at least 1 subsonic, fixed wing, or powered lift aircraft, or a fractional ownership interest equal to or greater than 1/32 of at least 1 rotorcraft aircraft.

qualified fractional owner.rest: any fractional owner which has a minimum fractional ownership interest in at least one fractional program aircraft.
qualified fractional owner.sentence: The term “qualified fractional owner” means any fractional owner which has a minimum fractional ownership interest in at least one fractional program aircraft.

cumulative United States amount.rest: the aggregate amount determined with respect to the plan under this section for the taxable year and for all prior taxable years to which this section applies.
cumulative United States amount.sentence: For purposes of paragraph (1)— The term “cumulative United States amount” means the aggregate amount determined with respect to the plan under this section for the taxable year and for all prior taxable years to which this section applies.

cumulative foreign amount.rest: the aggregate amount allowed as a deduction under the appropriate foreign tax laws for the taxable year and all prior taxable years to which this section applies.
cumulative foreign amount.sentence: The term “cumulative foreign amount” means the aggregate amount allowed as a deduction under the appropriate foreign tax laws for the taxable year and all prior taxable years to which this section applies.

permissible range.rest: a rate of interest which is not more than 20 percent above, and not more than 20 percent below, the average rate of interest for long-term corporate bonds in the appropriate country for the 15-year period ending on the last day before the beginning of the taxable year.
permissible range.sentence: For purposes of this subparagraph, the term “permissible range” means a rate of interest which is not more than 20 percent above, and not more than 20 percent below, the average rate of interest for long-term corporate bonds in the appropriate country for the 15-year period ending on the last day before the beginning of the taxable year.

qualified foreign plan.rest: any written plan of an employer for deferring the receipt of compensation but only if— such plan is for the exclusive benefit of the employer’s employees or their beneficiaries, 90 percent or more of the amounts taken into account for the taxable year under the plan are attributable to services— performed by nonresident aliens, and the compensation for which is not subject to tax under this chapter, and the employer elects (at such time and in such manner as the Secretary shall by regulations prescribe) to have this section apply to such plan.
qualified foreign plan.sentence: For purposes of this section, the term “qualified foreign plan” means any written plan of an employer for deferring the receipt of compensation but only if— such plan is for the exclusive benefit of the employer’s employees or their beneficiaries, 90 percent or more of the amounts taken into account for the taxable year under the plan are attributable to services— performed by nonresident aliens, and the compensation for which is not subject to tax under this chapter, and the employer elects (at such time and in such manner as the Secretary shall by regulations prescribe) to have this section apply to such plan.

qualified funded plan.rest: a qualified foreign plan which is not a qualified reserve plan.
qualified funded plan.sentence: For purposes of this section— The term “qualified funded plan” means a qualified foreign plan which is not a qualified reserve plan.

qualified reserve plan.rest: a qualified foreign plan with respect to which an election made by the taxpayer is in effect for the taxable year.
qualified reserve plan.sentence: The term “qualified reserve plan” means a qualified foreign plan with respect to which an election made by the taxpayer is in effect for the taxable year.

first retail sale.rest: the first sale, for a purpose other than for resale or leasing in a long-term lease, after production, manufacture, or importation.
first retail sale.sentence: For purposes of this subchapter— The term “first retail sale” means the first sale, for a purpose other than for resale or leasing in a long-term lease, after production, manufacture, or importation.

long-term lease.rest: any lease with a term of 1 year or more.
long-term lease.sentence: For purposes of this section, the term “long-term lease” means any lease with a term of 1 year or more.

presumed markup percentage.rest: the average markup percentage of retailers of articles of the type involved, as determined by the Secretary.
presumed markup percentage.sentence: For purposes of subparagraph (A), the term “presumed markup percentage” means the average markup percentage of retailers of articles of the type involved, as determined by the Secretary.

related person.rest: any person who is a member of the same controlled group (within the meaning of section 5061(e)(3)) as the manufacturer, producer, or importer.
related person.sentence: For purposes of this paragraph— Except as provided in clause (ii), the term “related person” means any person who is a member of the same controlled group (within the meaning of section 5061(e)(3)) as the manufacturer, producer, or importer.

EPA Administrator.rest: the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency.
EPA Administrator.sentence: The term “EPA Administrator” means the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency.

automobile.rest: any 4-wheeled vehicle propelled by fuel— which is manufactured primarily for use on public streets, roads, and highways (except any vehicle operated exclusively on a rail or rails), and which is rated at 6,000 pounds unloaded gross vehicle weight or less.
automobile.sentence: For purposes of this section— The term “automobile” means any 4-wheeled vehicle propelled by fuel— which is manufactured primarily for use on public streets, roads, and highways (except any vehicle operated exclusively on a rail or rails), and which is rated at 6,000 pounds unloaded gross vehicle weight or less.

automobile#.rest: any vehicle which is treated as a nonpassenger automobile under the rules which were prescribed by the Secretary of Transportation for purposes of section 32901 of title 49, United States Code, and which were in effect on the date of the enactment of this section.
automobile#.sentence: The term “automobile” does not include any vehicle which is treated as a nonpassenger automobile under the rules which were prescribed by the Secretary of Transportation for purposes of section 32901 of title 49, United States Code, and which were in effect on the date of the enactment of this section.

automobile##.rest: any vehicle sold for use and used— as an ambulance or combination ambulance-hearse, by the United States or by a State or local government for police or other law enforcement purposes, or for other emergency uses prescribed by the Secretary by regulations.
automobile##.sentence: The term “automobile” does not include any vehicle sold for use and used— as an ambulance or combination ambulance-hearse, by the United States or by a State or local government for police or other law enforcement purposes, or for other emergency uses prescribed by the Secretary by regulations.

fuel.sentence: The term “fuel” means gasoline and diesel fuel.

fuel economy.rest: the average number of miles traveled by an automobile per gallon of gasoline (or equivalent amount of other fuel) consumed, as determined by the EPA Administrator in accordance with procedures established under subsection (c).
fuel economy.sentence: The term “fuel economy” means the average number of miles traveled by an automobile per gallon of gasoline (or equivalent amount of other fuel) consumed, as determined by the EPA Administrator in accordance with procedures established under subsection (c).

manufacturer.sentence: The term “manufacturer” includes a producer or importer.

model type.rest: a particular class of automobile as determined by regulation by the EPA Administrator.
model type.sentence: The term “model type” means a particular class of automobile as determined by regulation by the EPA Administrator.

model year.sentence: If a manufacturer has no annual production period, the term “model year” means the calendar year.

biasply tire.rest: a pneumatic tire on which the ply cords that extend to the beads are laid at alternate angles substantially less than 90 degrees to the centerline of the tread.
biasply tire.sentence: For purposes of this part, the term “biasply tire” means a pneumatic tire on which the ply cords that extend to the beads are laid at alternate angles substantially less than 90 degrees to the centerline of the tread.

rubber.sentence: For purposes of this chapter, the term “rubber” includes synthetic and substitute rubber.

super single tire.rest: a single tire greater than 13 inches in cross section width designed to replace 2 tires in a dual fitment.
super single tire.sentence: For purposes of this part, the term “super single tire” means a single tire greater than 13 inches in cross section width designed to replace 2 tires in a dual fitment.

taxable tire.rest: any tire of the type used on highway vehicles if wholly or in part made of rubber and if marked pursuant to Federal regulations for highway use.
taxable tire.sentence: For purposes of this chapter, the term “taxable tire” means any tire of the type used on highway vehicles if wholly or in part made of rubber and if marked pursuant to Federal regulations for highway use.

tires of the type used on highway vehicl.rest: tires of the type used on— motor vehicles which are highway vehicles, or vehicles of the type used in connection with motor vehicles which are highway vehicles.
tires of the type used on highway vehicl.sentence: For purposes of this part, the term “tires of the type used on highway vehicles” means tires of the type used on— motor vehicles which are highway vehicles, or vehicles of the type used in connection with motor vehicles which are highway vehicles.

applicable percentage.rest: 3 percent.
applicable percentage.sentence: The term “applicable percentage” means 3 percent.

applicable requirement.rest: — the requirement under paragraph (2)(A)(i) that an employer be an eligible employer; the requirement under paragraph (2)(D) that an arrangement be the only plan of an employer; and the participation requirements under paragraph (4).
applicable requirement.sentence: For purposes of this paragraph, the term “applicable requirement” means— the requirement under paragraph (2)(A)(i) that an employer be an eligible employer; the requirement under paragraph (2)(D) that an arrangement be the only plan of an employer; and the participation requirements under paragraph (4).

bank.rest: — any bank (as defined in section 581), an insured credit union (within the meaning of paragraph (6) or (7) of section 101 of the Federal Credit Union Act), and a corporation which, under the laws of the State of its incorporation, is subject to supervision and examination by the Commissioner of Banking or other officer of such State in charge of the administration of the banking laws of such State.
bank.sentence: For purposes of subsection (a)(2), the term “bank” means— any bank (as defined in section 581), an insured credit union (within the meaning of paragraph (6) or (7) of section 101 of the Federal Credit Union Act), and a corporation which, under the laws of the State of its incorporation, is subject to supervision and examination by the Commissioner of Banking or other officer of such State in charge of the administration of the banking laws of such State.

collectible.rest: — any work of art, any rug or antique, any metal or gem, any stamp or coin, any alcoholic beverage, or any other tangible personal property specified by the Secretary for purposes of this subsection.
collectible.sentence: For purposes of this subsection, the term “collectible” means— any work of art, any rug or antique, any metal or gem, any stamp or coin, any alcoholic beverage, or any other tangible personal property specified by the Secretary for purposes of this subsection.

collectible#.rest: — any coin which is— a gold coin described in paragraph (7), (8), (9), or (10) of section 5112(a) of title 31, United States Code, a silver coin described in section 5112(e) of title 31, United States Code, a platinum coin described in section 5112(k) of title 31, United States Code, or a coin issued under the laws of any State, or any gold, silver, platinum, or palladium bullion of a fineness equal to or exceeding the minimum fineness that a contract market (as described in section 7 of the Commodity Exchange Act, 7 U.S.C.
collectible#.sentence: For purposes of this subsection, the term “collectible” shall not include— any coin which is— a gold coin described in paragraph (7), (8), (9), or (10) of section 5112(a) of title 31, United States Code, a silver coin described in section 5112(e) of title 31, United States Code, a platinum coin described in section 5112(k) of title 31, United States Code, or a coin issued under the laws of any State, or any gold, silver, platinum, or palladium bullion of a fineness equal to or exceeding the minimum fineness that a contract market (as described in section 7 of the Commodity Exchange Act, 7 U.S.C.

compensation.sentence: Except as provided in paragraph (2)(C), the term “compensation” has the meaning given such term by section 414(s).

compensation#.rest: amounts described in paragraphs (3) and (8) of section 6051(a).
compensation#.sentence: For purposes of this subsection— The term “compensation” means amounts described in paragraphs (3) and (8) of section 6051(a).

compensation##.rest: net earnings from self-employment determined under section 1402(a) without regard to any contribution under this subsection.
compensation##.sentence: In the case of an employee described in subparagraph (B), the term “compensation” means net earnings from self-employment determined under section 1402(a) without regard to any contribution under this subsection.

designated nondeductible contribution.rest: any contribution to an individual retirement plan for the taxable year which is designated (in such manner as the Secretary may prescribe) as a contribution for which a deduction is not allowable under section 219.
designated nondeductible contribution.sentence: For purposes of this paragraph, the term “designated nondeductible contribution” means any contribution to an individual retirement plan for the taxable year which is designated (in such manner as the Secretary may prescribe) as a contribution for which a deduction is not allowable under section 219.

eligible employer.rest: , with respect to any year, an employer which had no more than 100 employees who received at least $5,000 of compensation from the employer for the preceding year.
eligible employer.sentence: For purposes of this subsection— The term “eligible employer” means, with respect to any year, an employer which had no more than 100 employees who received at least $5,000 of compensation from the employer for the preceding year.

eligible plan.rest: any account, annuity, contract, or plan referred to in subparagraph (A).
eligible plan.sentence: For purposes of clause (i), the term “eligible plan” means any account, annuity, contract, or plan referred to in subparagraph (A).

eligible retirement plan.rest: an eligible retirement plan described in clause (iii), (iv), (v), or (vi) of section 402(c)(8)(B).
eligible retirement plan.sentence: For purposes of clause (ii), the term “eligible retirement plan” means an eligible retirement plan described in clause (iii), (iv), (v), or (vi) of section 402(c)(8)(B).

employee.rest: an employee as defined in section 401(c)(1).
employee.sentence: The term “employee” includes an employee as defined in section 401(c)(1).

excess contribution.rest: , with respect to a highly compensated employee, the excess of elective employer contributions under this paragraph over the maximum amount of such contributions allowable under subparagraph (A)(iii).
excess contribution.sentence: For purposes of clause (i), the term “excess contribution” means, with respect to a highly compensated employee, the excess of elective employer contributions under this paragraph over the maximum amount of such contributions allowable under subparagraph (A)(iii).

highly compensated employee.sentence: For purposes of this paragraph, the term “highly compensated employee” has the meaning given such term by section 414(q).

individual retirement account.rest: a trust created or organized in the United States for the exclusive benefit of an individual or his beneficiaries, but only if the written governing instrument creating the trust meets the following requirements: Except in the case of a rollover contribution described in subsection (d)(3) in 11 So in original.
individual retirement account.sentence: For purposes of this section, the term “individual retirement account” means a trust created or organized in the United States for the exclusive benefit of an individual or his beneficiaries, but only if the written governing instrument creating the trust meets the following requirements: Except in the case of a rollover contribution described in subsection (d)(3) in 11 So in original.

individual retirement annuity.rest: an annuity contract, or an endowment contract (as determined under regulations prescribed by the Secretary), issued by an insurance company which meets the following requirements: The contract is not transferable by the owner.
individual retirement annuity.sentence: For purposes of this section, the term “individual retirement annuity” means an annuity contract, or an endowment contract (as determined under regulations prescribed by the Secretary), issued by an insurance company which meets the following requirements: The contract is not transferable by the owner.

nondeductible limit.rest: the excess of— the amount allowable as a deduction under section 219 (determined without regard to section 219(g)), over the amount allowable as a deduction under section 219 (determined with regard to section 219(g)).
nondeductible limit.sentence: For purposes of this paragraph— The term “nondeductible limit” means the excess of— the amount allowable as a deduction under section 219 (determined without regard to section 219(g)), over the amount allowable as a deduction under section 219 (determined with regard to section 219(g)).

qualified HSA funding distribution.rest: a distribution from an individual retirement plan (other than a plan described in subsection (k) or (p)) of the employee to the extent that such distribution is contributed to the health savings account of the individual in a direct trustee-to-trustee transfer.
qualified HSA funding distribution.sentence: For purposes of this paragraph, the term “qualified HSA funding distribution” means a distribution from an individual retirement plan (other than a plan described in subsection (k) or (p)) of the employee to the extent that such distribution is contributed to the health savings account of the individual in a direct trustee-to-trustee transfer.

qualified charitable distribution.rest: any distribution from an individual retirement plan (other than a plan described in subsection (k) or (p))— which is made directly by the trustee to an organization described in section 170(b)(1)(A) (other than any organization described in section 509(a)(3) or any fund or account described in section 4966(d)(2)), and which is made on or after the date that the individual for whose benefit the plan is maintained has attained age 70½.
qualified charitable distribution.sentence: For purposes of this paragraph, the term “qualified charitable distribution” means any distribution from an individual retirement plan (other than a plan described in subsection (k) or (p))— which is made directly by the trustee to an organization described in section 170(b)(1)(A) (other than any organization described in section 509(a)(3) or any fund or account described in section 4966(d)(2)), and which is made on or after the date that the individual for whose benefit the plan is maintained has attained age 70½.

qualified employer plan.rest: given such term by section 72(p)(4)(A)(i); except that such term shall also include an eligible deferred compensation plan (as defined in section 457(b)) of an eligible employer described in section 457(e)(1)(A).
qualified employer plan.sentence: For purposes of this subsection— The term “qualified employer plan” has the meaning given such term by section 72(p)(4)(A)(i); except that such term shall also include an eligible deferred compensation plan (as defined in section 457(b)) of an eligible employer described in section 457(e)(1)(A).

qualified plan.rest: a plan, contract, pension, or trust described in subparagraph (A) or (B) of section 219(g)(5).
qualified plan.sentence: For purposes of this subparagraph, the term “qualified plan” means a plan, contract, pension, or trust described in subparagraph (A) or (B) of section 219(g)(5).

qualified salary reduction arrangement.rest: a written arrangement of an eligible employer under which— an employee eligible to participate in the arrangement may elect to have the employer make payments— as elective employer contributions to a simple retirement account on behalf of the employee, or to the employee directly in cash, the amount which an employee may elect under clause (i) for any year is required to be expressed as a percentage of compensation and may not exceed a total of the applicable dollar amount for any year, the employer is required to make a matching contribution to the simple retirement account for any year in an amount equal to so much of the amount the employee elects under clause (i)(I) as does not exceed the applicable percentage of compensation for the year, and no contributions may be made other than contributions described in clause (i) or (iii).
qualified salary reduction arrangement.sentence: For purposes of this subsection, the term “qualified salary reduction arrangement” means a written arrangement of an eligible employer under which— an employee eligible to participate in the arrangement may elect to have the employer make payments— as elective employer contributions to a simple retirement account on behalf of the employee, or to the employee directly in cash, the amount which an employee may elect under clause (i) for any year is required to be expressed as a percentage of compensation and may not exceed a total of the applicable dollar amount for any year, the employer is required to make a matching contribution to the simple retirement account for any year in an amount equal to so much of the amount the employee elects under clause (i)(I) as does not exceed the applicable percentage of compensation for the year, and no contributions may be made other than contributions described in clause (i) or (iii).

simple retirement account.rest: an individual retirement plan (as defined in section 7701(a)(37))— with respect to which the requirements of paragraphs (3), (4), and (5) are met; and except in the case of a rollover contribution described in subsection (d)(3)(G) or a rollover contribution otherwise described in subsection (d)(3) or in section 402(c), 403(a)(4), 403(b)(8), or 457(e)(16), which is made after the 2-year period described in section 72(t)(6), with respect to which the only contributions allowed are contributions under a qualified salary reduction arrangement.
simple retirement account.sentence: For purposes of this title, the term “simple retirement account” means an individual retirement plan (as defined in section 7701(a)(37))— with respect to which the requirements of paragraphs (3), (4), and (5) are met; and except in the case of a rollover contribution described in subsection (d)(3)(G) or a rollover contribution otherwise described in subsection (d)(3) or in section 402(c), 403(a)(4), 403(b)(8), or 457(e)(16), which is made after the 2-year period described in section 72(t)(6), with respect to which the only contributions allowed are contributions under a qualified salary reduction arrangement.

simplified employee pension.rest: an individual retirement account or individual retirement annuity— with respect to which the requirements of paragraphs (2), (3), (4), and (5) of this subsection are met, and if such account or annuity is part of a top-heavy plan (as defined in section 416), with respect to which the requirements of section 416(c)(2) are met.
simplified employee pension.sentence: For purposes of this title, the term “simplified employee pension” means an individual retirement account or individual retirement annuity— with respect to which the requirements of paragraphs (2), (3), (4), and (5) of this subsection are met, and if such account or annuity is part of a top-heavy plan (as defined in section 416), with respect to which the requirements of section 416(c)(2) are met.

testing period.rest: the period beginning with the month in which the qualified HSA funding distribution is contributed to a health savings account and ending on the last day of the 12th month following such month.
testing period.sentence: The term “testing period” means the period beginning with the month in which the qualified HSA funding distribution is contributed to a health savings account and ending on the last day of the 12th month following such month.

transition period.rest: the period beginning on the date of any transaction described in subparagraph (A) and ending on the last day of the second calendar year following the calendar year in which such transaction occurs.
transition period.sentence: For purposes of this paragraph, the term “transition period” means the period beginning on the date of any transaction described in subparagraph (A) and ending on the last day of the second calendar year following the calendar year in which such transaction occurs.

voluntary employee contribution.rest: any contribution (other than a mandatory contribution within the meaning of section 411(c)(2)(C))— which is made by an individual as an employee under a qualified employer plan which allows employees to elect to make contributions described in paragraph (1), and with respect to which the individual has designated the contribution as a contribution to which this subsection applies.
voluntary employee contribution.sentence: The term “voluntary employee contribution” means any contribution (other than a mandatory contribution within the meaning of section 411(c)(2)(C))— which is made by an individual as an employee under a qualified employer plan which allows employees to elect to make contributions described in paragraph (1), and with respect to which the individual has designated the contribution as a contribution to which this subsection applies.

year.rest: — the calendar year, or if the employer elects, subject to such terms and conditions as the Secretary may prescribe, to maintain the simplified employee pension on the basis of the employer’s taxable year.
year.sentence: The term “year” means— the calendar year, or if the employer elects, subject to such terms and conditions as the Secretary may prescribe, to maintain the simplified employee pension on the basis of the employer’s taxable year.

year#.sentence: The term “year” means the calendar year.

nontaxable use.rest: — any use which is exempt from the tax imposed by section 4041(a)(1) other than by reason of a prior imposition of tax, any use in a train, and any use described in section 4041(a)(1)(C)(iii)(II).
nontaxable use.sentence: For purposes of this section, the term “nontaxable use” means— any use which is exempt from the tax imposed by section 4041(a)(1) other than by reason of a prior imposition of tax, any use in a train, and any use described in section 4041(a)(1)(C)(iii)(II).

nontaxable use#.rest: the use of kerosene in an aircraft and such term shall not include any use described in section 6421(e)(2)(C).
nontaxable use#.sentence: The term “nontaxable use” does not include the use of kerosene in an aircraft and such term shall not include any use described in section 6421(e)(2)(C).

commercial aviation.rest: any use of an aircraft in a business of transporting persons or property for compensation or hire by air, unless properly allocable to any transportation exempt from the taxes imposed by sections 4261 and 4271 by reason of section 4281 or 4282 or by reason of subsection (h) or (i) of section 4261.
commercial aviation.sentence: For purposes of this subpart, the term “commercial aviation” means any use of an aircraft in a business of transporting persons or property for compensation or hire by air, unless properly allocable to any transportation exempt from the taxes imposed by sections 4261 and 4271 by reason of section 4281 or 4282 or by reason of subsection (h) or (i) of section 4261.

diesel fuel.rest: — any liquid (other than gasoline) which is suitable for use as a fuel in a diesel-powered highway vehicle, or a diesel-powered train, transmix, and diesel fuel blend stocks identified by the Secretary.
diesel fuel.sentence: The term “diesel fuel” means— any liquid (other than gasoline) which is suitable for use as a fuel in a diesel-powered highway vehicle, or a diesel-powered train, transmix, and diesel fuel blend stocks identified by the Secretary.

gasoline blend stock.rest: any petroleum product component of gasoline.
gasoline blend stock.sentence: For purposes of subparagraph (B)(i), the term “gasoline blend stock” means any petroleum product component of gasoline.

taxable fuel.sentence: For purposes of this subpart— The term “taxable fuel” means— gasoline, diesel fuel, and kerosene.

transmix.rest: a byproduct of refined products pipeline operations created by the mixing of different specification products during pipeline transportation.
transmix.sentence: For purposes of subparagraph (A), the term “transmix” means a byproduct of refined products pipeline operations created by the mixing of different specification products during pipeline transportation.

Roth IRA.rest: an individual retirement plan (as defined in section 7701(a)(37)) which is designated (in such manner as the Secretary may prescribe) at the time of establishment of the plan as a Roth IRA.
Roth IRA.sentence: For purposes of this title, the term “Roth IRA” means an individual retirement plan (as defined in section 7701(a)(37)) which is designated (in such manner as the Secretary may prescribe) at the time of establishment of the plan as a Roth IRA.

qualified distribution.rest: any payment or distribution— made on or after the date on which the individual attains age 59½, made to a beneficiary (or to the estate of the individual) on or after the death of the individual, attributable to the individual’s being disabled (within the meaning of section 72(m)(7)), or which is a qualified special purpose distribution.
qualified distribution.sentence: For purposes of this subsection— The term “qualified distribution” means any payment or distribution— made on or after the date on which the individual attains age 59½, made to a beneficiary (or to the estate of the individual) on or after the death of the individual, attributable to the individual’s being disabled (within the meaning of section 72(m)(7)), or which is a qualified special purpose distribution.

qualified distribution#.rest: any distribution of any contribution described in section 408(d)(4) and any net income allocable to the contribution.
qualified distribution#.sentence: The term “qualified distribution” shall not include any distribution of any contribution described in section 408(d)(4) and any net income allocable to the contribution.

qualified rollover contribution.rest: a rollover contribution— to a Roth IRA from another such account, from an eligible retirement plan, but only if— in the case of an individual retirement plan, such rollover contribution meets the requirements of section 408(d)(3), and in the case of any eligible retirement plan (as defined in section 402(c)(8)(B) other than clauses (i) and (ii) thereof), such rollover contribution meets the requirements of section 402(c), 403(b)(8), or 457(e)(16), as applicable.
qualified rollover contribution.sentence: For purposes of this section— The term “qualified rollover contribution” means a rollover contribution— to a Roth IRA from another such account, from an eligible retirement plan, but only if— in the case of an individual retirement plan, such rollover contribution meets the requirements of section 408(d)(3), and in the case of any eligible retirement plan (as defined in section 402(c)(8)(B) other than clauses (i) and (ii) thereof), such rollover contribution meets the requirements of section 402(c), 403(b)(8), or 457(e)(16), as applicable.

qualified rollover contribution#.rest: a contribution to a Roth IRA maintained for the benefit of an individual made before the end of the 1-year period beginning on the date on which such individual receives an amount under section 1477 of title 10, United States Code, or section 1967 of title 38 of such Code, with respect to a person, to the extent that such contribution does not exceed— the sum of the amounts received during such period by such individual under such sections with respect to such person, reduced by the amounts so received which were contributed to a Coverdell education savings account under section 530(d)(9).
qualified rollover contribution#.sentence: The term “qualified rollover contribution” includes a contribution to a Roth IRA maintained for the benefit of an individual made before the end of the 1-year period beginning on the date on which such individual receives an amount under section 1477 of title 10, United States Code, or section 1967 of title 38 of such Code, with respect to a person, to the extent that such contribution does not exceed— the sum of the amounts received during such period by such individual under such sections with respect to such person, reduced by the amounts so received which were contributed to a Coverdell education savings account under section 530(d)(9).

qualified special purpose distribution.rest: any distribution to which subparagraph (F) of section 72(t)(2) applies.
qualified special purpose distribution.sentence: For purposes of this section, the term “qualified special purpose distribution” means any distribution to which subparagraph (F) of section 72(t)(2) applies.

controlled group of corporations.rest: given to such term by section 1563(a) (determined without regard to subsections (a)(4) and (e)(3)(C) of section 1563).
controlled group of corporations.sentence: For purposes of this subsection, the term “controlled group of corporations” has the meaning given to such term by section 1563(a) (determined without regard to subsections (a)(4) and (e)(3)(C) of section 1563).

deemed-owned shares.rest: , with respect to any person— the stock in the S corporation constituting employer securities of an employee stock ownership plan which is allocated to such person under the plan, and such person’s share of the stock in such corporation which is held by such plan but which is not allocated under the plan to participants.
deemed-owned shares.sentence: The term “deemed-owned shares” means, with respect to any person— the stock in the S corporation constituting employer securities of an employee stock ownership plan which is allocated to such person under the plan, and such person’s share of the stock in such corporation which is held by such plan but which is not allocated under the plan to participants.

disqualified person.rest: any person if— the aggregate number of deemed-owned shares of such person and the members of such person’s family is at least 20 percent of the number of deemed-owned shares of stock in the S corporation, or in the case of a person not described in clause (i), the number of deemed-owned shares of such person is at least 10 percent of the number of deemed-owned shares of stock in such corporation.
disqualified person.sentence: For purposes of this subsection— The term “disqualified person” means any person if— the aggregate number of deemed-owned shares of such person and the members of such person’s family is at least 20 percent of the number of deemed-owned shares of stock in the S corporation, or in the case of a person not described in clause (i), the number of deemed-owned shares of such person is at least 10 percent of the number of deemed-owned shares of stock in such corporation.

employee stock ownership plan.sentence: For purposes of this subsection— The term “employee stock ownership plan” has the meaning given such term by section 4975(e)(7).

employer securities.rest: common stock issued by the employer (or by a corporation which is a member of the same controlled group) which is readily tradable on an established securities market.
employer securities.sentence: For purposes of this section— The term “employer securities” means common stock issued by the employer (or by a corporation which is a member of the same controlled group) which is readily tradable on an established securities market.

employer securities#.rest: common stock issued by the employer (or by a corporation which is a member of the same controlled group) having a combination of voting power and dividend rights equal to or in excess of— that class of common stock of the employer (or of any other such corporation) having the greatest voting power, and that class of common stock of the employer (or of any other such corporation) having the greatest dividend rights.
employer securities#.sentence: If there is no common stock which meets the requirements of paragraph (1), the term “employer securities” means common stock issued by the employer (or by a corporation which is a member of the same controlled group) having a combination of voting power and dividend rights equal to or in excess of— that class of common stock of the employer (or of any other such corporation) having the greatest voting power, and that class of common stock of the employer (or of any other such corporation) having the greatest dividend rights.

employer security.sentence: The term “employer security” has the meaning given such term by section 409(l).

member of the family.rest: , with respect to any individual— the spouse of the individual, an ancestor or lineal descendant of the individual or the individual’s spouse, a brother or sister of the individual or the individual’s spouse and any lineal descendant of the brother or sister, and the spouse of any individual described in clause (ii) or (iii).
member of the family.sentence: For purposes of this paragraph, the term “member of the family” means, with respect to any individual— the spouse of the individual, an ancestor or lineal descendant of the individual or the individual’s spouse, a brother or sister of the individual or the individual’s spouse and any lineal descendant of the brother or sister, and the spouse of any individual described in clause (ii) or (iii).

nonallocation period.rest: the period beginning on the date of the sale of the qualified securities and ending on the later of— the date which is 10 years after the date of sale, or the date of the plan allocation attributable to the final payment of acquisition indebtedness incurred in connection with such sale.
nonallocation period.sentence: The term “nonallocation period” means the period beginning on the date of the sale of the qualified securities and ending on the later of— the date which is 10 years after the date of sale, or the date of the plan allocation attributable to the final payment of acquisition indebtedness incurred in connection with such sale.

nonallocation year.rest: any plan year of an employee stock ownership plan if, at any time during such plan year— such plan holds employer securities consisting of stock in an S corporation, and disqualified persons own at least 50 percent of the number of shares of stock in the S corporation.
nonallocation year.sentence: For purposes of this subsection— The term “nonallocation year” means any plan year of an employee stock ownership plan if, at any time during such plan year— such plan holds employer securities consisting of stock in an S corporation, and disqualified persons own at least 50 percent of the number of shares of stock in the S corporation.

synthetic equity.rest: any stock option, warrant, restricted stock, deferred issuance stock right, or similar interest or right that gives the holder the right to acquire or receive stock of the S corporation in the future.
synthetic equity.sentence: The term “synthetic equity” means any stock option, warrant, restricted stock, deferred issuance stock right, or similar interest or right that gives the holder the right to acquire or receive stock of the S corporation in the future.

tax credit employee stock ownership plan.rest: a defined contribution plan which— meets the requirements of section 401(a), is designed to invest primarily in employer securities, and meets the requirements of subsections (b), (c), (d), (e), (f), (g), (h), and (o) of this section.
tax credit employee stock ownership plan.sentence: Except as otherwise provided in this title, for purposes of this title, the term “tax credit employee stock ownership plan” means a defined contribution plan which— meets the requirements of section 401(a), is designed to invest primarily in employer securities, and meets the requirements of subsections (b), (c), (d), (e), (f), (g), (h), and (o) of this section.

total distribution.rest: the distribution within 1 taxable year to the recipient of the balance to the credit of the recipient’s account.
total distribution.sentence: For purposes of this paragraph, the term “total distribution” means the distribution within 1 taxable year to the recipient of the balance to the credit of the recipient’s account.

applicable covered employee.rest: any— covered employee of a plan sponsor, covered employee of a member of a controlled group which includes the plan sponsor, and former employee who was a covered employee at the time of termination of employment with the plan sponsor or a member of a controlled group which includes the plan sponsor.
applicable covered employee.sentence: For purposes of this section— The term “applicable covered employee” means any— covered employee of a plan sponsor, covered employee of a member of a controlled group which includes the plan sponsor, and former employee who was a covered employee at the time of termination of employment with the plan sponsor or a member of a controlled group which includes the plan sponsor.

covered employee.rest: an individual described in section 162(m)(3) or an individual subject to the requirements of section 16(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934.
covered employee.sentence: The term “covered employee” means an individual described in section 162(m)(3) or an individual subject to the requirements of section 16(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934.

nonqualified deferred compensation plan.rest: any plan that provides for the deferral of compensation, other than— a qualified employer plan, and any bona fide vacation leave, sick leave, compensatory time, disability pay, or death benefit plan.
nonqualified deferred compensation plan.sentence: For purposes of this section: The term “nonqualified deferred compensation plan” means any plan that provides for the deferral of compensation, other than— a qualified employer plan, and any bona fide vacation leave, sick leave, compensatory time, disability pay, or death benefit plan.

plan.rest: any agreement or arrangement, including an agreement or arrangement that includes one person.
plan.sentence: The term “plan” includes any agreement or arrangement, including an agreement or arrangement that includes one person.

qualified employer plan.rest: — any plan, contract, pension, account, or trust described in subparagraph (A) or (B) of section 219(g)(5) (without regard to subparagraph (A)(iii)), any eligible deferred compensation plan (within the meaning of section 457(b)), and any plan described in section 415(m).
qualified employer plan.sentence: The term “qualified employer plan” means— any plan, contract, pension, account, or trust described in subparagraph (A) or (B) of section 219(g)(5) (without regard to subparagraph (A)(iii)), any eligible deferred compensation plan (within the meaning of section 457(b)), and any plan described in section 415(m).

restricted period.rest: , with respect to any plan described in subparagraph (A)— any period during which the plan is in at-risk status (as defined in section 430(i)); 11 So in original.
restricted period.sentence: For purposes of this section, the term “restricted period” means, with respect to any plan described in subparagraph (A)— any period during which the plan is in at-risk status (as defined in section 430(i)); 11 So in original.

unforeseeable emergency.rest: a severe financial hardship to the participant resulting from an illness or accident of the participant, the participant’s spouse, or a dependent (as defined in section 152(a)) of the participant, loss of the participant’s property due to casualty, or other similar extraordinary and unforeseeable circumstances arising as a result of events beyond the control of the participant.
unforeseeable emergency.sentence: For purposes of subparagraph (A)(vi)— The term “unforeseeable emergency” means a severe financial hardship to the participant resulting from an illness or accident of the participant, the participant’s spouse, or a dependent (as defined in section 152(a)) of the participant, loss of the participant’s property due to casualty, or other similar extraordinary and unforeseeable circumstances arising as a result of events beyond the control of the participant.

United States.rest: any possession of the United States.
United States.sentence: For purposes of this paragraph, the term “United States” includes any possession of the United States.

agri-biodiesel.rest: biodiesel derived solely from virgin oils, including esters derived from virgin vegetable oils from corn, soybeans, sunflower seeds, cottonseeds, canola, crambe, rapeseeds, safflowers, flaxseeds, rice bran, mustard seeds, and camelina, and from animal fats.
agri-biodiesel.sentence: The term “agri-biodiesel” means biodiesel derived solely from virgin oils, including esters derived from virgin vegetable oils from corn, soybeans, sunflower seeds, cottonseeds, canola, crambe, rapeseeds, safflowers, flaxseeds, rice bran, mustard seeds, and camelina, and from animal fats.

biodiesel.rest: the monoalkyl esters of long chain fatty acids derived from plant or animal matter which meet— the registration requirements for fuels and fuel additives established by the Environmental Protection Agency under section 211 of the Clean Air Act (42 U.S.C.
biodiesel.sentence: For purposes of this section— The term “biodiesel” means the monoalkyl esters of long chain fatty acids derived from plant or animal matter which meet— the registration requirements for fuels and fuel additives established by the Environmental Protection Agency under section 211 of the Clean Air Act (42 U.S.C.

biomass.sentence: For purposes of this paragraph, the term “biomass” has the meaning given such term by section 45K(c)(3).

eligible small agri-biodiesel producer.rest: a person who, at all times during the taxable year, has a productive capacity for agri-biodiesel not in excess of 60,000,000 gallons.
eligible small agri-biodiesel producer.sentence: For purposes of this section— The term “eligible small agri-biodiesel producer” means a person who, at all times during the taxable year, has a productive capacity for agri-biodiesel not in excess of 60,000,000 gallons.

qualified agri-biodiesel production.rest: any agri-biodiesel which is produced by an eligible small agri-biodiesel producer, and which during the taxable year— is sold by such producer to another person— for use by such other person in the production of a qualified biodiesel mixture in such other person’s trade or business (other than casual off-farm production), for use by such other person as a fuel in a trade or business, or who sells such agri-biodiesel at retail to another person and places such agri-biodiesel in the fuel tank of such other person, or is used or sold by such producer for any purpose described in clause (i).
qualified agri-biodiesel production.sentence: For purposes of this paragraph, the term “qualified agri-biodiesel production” means any agri-biodiesel which is produced by an eligible small agri-biodiesel producer, and which during the taxable year— is sold by such producer to another person— for use by such other person in the production of a qualified biodiesel mixture in such other person’s trade or business (other than casual off-farm production), for use by such other person as a fuel in a trade or business, or who sells such agri-biodiesel at retail to another person and places such agri-biodiesel in the fuel tank of such other person, or is used or sold by such producer for any purpose described in clause (i).

qualified biodiesel mixture.rest: a mixture of biodiesel and diesel fuel (as defined in section 4083(a)(3)), determined without regard to any use of kerosene, which— is sold by the taxpayer producing such mixture to any person for use as a fuel, or is used as a fuel by the taxpayer producing such mixture.
qualified biodiesel mixture.sentence: The term “qualified biodiesel mixture” means a mixture of biodiesel and diesel fuel (as defined in section 4083(a)(3)), determined without regard to any use of kerosene, which— is sold by the taxpayer producing such mixture to any person for use as a fuel, or is used as a fuel by the taxpayer producing such mixture.

renewable diesel.rest: liquid fuel derived from biomass which meets— the registration requirements for fuels and fuel additives established by the Environmental Protection Agency under section 211 of the Clean Air Act (42 U.S.C.
renewable diesel.sentence: The term “renewable diesel” means liquid fuel derived from biomass which meets— the registration requirements for fuels and fuel additives established by the Environmental Protection Agency under section 211 of the Clean Air Act (42 U.S.C.

renewable diesel#.rest: fuel derived from biomass which meets the requirements of a Department of Defense specification for military jet fuel or an American Society of Testing and Materials specification for aviation turbine fuel.
renewable diesel#.sentence: Except as provided in the last 3 sentences of paragraph (3), the term “renewable diesel” shall include fuel derived from biomass which meets the requirements of a Department of Defense specification for military jet fuel or an American Society of Testing and Materials specification for aviation turbine fuel.

Federal laboratory.rest: given such term by section 4(6) of the Stevenson-Wydler Technology Innovation Act of 1980 (15 U.S.C.
Federal laboratory.sentence: For purposes of this subparagraph, the term “Federal laboratory” has the meaning given such term by section 4(6) of the Stevenson-Wydler Technology Innovation Act of 1980 (15 U.S.C.

base amount.rest: the product of— the fixed-base percentage, and the average annual gross receipts of the taxpayer for the 4 taxable years preceding the taxable year for which the credit is being determined (hereinafter in this subsection referred to as the “credit year”).
base amount.sentence: The term “base amount” means the product of— the fixed-base percentage, and the average annual gross receipts of the taxpayer for the 4 taxable years preceding the taxable year for which the credit is being determined (hereinafter in this subsection referred to as the “credit year”).

base period.rest: the 3-taxable-year period ending with the taxable year immediately preceding the 1st taxable year of the taxpayer beginning after December 31, 1983.
base period.sentence: The term “base period” means the 3-taxable-year period ending with the taxable year immediately preceding the 1st taxable year of the taxpayer beginning after December 31, 1983.

basic research.rest: any original investigation for the advancement of scientific knowledge not having a specific commercial objective, except that such term shall not include— basic research conducted outside of the United States, and basic research in the social sciences, arts, or humanities.
basic research.sentence: For purposes of this subsection— The term “basic research” means any original investigation for the advancement of scientific knowledge not having a specific commercial objective, except that such term shall not include— basic research conducted outside of the United States, and basic research in the social sciences, arts, or humanities.

basic research payment.rest: , with respect to any taxable year, any amount paid in cash during such taxable year by a corporation to any qualified organization for basic research but only if— such payment is pursuant to a written agreement between such corporation and such qualified organization, and such basic research is to be performed by such qualified organization.
basic research payment.sentence: For purposes of this subsection— The term “basic research payment” means, with respect to any taxable year, any amount paid in cash during such taxable year by a corporation to any qualified organization for basic research but only if— such payment is pursuant to a written agreement between such corporation and such qualified organization, and such basic research is to be performed by such qualified organization.

business component.rest: any product, process, computer software, technique, formula, or invention which is to be— held for sale, lease, or license, or used by the taxpayer in a trade or business of the taxpayer.
business component.sentence: The term “business component” means any product, process, computer software, technique, formula, or invention which is to be— held for sale, lease, or license, or used by the taxpayer in a trade or business of the taxpayer.

contract research expenses.rest: 65 percent of any amount paid or incurred by the taxpayer to any person (other than an employee of the taxpayer) for qualified research.
contract research expenses.sentence: The term “contract research expenses” means 65 percent of any amount paid or incurred by the taxpayer to any person (other than an employee of the taxpayer) for qualified research.

corporation.rest: — an S corporation, a personal holding company (as defined in section 542), or a service organization (as defined in section 414(m)(3)).
corporation.sentence: The term “corporation” shall not include— an S corporation, a personal holding company (as defined in section 542), or a service organization (as defined in section 414(m)(3)).

eligible small business.rest: a small business with respect to which the taxpayer does not own (within the meaning of section 318) 50 percent or more of— in the case of a corporation, the outstanding stock of the corporation (either by vote or value), and in the case of a small business which is not a corporation, the capital and profits interests of the small business.
eligible small business.sentence: For purposes of this subparagraph, the term “eligible small business” means a small business with respect to which the taxpayer does not own (within the meaning of section 318) 50 percent or more of— in the case of a corporation, the outstanding stock of the corporation (either by vote or value), and in the case of a small business which is not a corporation, the capital and profits interests of the small business.

energy research.rest: any research which is not qualified research.
energy research.sentence: The term “energy research” does not include any research which is not qualified research.

energy research consortium.rest: any organization— which is— described in section 501(c)(3) and is exempt from tax under section 501(a) and is organized and operated primarily to conduct energy research, or organized and operated primarily to conduct energy research in the public interest (within the meaning of section 501(c)(3)), which is not a private foundation, to which at least 5 unrelated persons paid or incurred during the calendar year in which the taxable year of the organization begins amounts (including as contributions) to such organization for energy research, and to which no single person paid or incurred (including as contributions) during such calendar year an amount equal to more than 50 percent of the total amounts received by such organization during such calendar year for energy research.
energy research consortium.sentence: The term “energy research consortium” means any organization— which is— described in section 501(c)(3) and is exempt from tax under section 501(a) and is organized and operated primarily to conduct energy research, or organized and operated primarily to conduct energy research in the public interest (within the meaning of section 501(c)(3)), which is not a private foundation, to which at least 5 unrelated persons paid or incurred during the calendar year in which the taxable year of the organization begins amounts (including as contributions) to such organization for energy research, and to which no single person paid or incurred (including as contributions) during such calendar year an amount equal to more than 50 percent of the total amounts received by such organization during such calendar year for energy research.

in-house research expenses.rest: — any wages paid or incurred to an employee for qualified services performed by such employee, any amount paid or incurred for supplies used in the conduct of qualified research, and under regulations prescribed by the Secretary, any amount paid or incurred to another person for the right to use computers in the conduct of qualified research.
in-house research expenses.sentence: The term “in-house research expenses” means— any wages paid or incurred to an employee for qualified services performed by such employee, any amount paid or incurred for supplies used in the conduct of qualified research, and under regulations prescribed by the Secretary, any amount paid or incurred to another person for the right to use computers in the conduct of qualified research.

maintenance-of-effort amount.rest: , with respect to any taxable year, an amount equal to the excess (if any) of— an amount equal to— the average of the nondesignated university contributions paid by the taxpayer during the base period, multiplied by the cost-of-living adjustment for the calendar year in which such taxable year begins, over the amount of nondesignated university contributions paid by the taxpayer during such taxable year.
maintenance-of-effort amount.sentence: For purposes of this subsection— The term “maintenance-of-effort amount” means, with respect to any taxable year, an amount equal to the excess (if any) of— an amount equal to— the average of the nondesignated university contributions paid by the taxpayer during the base period, multiplied by the cost-of-living adjustment for the calendar year in which such taxable year begins, over the amount of nondesignated university contributions paid by the taxpayer during such taxable year.

measurement period.rest: , with respect to the taxable year of the acquiring person for which the credit is determined, any period of the acquiring person preceding such taxable year which is taken into account for purposes of determining the credit for such year.
measurement period.sentence: For purposes of this subparagraph, the term “measurement period” means, with respect to the taxable year of the acquiring person for which the credit is determined, any period of the acquiring person preceding such taxable year which is taken into account for purposes of determining the credit for such year.

minimum basic research amount.rest: an amount equal to the greater of— 1 percent of the average of the sum of amounts paid or incurred during the base period for— any in-house research expenses, and any contract research expenses, or the amounts treated as contract research expenses during the base period by reason of this subsection (as in effect during the base period).
minimum basic research amount.sentence: For purposes of this subsection— The term “minimum basic research amount” means an amount equal to the greater of— 1 percent of the average of the sum of amounts paid or incurred during the base period for— any in-house research expenses, and any contract research expenses, or the amounts treated as contract research expenses during the base period by reason of this subsection (as in effect during the base period).

nondesignated university contribution.rest: any amount paid by a taxpayer to any qualified organization described in paragraph (6)(A)— for which a deduction was allowable under section 170, and which was not taken into account— in computing the amount of the credit under this section (as in effect during the base period) during any taxable year in the base period, or as a basic research payment for purposes of this section.
nondesignated university contribution.sentence: For purposes of this paragraph, the term “nondesignated university contribution” means any amount paid by a taxpayer to any qualified organization described in paragraph (6)(A)— for which a deduction was allowable under section 170, and which was not taken into account— in computing the amount of the credit under this section (as in effect during the base period) during any taxable year in the base period, or as a basic research payment for purposes of this section.

qualified organization.rest: any of the following organizations: Any educational organization which— is an institution of higher education (within the meaning of section 3304(f)), and is described in section 170(b)(1)(A)(ii).
qualified organization.sentence: For purposes of this subsection, the term “qualified organization” means any of the following organizations: Any educational organization which— is an institution of higher education (within the meaning of section 3304(f)), and is described in section 170(b)(1)(A)(ii).

qualified organization base period amoun.rest: an amount equal to the sum of— the minimum basic research amount, plus the maintenance-of-effort amount.
qualified organization base period amoun.sentence: For purposes of this subsection, the term “qualified organization base period amount” means an amount equal to the sum of— the minimum basic research amount, plus the maintenance-of-effort amount.

qualified research.rest: research— with respect to which expenditures may be treated as expenses under section 174, which is undertaken for the purpose of discovering information— which is technological in nature, and the application of which is intended to be useful in the development of a new or improved business component of the taxpayer, and substantially all of the activities of which constitute elements of a process of experimentation for a purpose described in paragraph (3).
qualified research.sentence: For purposes of this section— The term “qualified research” means research— with respect to which expenditures may be treated as expenses under section 174, which is undertaken for the purpose of discovering information— which is technological in nature, and the application of which is intended to be useful in the development of a new or improved business component of the taxpayer, and substantially all of the activities of which constitute elements of a process of experimentation for a purpose described in paragraph (3).

qualified research consortium.rest: any organization which— is described in section 501(c)(3) or 501(c)(6) and is exempt from tax under section 501(a), is organized and operated primarily to conduct scientific research, and is not a private foundation.
qualified research consortium.sentence: The term “qualified research consortium” means any organization which— is described in section 501(c)(3) or 501(c)(6) and is exempt from tax under section 501(a), is organized and operated primarily to conduct scientific research, and is not a private foundation.

qualified research expenses.rest: the sum of the following amounts which are paid or incurred by the taxpayer during the taxable year in carrying on any trade or business of the taxpayer— in-house research expenses, and contract research expenses.
qualified research expenses.sentence: For purposes of this section— The term “qualified research expenses” means the sum of the following amounts which are paid or incurred by the taxpayer during the taxable year in carrying on any trade or business of the taxpayer— in-house research expenses, and contract research expenses.

qualified research#.rest: any of the following: Any research conducted after the beginning of commercial production of the business component.
qualified research#.sentence: The term “qualified research” shall not include any of the following: Any research conducted after the beginning of commercial production of the business component.

qualified services.rest: services consisting of— engaging in qualified research, or engaging in the direct supervision or direct support of research activities which constitute qualified research.
qualified services.sentence: The term “qualified services” means services consisting of— engaging in qualified research, or engaging in the direct supervision or direct support of research activities which constitute qualified research.

qualified services#.rest: all of the services performed by such individual for the taxpayer during the taxable year.
qualified services#.sentence: If substantially all of the services performed by an individual for the taxpayer during the taxable year consists of services meeting the requirements of clause (i) or (ii), the term “qualified services” means all of the services performed by such individual for the taxpayer during the taxable year.
