disqualification year.sentence: The term “disqualification year” means, with respect to any bank, the 1st taxable year beginning after December 31, 1986, for which such bank was a large bank if such bank maintained a reserve for bad debts for the preceding taxable year.

equity.rest: the equity of the bank as determined for Federal regulatory purposes.
equity.sentence: The term “equity” means the equity of the bank as determined for Federal regulatory purposes.

financially troubled bank.rest: any bank if, for the taxable year, the nonperforming loan percentage of such bank exceeds 75 percent.
financially troubled bank.sentence: For purposes of clause (i), the term “financially troubled bank” means any bank if, for the taxable year, the nonperforming loan percentage of such bank exceeds 75 percent.

nonperforming loan.rest: any loan which is considered to be nonperforming by the primary Federal regulatory agency with respect to the bank.
nonperforming loan.sentence: For purposes of this subparagraph— The term “nonperforming loan” means any loan which is considered to be nonperforming by the primary Federal regulatory agency with respect to the bank.

nonperforming loan percentage.rest: the percentage determined by dividing— the sum of the outstanding balances of nonperforming loans of the bank as of the close of each quarter of the taxable year, by the sum of the amounts of equity of the bank as of the close of each such quarter.
nonperforming loan percentage.sentence: For purposes of clause (iii), the term “nonperforming loan percentage” means the percentage determined by dividing— the sum of the outstanding balances of nonperforming loans of the bank as of the close of each quarter of the taxable year, by the sum of the amounts of equity of the bank as of the close of each such quarter.

parent-subsidiary controlled group.rest: any controlled group of corporations described in section 1563(a)(1).
parent-subsidiary controlled group.sentence: For purposes of this subsection— The term “parent-subsidiary controlled group” means any controlled group of corporations described in section 1563(a)(1).

greenmail.rest: any consideration transferred by a corporation (or any person acting in concert with such corporation) to directly or indirectly acquire stock of such corporation from any shareholder if— such shareholder held such stock (as determined under section 1223) for less than 2 years before entering into the agreement to make the transfer, at some time during the 2-year period ending on the date of such acquisition— such shareholder, any person acting in concert with such shareholder, or any person who is related to such shareholder or person described in subparagraph (B), made or threatened to make a public tender offer for stock of such corporation, and such acquisition is pursuant to an offer which was not made on the same terms to all shareholders.
greenmail.sentence: For purposes of this section, the term “greenmail” means any consideration transferred by a corporation (or any person acting in concert with such corporation) to directly or indirectly acquire stock of such corporation from any shareholder if— such shareholder held such stock (as determined under section 1223) for less than 2 years before entering into the agreement to make the transfer, at some time during the 2-year period ending on the date of such acquisition— such shareholder, any person acting in concert with such shareholder, or any person who is related to such shareholder or person described in subparagraph (B), made or threatened to make a public tender offer for stock of such corporation, and such acquisition is pursuant to an offer which was not made on the same terms to all shareholders.

public tender offer.rest: any offer to purchase or otherwise acquire stock or assets in a corporation if such offer was or would be required to be filed or registered with any Federal or State agency regulating securities.
public tender offer.sentence: For purposes of this section— The term “public tender offer” means any offer to purchase or otherwise acquire stock or assets in a corporation if such offer was or would be required to be filed or registered with any Federal or State agency regulating securities.

State.rest: the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico and any possession of the United States.
State.sentence: The term “State” includes the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico and any possession of the United States.

applicable State court.rest: , with respect to any applicable State statute, a court of the State which enacted such statute.
applicable State court.sentence: For purposes of this section— The term “applicable State court” means, with respect to any applicable State statute, a court of the State which enacted such statute.

applicable State statute.rest: a statute providing for the entry of an order, judgment, or decree described in paragraph (2)(A) which is enacted by— the State in which the payee of the structured settlement is domiciled, or if there is no statute described in subparagraph (A), the State in which either the party to the structured settlement (including an assignee under a qualified assignment under section 130) or the person issuing the funding asset for the structured settlement is domiciled or has its principal place of business.
applicable State statute.sentence: For purposes of this section, the term “applicable State statute” means a statute providing for the entry of an order, judgment, or decree described in paragraph (2)(A) which is enacted by— the State in which the payee of the structured settlement is domiciled, or if there is no statute described in subparagraph (A), the State in which either the party to the structured settlement (including an assignee under a qualified assignment under section 130) or the person issuing the funding asset for the structured settlement is domiciled or has its principal place of business.

factoring discount.rest: an amount equal to the excess of— the aggregate undiscounted amount of structured settlement payments being acquired in the structured settlement factoring transaction, over the total amount actually paid by the acquirer to the person from whom such structured settlement payments are acquired.
factoring discount.sentence: The term “factoring discount” means an amount equal to the excess of— the aggregate undiscounted amount of structured settlement payments being acquired in the structured settlement factoring transaction, over the total amount actually paid by the acquirer to the person from whom such structured settlement payments are acquired.

qualified order.rest: a final order, judgment, or decree which— finds that the transfer described in paragraph (1)— does not contravene any Federal or State statute or the order of any court or responsible administrative authority, and is in the best interest of the payee, taking into account the welfare and support of the payee’s dependents, and is issued— under the authority of an applicable State statute by an applicable State court, or by the responsible administrative authority (if any) which has exclusive jurisdiction over the underlying action or proceeding which was resolved by means of the structured settlement.
qualified order.sentence: For purposes of this section, the term “qualified order” means a final order, judgment, or decree which— finds that the transfer described in paragraph (1)— does not contravene any Federal or State statute or the order of any court or responsible administrative authority, and is in the best interest of the payee, taking into account the welfare and support of the payee’s dependents, and is issued— under the authority of an applicable State statute by an applicable State court, or by the responsible administrative authority (if any) which has exclusive jurisdiction over the underlying action or proceeding which was resolved by means of the structured settlement.

responsible administrative authority.rest: the administrative authority which had jurisdiction over the underlying action or proceeding which was resolved by means of the structured settlement.
responsible administrative authority.sentence: The term “responsible administrative authority” means the administrative authority which had jurisdiction over the underlying action or proceeding which was resolved by means of the structured settlement.

structured settlement.rest: an arrangement— which is established by— suit or agreement for the periodic payment of damages excludable from the gross income of the recipient under section 104(a)(2), or agreement for the periodic payment of compensation under any workers’ compensation law excludable from the gross income of the recipient under section 104(a)(1), and under which the periodic payments are— of the character described in subparagraphs (A) and (B) of section 130(c)(2), and payable by a person who is a party to the suit or agreement or to the workers’ compensation claim or by a person who has assumed the liability for such periodic payments under a qualified assignment in accordance with section 130.
structured settlement.sentence: For purposes of this section— The term “structured settlement” means an arrangement— which is established by— suit or agreement for the periodic payment of damages excludable from the gross income of the recipient under section 104(a)(2), or agreement for the periodic payment of compensation under any workers’ compensation law excludable from the gross income of the recipient under section 104(a)(1), and under which the periodic payments are— of the character described in subparagraphs (A) and (B) of section 130(c)(2), and payable by a person who is a party to the suit or agreement or to the workers’ compensation claim or by a person who has assumed the liability for such periodic payments under a qualified assignment in accordance with section 130.

structured settlement factoring transact.rest: a transfer of structured settlement payment rights (including portions of structured settlement payments) made for consideration by means of sale, assignment, pledge, or other form of encumbrance or alienation for consideration.
structured settlement factoring transact.sentence: The term “structured settlement factoring transaction” means a transfer of structured settlement payment rights (including portions of structured settlement payments) made for consideration by means of sale, assignment, pledge, or other form of encumbrance or alienation for consideration.

structured settlement payment rights.rest: rights to receive payments under a structured settlement.
structured settlement payment rights.sentence: The term “structured settlement payment rights” means rights to receive payments under a structured settlement.

differently treated item.rest: any item of tax preference or any other item which is treated differently for purposes of this part than for purposes of computing the regular tax.
differently treated item.sentence: For purposes of this section, the term “differently treated item” means any item of tax preference or any other item which is treated differently for purposes of this part than for purposes of computing the regular tax.

pre-credit tentative minimum tax.rest: — in the case of a taxpayer other than a corporation, the amount determined under the first sentence of section 55(b)(1)(A)(i), or in the case of a corporation, the amount determined under section 55(b)(1)(B)(i).
pre-credit tentative minimum tax.sentence: For purposes of this subsection, the term “pre-credit tentative minimum tax” means— in the case of a taxpayer other than a corporation, the amount determined under the first sentence of section 55(b)(1)(A)(i), or in the case of a corporation, the amount determined under section 55(b)(1)(B)(i).

qualified expenditure.rest: any amount which, but for an election under this subsection, would have been allowable as a deduction (determined without regard to section 291) for the taxable year in which paid or incurred under— section 173 (relating to circulation expenditures), section 174(a) (relating to research and experimental expenditures), section 263(c) (relating to intangible drilling and development expenditures), section 616(a) (relating to development expenditures), or section 617(a) (relating to mining exploration expenditures).
qualified expenditure.sentence: For purposes of this subsection, the term “qualified expenditure” means any amount which, but for an election under this subsection, would have been allowable as a deduction (determined without regard to section 291) for the taxable year in which paid or incurred under— section 173 (relating to circulation expenditures), section 174(a) (relating to research and experimental expenditures), section 263(c) (relating to intangible drilling and development expenditures), section 616(a) (relating to development expenditures), or section 617(a) (relating to mining exploration expenditures).

mutual savings bank.rest: any bank— which has capital stock represented by shares, and which is subject to, and operates under, Federal or State laws relating to mutual savings bank.
mutual savings bank.sentence: For purposes of this part, the term “mutual savings bank” includes any bank— which has capital stock represented by shares, and which is subject to, and operates under, Federal or State laws relating to mutual savings bank.

affiliated group.rest: assigned to such term by section 1504(a); except that (i) the phrase “more than 50 percent” shall be substituted for the phrase “at least 80 percent” each place it appears in section 1504(a), and (ii) all corporations shall be treated as includible corporations (without any exclusion under section 1504(b)).
affiliated group.sentence: For purposes of subparagraph (B)(iii), the term “affiliated group” has the meaning assigned to such term by section 1504(a); except that (i) the phrase “more than 50 percent” shall be substituted for the phrase “at least 80 percent” each place it appears in section 1504(a), and (ii) all corporations shall be treated as includible corporations (without any exclusion under section 1504(b)).

applicable excess reserves.rest: the excess (if any) of— the balance of the reserves described in subsection (c)(1) (other than the supplemental reserve) as of the close of the taxpayer’s last taxable year beginning before January 1, 1996, over the lesser of— the balance of such reserves as of the close of the taxpayer’s last taxable year beginning before January 1, 1988, or the balance of the reserves described in subclause (I), reduced in the same manner as under section 585(b)(2)(B)(ii) on the basis of the taxable years described in clause (i) and this clause.
applicable excess reserves.sentence: For purposes of paragraph (1), the term “applicable excess reserves” means the excess (if any) of— the balance of the reserves described in subsection (c)(1) (other than the supplemental reserve) as of the close of the taxpayer’s last taxable year beginning before January 1, 1996, over the lesser of— the balance of such reserves as of the close of the taxpayer’s last taxable year beginning before January 1, 1988, or the balance of the reserves described in subclause (I), reduced in the same manner as under section 585(b)(2)(B)(ii) on the basis of the taxable years described in clause (i) and this clause.

loan.rest: debt, as the term “debt” is used in section 166.
loan.sentence: The term “loan” means debt, as the term “debt” is used in section 166.

nonqualifying loan.rest: any loan which is not a qualifying real property loan.
nonqualifying loan.sentence: The term “nonqualifying loan” means any loan which is not a qualifying real property loan.

qualifying real property loan.rest: any loan secured by an interest in improved real property or secured by an interest in real property which is to be improved out of the proceeds of the loan, but such term does not include— any loan evidenced by a security (as defined in section 165(g)(2)(C)); any loan, whether or not evidenced by a security (as defined in section 165(g)(2)(C)), the primary obligor on which is— a government or political subdivision or instrumentality thereof; a bank (as defined in section 581); or another member of the same affiliated group; any loan, to the extent secured by a deposit in or share of the taxpayer; or any loan which, within a 60-day period beginning in one taxable year of the creditor and ending in its next taxable year, is made or acquired and then repaid or disposed of, unless the transactions by which such loan was made or acquired and then repaid or disposed of are established to be for bona fide business purposes.
qualifying real property loan.sentence: For purposes of this section— The term “qualifying real property loan” means any loan secured by an interest in improved real property or secured by an interest in real property which is to be improved out of the proceeds of the loan, but such term does not include— any loan evidenced by a security (as defined in section 165(g)(2)(C)); any loan, whether or not evidenced by a security (as defined in section 165(g)(2)(C)), the primary obligor on which is— a government or political subdivision or instrumentality thereof; a bank (as defined in section 581); or another member of the same affiliated group; any loan, to the extent secured by a deposit in or share of the taxpayer; or any loan which, within a 60-day period beginning in one taxable year of the creditor and ending in its next taxable year, is made or acquired and then repaid or disposed of, unless the transactions by which such loan was made or acquired and then repaid or disposed of are established to be for bona fide business purposes.

residential loan.rest: any loan described in clause (v) of section 7701(a)(19)(C) but only if such loan is incurred in acquiring, constructing, or improving the property described in such clause.
residential loan.sentence: For purposes of this paragraph, the term “residential loan” means any loan described in clause (v) of section 7701(a)(19)(C) but only if such loan is incurred in acquiring, constructing, or improving the property described in such clause.

Federal financial assistance.rest: — any money or other property provided with respect to a domestic building and loan association by the Federal Savings and Loan Insurance Corporation or the Resolution Trust Corporation pursuant to section 406(f) of the National Housing Act or section 21A 11 See References in Text note below.
Federal financial assistance.sentence: For purposes of this section, the term “Federal financial assistance” means— any money or other property provided with respect to a domestic building and loan association by the Federal Savings and Loan Insurance Corporation or the Resolution Trust Corporation pursuant to section 406(f) of the National Housing Act or section 21A 11 See References in Text note below.

domestic building and loan association.rest: given such term by section 7701(a)(19) without regard to subparagraph (C) thereof.
domestic building and loan association.sentence: For purposes of this section, the term “domestic building and loan association” has the meaning given such term by section 7701(a)(19) without regard to subparagraph (C) thereof.

individual income tax return.rest: any return of the tax imposed by subtitle A on individuals, estates, or trusts.
individual income tax return.sentence: For purposes of this paragraph, the term “individual income tax return” means any return of the tax imposed by subtitle A on individuals, estates, or trusts.

specified tax return preparer.rest: , with respect to any calendar year, any tax return preparer unless such preparer reasonably expects to file 10 or fewer individual income tax returns during such calendar year.
specified tax return preparer.sentence: For purposes of this paragraph, the term “specified tax return preparer” means, with respect to any calendar year, any tax return preparer unless such preparer reasonably expects to file 10 or fewer individual income tax returns during such calendar year.

exemption amount.sentence: The term “exemption amount” has the meaning given such term by section 151(d).

exemption amount.rest: given to such term by section 151(d).
exemption amount.sentence: For purposes of this subparagraph, the term “exemption amount” has the meaning given to such term by section 151(d).

return.rest: a separate return filed by a spouse with respect to a taxable year for which a joint return is made under this subsection after the filing of such separate return.
return.sentence: For purposes of section 7206(1) and (2) and section 7207 (relating to criminal penalties in the case of fraudulent returns) the term “return” includes a separate return filed by a spouse with respect to a taxable year for which a joint return is made under this subsection after the filing of such separate return.

disqualified asset.rest: any property or right to property transferred to an individual making the election under this subsection with respect to a joint return by the other individual filing such joint return if the principal purpose of the transfer was the avoidance of tax or payment of tax.
disqualified asset.sentence: For purposes of this paragraph— The term “disqualified asset” means any property or right to property transferred to an individual making the election under this subsection with respect to a joint return by the other individual filing such joint return if the principal purpose of the transfer was the avoidance of tax or payment of tax.

understatement.rest: given to such term by section 6662(d)(2)(A).
understatement.sentence: For purposes of this subsection, the term “understatement” has the meaning given to such term by section 6662(d)(2)(A).

applicable entity.rest: the estate or trust of which the taxpayer is the beneficiary.
applicable entity.sentence: The term “applicable entity” means the estate or trust of which the taxpayer is the beneficiary.

reported item.rest: any item for which information is required to be furnished under subsection (a).
reported item.sentence: For purposes of this subsection— The term “reported item” means any item for which information is required to be furnished under subsection (a).

subchapter S item.rest: any item of an S corporation to the extent that regulations prescribed by the Secretary provide that, for purposes of this subtitle, such item is more appropriately determined at the corporation level than at the shareholder level.
subchapter S item.sentence: For purposes of this subsection, the term “subchapter S item” means any item of an S corporation to the extent that regulations prescribed by the Secretary provide that, for purposes of this subtitle, such item is more appropriately determined at the corporation level than at the shareholder level.

foreign business entity.rest: a foreign corporation and a foreign partnership.
foreign business entity.sentence: For purposes of this section— The term “foreign business entity” means a foreign corporation and a foreign partnership.

United States person.rest: given to such term by section 7701(a)(30), except that any individual who is a citizen of any possession of the United States (but not otherwise a citizen of the United States) and who is not a resident of the United States shall not be treated as a United States person.
United States person.sentence: For purposes of the preceding sentence, the term “United States person” has the meaning given to such term by section 7701(a)(30), except that any individual who is a citizen of any possession of the United States (but not otherwise a citizen of the United States) and who is not a resident of the United States shall not be treated as a United States person.

affected taxable year.rest: any taxable year if the determination of the amount of tax imposed for such taxable year is affected by the treatment of the transaction to which the summons relates.
affected taxable year.sentence: For purposes of this subparagraph, the term “affected taxable year” means any taxable year if the determination of the amount of tax imposed for such taxable year is affected by the treatment of the transaction to which the summons relates.

foreign person.rest: any person who is not a United States person.
foreign person.sentence: The term “foreign person” means any person who is not a United States person.

records.rest: any books, papers, or other data.
records.sentence: The term “records” includes any books, papers, or other data.

related party.rest: — any 25-percent foreign shareholder of the reporting corporation, any person who is related (within the meaning of section 267(b) or 707(b)(1)) to the reporting corporation or to a 25-percent foreign shareholder of the reporting corporation, and any other person who is related (within the meaning of section 482) to the reporting corporation.
related party.sentence: The term “related party” means— any 25-percent foreign shareholder of the reporting corporation, any person who is related (within the meaning of section 267(b) or 707(b)(1)) to the reporting corporation or to a 25-percent foreign shareholder of the reporting corporation, and any other person who is related (within the meaning of section 482) to the reporting corporation.

specified foreign financial asset.rest: — any financial account (as defined in section 1471(d)(2)) maintained by a foreign financial institution (as defined in section 1471(d)(4)), and any of the following assets which are not held in an account maintained by a financial institution (as defined in section 1471(d)(5))— any stock or security issued by a person other than a United States person, any financial instrument or contract held for investment that has an issuer or counterparty which is other than a United States person, and any interest in a foreign entity (as defined in section 1473).
specified foreign financial asset.sentence: For purposes of this section, the term “specified foreign financial asset” means— any financial account (as defined in section 1471(d)(2)) maintained by a foreign financial institution (as defined in section 1471(d)(4)), and any of the following assets which are not held in an account maintained by a financial institution (as defined in section 1471(d)(5))— any stock or security issued by a person other than a United States person, any financial instrument or contract held for investment that has an issuer or counterparty which is other than a United States person, and any interest in a foreign entity (as defined in section 1473).

United States real property interest.rest: given to such term by section 897(c).
United States real property interest.sentence: For purposes of this section— The term “United States real property interest” has the meaning given to such term by section 897(c).

foreign person.rest: any person who is not a United States person.
foreign person.sentence: The term “foreign person” means any person who is not a United States person.

applicable exclusion.rest: , with respect to any specified fringe benefit plan, the section specified under paragraph (1) under which benefits under such plan are excludable from gross income.
applicable exclusion.sentence: The term “applicable exclusion” means, with respect to any specified fringe benefit plan, the section specified under paragraph (1) under which benefits under such plan are excludable from gross income.

specified fringe benefit plan.sentence: For purposes of this section— The term “specified fringe benefit plan” means any plan under section 79, 105, 106, 125, 127, 129, or 137.

foreign gift.rest: any amount received from a person other than a United States person which the recipient treats as a gift or bequest.
foreign gift.sentence: For purposes of this section, the term “foreign gift” means any amount received from a person other than a United States person which the recipient treats as a gift or bequest.

person.rest: any governmental unit (and any agency or instrumentality thereof).
person.sentence: The term “person” includes any governmental unit (and any agency or instrumentality thereof).

service-recipient.rest: the person for whom the service is performed.
service-recipient.sentence: For purposes of the preceding sentence, the term “service-recipient” means the person for whom the service is performed.

dividend.rest: — any distribution by a corporation which is a dividend (as defined in section 316); and any payment made by a stockbroker to any person as a substitute for a dividend (as so defined).
dividend.sentence: For purposes of this section, the term “dividend” means— any distribution by a corporation which is a dividend (as defined in section 316); and any payment made by a stockbroker to any person as a substitute for a dividend (as so defined).

dividend#.rest: any distribution or payment— to the extent provided in regulations prescribed by the Secretary— by a foreign corporation, or to a foreign corporation, a nonresident alien, or a partnership not engaged in a trade or business in the United States and composed in whole or in part of nonresident aliens, or except to the extent otherwise provided in regulations prescribed by the Secretary, to any person described in section 6049(b)(4).
dividend#.sentence: For purposes of this section, the term “dividend” does not include any distribution or payment— to the extent provided in regulations prescribed by the Secretary— by a foreign corporation, or to a foreign corporation, a nonresident alien, or a partnership not engaged in a trade or business in the United States and composed in whole or in part of nonresident aliens, or except to the extent otherwise provided in regulations prescribed by the Secretary, to any person described in section 6049(b)(4).

taxable acquisition.rest: any acquisition by a corporation of stock in or property of another corporation if any shareholder of the acquired corporation is required to recognize gain (if any) as a result of such acquisition.
taxable acquisition.sentence: For purposes of this section, the term “taxable acquisition” means any acquisition by a corporation of stock in or property of another corporation if any shareholder of the acquired corporation is required to recognize gain (if any) as a result of such acquisition.

applicable date.rest: — January 1, 2011, in the case of any specified security which is stock in a corporation (other than any stock described in clause (ii)), January 1, 2012, in the case of any stock for which an average basis method is permissible under section 1012, and January 1, 2013, or such later date determined by the Secretary in the case of any other specified security.
applicable date.sentence: The term “applicable date” means— January 1, 2011, in the case of any specified security which is stock in a corporation (other than any stock described in clause (ii)), January 1, 2012, in the case of any stock for which an average basis method is permissible under section 1012, and January 1, 2013, or such later date determined by the Secretary in the case of any other specified security.

barter exchange.rest: any organization of members providing property or services who jointly contract to trade or barter such property or services.
barter exchange.sentence: The term “barter exchange” means any organization of members providing property or services who jointly contract to trade or barter such property or services.

broker.rest: — a dealer, a barter exchange, and any other person who (for a consideration) regularly acts as a middleman with respect to property or services.
broker.sentence: For purposes of this section— The term “broker” includes— a dealer, a barter exchange, and any other person who (for a consideration) regularly acts as a middleman with respect to property or services.

covered security.rest: any specified security acquired on or after the applicable date if such security— was acquired through a transaction in the account in which such security is held, or was transferred to such account from an account in which such security was a covered security, but only if the broker received a statement under section 6045A with respect to the transfer.
covered security.sentence: For purposes of this subsection— The term “covered security” means any specified security acquired on or after the applicable date if such security— was acquired through a transaction in the account in which such security is held, or was transferred to such account from an account in which such security was a covered security, but only if the broker received a statement under section 6045A with respect to the transfer.

customer.rest: any person for whom the broker has transacted any business.
customer.sentence: The term “customer” means any person for whom the broker has transacted any business.

person.rest: any governmental unit and any agency or instrumentality thereof.
person.sentence: The term “person” includes any governmental unit and any agency or instrumentality thereof.

real estate reporting person.rest: any of the following persons involved in a real estate transaction in the following order: the person (including any attorney or title company) responsible for closing the transaction, the mortgage lender, the seller’s broker, the buyer’s broker, or such other person designated in regulations prescribed by the Secretary.
real estate reporting person.sentence: For purposes of this subsection, the term “real estate reporting person” means any of the following persons involved in a real estate transaction in the following order: the person (including any attorney or title company) responsible for closing the transaction, the mortgage lender, the seller’s broker, the buyer’s broker, or such other person designated in regulations prescribed by the Secretary.

seller.rest: the person relinquishing the residence in an exchange.
seller.sentence: For purposes of this paragraph, the term “seller” includes the person relinquishing the residence in an exchange.

specified security.rest: — any share of stock in a corporation, any note, bond, debenture, or other evidence of indebtedness, any commodity, or contract or derivative with respect to such commodity, if the Secretary determines that adjusted basis reporting is appropriate for purposes of this subsection, and any other financial instrument with respect to which the Secretary determines that adjusted basis reporting is appropriate for purposes of this subsection.
specified security.sentence: The term “specified security” means— any share of stock in a corporation, any note, bond, debenture, or other evidence of indebtedness, any commodity, or contract or derivative with respect to such commodity, if the Secretary determines that adjusted basis reporting is appropriate for purposes of this subsection, and any other financial instrument with respect to which the Secretary determines that adjusted basis reporting is appropriate for purposes of this subsection.

applicable person.rest: — any broker (as defined in section 6045(c)(1)), and any other person as provided by the Secretary in regulations.
applicable person.sentence: For purposes of subsection (a), the term “applicable person” means— any broker (as defined in section 6045(c)(1)), and any other person as provided by the Secretary in regulations.

specified security.sentence: For purposes of this section, the term “specified security” has the meaning given such term by section 6045(g)(3)(B).

reportable event.rest: — the creation of any foreign trust by a United States person, the transfer of any money or property (directly or indirectly) to a foreign trust by a United States person, including a transfer by reason of death, and the death of a citizen or resident of the United States if— the decedent was treated as the owner of any portion of a foreign trust under the rules of subpart E of part I of subchapter J of chapter 1, or any portion of a foreign trust was included in the gross estate of the decedent.
reportable event.sentence: For purposes of this subsection— The term “reportable event” means— the creation of any foreign trust by a United States person, the transfer of any money or property (directly or indirectly) to a foreign trust by a United States person, including a transfer by reason of death, and the death of a citizen or resident of the United States if— the decedent was treated as the owner of any portion of a foreign trust under the rules of subpart E of part I of subchapter J of chapter 1, or any portion of a foreign trust was included in the gross estate of the decedent.

responsible party.rest: — the grantor in the case of the creation of an inter vivos trust, the transferor in the case of a reportable event described in paragraph (3)(A)(ii) other than a transfer by reason of death, and the executor of the decedent’s estate in any other case.
responsible party.sentence: For purposes of this subsection, the term “responsible party” means— the grantor in the case of the creation of an inter vivos trust, the transferor in the case of a reportable event described in paragraph (3)(A)(ii) other than a transfer by reason of death, and the executor of the decedent’s estate in any other case.

interest.rest: — interest on any obligation— issued in registered form, or of a type offered to the public, other than any obligation with a maturity (at issue) of not more than 1 year which is held by a corporation, interest on deposits with persons carrying on the banking business, amounts (whether or not designated as interest) paid by a mutual savings bank, savings and loan association, building and loan association, cooperative bank, homestead association, credit union, industrial loan association or bank, or similar organization, in respect of deposits, investment certificates, or withdrawable or repurchasable shares, interest on amounts held by an insurance company under an agreement to pay interest thereon, interest on deposits with brokers (as defined in section 6045(c)), interest paid on amounts held by investment companies (as defined in section 3 of the Investment Company Act of 1940 (15 U.S.C.
interest.sentence: For purposes of subsection (a), the term “interest” means— interest on any obligation— issued in registered form, or of a type offered to the public, other than any obligation with a maturity (at issue) of not more than 1 year which is held by a corporation, interest on deposits with persons carrying on the banking business, amounts (whether or not designated as interest) paid by a mutual savings bank, savings and loan association, building and loan association, cooperative bank, homestead association, credit union, industrial loan association or bank, or similar organization, in respect of deposits, investment certificates, or withdrawable or repurchasable shares, interest on amounts held by an insurance company under an agreement to pay interest thereon, interest on deposits with brokers (as defined in section 6045(c)), interest paid on amounts held by investment companies (as defined in section 3 of the Investment Company Act of 1940 (15 U.S.C.

interest#.rest: — interest on any obligation issued by a natural person, except to the extent otherwise provided in regulations— any amount paid to any person described in paragraph (4), or any amount described in paragraph (5), and except to the extent otherwise provided in regulations, any amount not described in subparagraph (B) of this paragraph which is income from sources outside the United States or which is paid by— a foreign government or international organization or any agency or instrumentality thereof, a foreign central bank of issue, a foreign corporation not engaged in a trade or business in the United States, a foreign corporation, the interest payments of which would be exempt from withholding under subchapter A of chapter 3 if paid to a person who is not a United States person, or a partnership not engaged in a trade or business in the United States and composed in whole of nonresident alien individuals and person described in clause (i), (ii), or (iii).
interest#.sentence: For purposes of subsection (a), the term “interest” does not include— interest on any obligation issued by a natural person, except to the extent otherwise provided in regulations— any amount paid to any person described in paragraph (4), or any amount described in paragraph (5), and except to the extent otherwise provided in regulations, any amount not described in subparagraph (B) of this paragraph which is income from sources outside the United States or which is paid by— a foreign government or international organization or any agency or instrumentality thereof, a foreign central bank of issue, a foreign corporation not engaged in a trade or business in the United States, a foreign corporation, the interest payments of which would be exempt from withholding under subchapter A of chapter 3 if paid to a person who is not a United States person, or a partnership not engaged in a trade or business in the United States and composed in whole of nonresident alien individuals and person described in clause (i), (ii), or (iii).

interest##.rest: amounts includible in gross income with respect to regular interests in REMIC’s (and such amounts shall be treated as paid when includible in gross income under section 860B(b)).
interest##.sentence: For purposes of subsection (a), the term “interest” includes amounts includible in gross income with respect to regular interests in REMIC’s (and such amounts shall be treated as paid when includible in gross income under section 860B(b)).

interest###.rest: amounts includible in gross income under section 54(g) or 1400N(l)(6) and such amounts shall be treated as paid on the credit allowance date (as defined in section 54(b)(4) or 1400N(l)(2)(D), as the case may be).
interest###.sentence: For purposes of subsection (a), the term “interest” includes amounts includible in gross income under section 54(g) or 1400N(l)(6) and such amounts shall be treated as paid on the credit allowance date (as defined in section 54(b)(4) or 1400N(l)(2)(D), as the case may be).

interest####.rest: amounts includible in gross income under section 54A and such amounts shall be treated as paid on the credit allowance date (as defined in section 54A(e)(1)).
interest####.sentence: For purposes of subsection (a), the term “interest” includes amounts includible in gross income under section 54A and such amounts shall be treated as paid on the credit allowance date (as defined in section 54A(e)(1)).

obligation.rest: bonds, debentures, notes, certificates, and other evidences of indebtedness.
obligation.sentence: The term “obligation” includes bonds, debentures, notes, certificates, and other evidences of indebtedness.

original issue discount.rest: given to such term by section 1273(a).
original issue discount.sentence: For purposes of this paragraph, the term “original issue discount” has the meaning given to such term by section 1273(a).

person.rest: any governmental unit and any agency or instrumentality thereof and any international organization and any agency or instrumentality thereof.
person.sentence: For purposes of this section— The term “person” includes any governmental unit and any agency or instrumentality thereof and any international organization and any agency or instrumentality thereof.

person.rest: the officer or employee having control of the payment of the unemployment compensation, or the person appropriately designated for purposes of this section.
person.sentence: The term “person” means the officer or employee having control of the payment of the unemployment compensation, or the person appropriately designated for purposes of this section.

unemployment compensation.rest: given to such term by section 85(b).
unemployment compensation.sentence: For purposes of this section— The term “unemployment compensation” has the meaning given to such term by section 85(b).

person.rest: the officer or employee having control of the program, or the person appropriately designated for purposes of this section.
person.sentence: For purposes of this section, the term “person” means the officer or employee having control of the program, or the person appropriately designated for purposes of this section.

person.rest: the officer or employee having control of the payment of the refunds (or the allowance of the credits or offsets) or the person appropriately designated for purposes of this section.
person.sentence: For purposes of this section, the term “person” means the officer or employee having control of the payment of the refunds (or the allowance of the credits or offsets) or the person appropriately designated for purposes of this section.

appropriate Federal official.rest: — the Commissioner of Social Security in the case of social security benefits described in section 86(d)(1)(A), and the Railroad Retirement Board in the case of social security benefits described in section 86(d)(1)(B).
appropriate Federal official.sentence: For purposes of this section The term “appropriate Federal official” means— the Commissioner of Social Security in the case of social security benefits described in section 86(d)(1)(A), and the Railroad Retirement Board in the case of social security benefits described in section 86(d)(1)(B).

social security benefit.rest: given to such term by section 86(d)(1).
social security benefit.sentence: The term “social security benefit” has the meaning given to such term by section 86(d)(1).

mortgage.rest: any obligation secured by real property.
mortgage.sentence: For purposes of this section, except as provided in regulations prescribed by the Secretary, the term “mortgage” means any obligation secured by real property.

mortgage insurance.rest: — mortgage insurance provided by the Veterans Administration, the Federal Housing Administration, or the Rural Housing Administration, and private mortgage insurance (as defined by section 2 of the Homeowners Protection Act of 1998 (12 U.S.C.
mortgage insurance.sentence: For purposes of this subsection— rules similar to the rules of subsection (c) shall apply, and the term “mortgage insurance” means— mortgage insurance provided by the Veterans Administration, the Federal Housing Administration, or the Rural Housing Administration, and private mortgage insurance (as defined by section 2 of the Homeowners Protection Act of 1998 (12 U.S.C.

person.rest: any governmental unit (and any agency or instrumentality thereof).
person.sentence: For purposes of subsection (a)— The term “person” includes any governmental unit (and any agency or instrumentality thereof).

cash.rest: — foreign currency, and to the extent provided in regulations prescribed by the Secretary, any monetary instrument (whether or not in bearer form) with a face amount of not more than $10,000.
cash.sentence: For purposes of this section, the term “cash” includes— foreign currency, and to the extent provided in regulations prescribed by the Secretary, any monetary instrument (whether or not in bearer form) with a face amount of not more than $10,000.

specified criminal offense.rest: — any Federal criminal offense involving a controlled substance, racketeering (as defined in section 1951, 1952, or 1955 of title 18, United States Code), money laundering (as defined in section 1956 or 1957 of such title), and any State criminal offense substantially similar to an offense described in subparagraph (A), (B), or (C).
specified criminal offense.sentence: For purposes of this subsection, the term “specified criminal offense” means— any Federal criminal offense involving a controlled substance, racketeering (as defined in section 1951, 1952, or 1955 of title 18, United States Code), money laundering (as defined in section 1956 or 1957 of such title), and any State criminal offense substantially similar to an offense described in subparagraph (A), (B), or (C).

person.rest: any governmental unit (and any agency or instrumentality thereof).
person.sentence: For purposes of this section— The term “person” includes any governmental unit (and any agency or instrumentality thereof).

charitable deduction property.rest: any property (other than publicly traded securities) contributed in a contribution for which a deduction was claimed under section 170 if the claimed value of such property (plus the claimed value of all similar items of property donated by the donor to 1 or more donees) exceeds $5,000.
charitable deduction property.sentence: For purposes of this subsection: The term “charitable deduction property” means any property (other than publicly traded securities) contributed in a contribution for which a deduction was claimed under section 170 if the claimed value of such property (plus the claimed value of all similar items of property donated by the donor to 1 or more donees) exceeds $5,000.

publicly traded securities.rest: securities for which (as of the date of the contribution) market quotations are readily available on an established securities market.
publicly traded securities.sentence: The term “publicly traded securities” means securities for which (as of the date of the contribution) market quotations are readily available on an established securities market.

specified taxable year.rest: , with respect to any qualified intellectual property contribution, any taxable year of the donee any portion of which is part of the 10-year period beginning on the date of such contribution.
specified taxable year.sentence: The term “specified taxable year” means, with respect to any qualified intellectual property contribution, any taxable year of the donee any portion of which is part of the 10-year period beginning on the date of such contribution.

Federal executive agency.rest: — any Executive agency (as defined in section 105 of title 5, United States Code) other than the Government Accountability Office, any military department (as defined in section 102 of such title), and the United States Postal Service and the Postal Regulatory Commission.
Federal executive agency.sentence: For purposes of this section, the term “Federal executive agency” means— any Executive agency (as defined in section 105 of title 5, United States Code) other than the Government Accountability Office, any military department (as defined in section 102 of such title), and the United States Postal Service and the Postal Regulatory Commission.

applicable entity.rest: — an executive, judicial, or legislative agency (as defined in section 3701(a)(4) of title 31, United States Code), and an applicable financial entity.
applicable entity.sentence: For purposes of this section— The term “applicable entity” means— an executive, judicial, or legislative agency (as defined in section 3701(a)(4) of title 31, United States Code), and an applicable financial entity.

applicable financial entity.rest: — any financial institution described in section 581 or 591(a) and any credit union, the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation, the Resolution Trust Corporation, the National Credit Union Administration, and any other Federal executive agency (as defined in section 6050M), and any successor or subunit of any of the foregoing, any other corporation which is a direct or indirect subsidiary of an entity referred to in subparagraph (A) but only if, by virtue of being affiliated with such entity, such other corporation is subject to supervision and examination by a Federal or State agency which regulates entities referred to in subparagraph (A), and any organization a significant trade or business of which is the lending of money.
applicable financial entity.sentence: The term “applicable financial entity” means— any financial institution described in section 581 or 591(a) and any credit union, the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation, the Resolution Trust Corporation, the National Credit Union Administration, and any other Federal executive agency (as defined in section 6050M), and any successor or subunit of any of the foregoing, any other corporation which is a direct or indirect subsidiary of an entity referred to in subparagraph (A) but only if, by virtue of being affiliated with such entity, such other corporation is subject to supervision and examination by a Federal or State agency which regulates entities referred to in subparagraph (A), and any organization a significant trade or business of which is the lending of money.

long-term care benefit.rest: — any payment under a product which is advertised, marketed, or offered as long-term care insurance, and any payment which is excludable from gross income by reason of section 101(g).
long-term care benefit.sentence: For purposes of this section, the term “long-term care benefit” means— any payment under a product which is advertised, marketed, or offered as long-term care insurance, and any payment which is excludable from gross income by reason of section 101(g).

cash.sentence: For purposes of this section: The term “cash” has the meaning given such term by section 6050I(d).

fish.sentence: The term “fish” includes other forms of aquatic life.

qualified education loan.sentence: For purposes of this section, the terms “eligible educational institution” and “qualified tuition and related expenses” have the meanings given such terms by section 25A (without regard to subsection (g)(2) thereof), and except as provided in regulations, the term “qualified education loan” has the meaning given such term by section 221(d)(1).

applicable exempt organization.rest: — an organization described in section 170(c), an organization described in section 168(h)(2)(A)(iv), or an organization not described in paragraph (1) or (2) which is described in section 2055(a) or section 2522(a).
applicable exempt organization.sentence: The term “applicable exempt organization” means— an organization described in section 170(c), an organization described in section 168(h)(2)(A)(iv), or an organization not described in paragraph (1) or (2) which is described in section 2055(a) or section 2522(a).

applicable insurance contract.rest: any life insurance, annuity, or endowment contract with respect to which both an applicable exempt organization and a person other than an applicable exempt organization have directly or indirectly held an interest in the contract (whether or not at the same time).
applicable insurance contract.sentence: The term “applicable insurance contract” means any life insurance, annuity, or endowment contract with respect to which both an applicable exempt organization and a person other than an applicable exempt organization have directly or indirectly held an interest in the contract (whether or not at the same time).

reportable acquisition.rest: the acquisition by an applicable exempt organization of a direct or indirect interest in any applicable insurance contract in any case in which such acquisition is a part of a structured transaction involving a pool of such contracts.
reportable acquisition.sentence: For purposes of this section— The term “reportable acquisition” means the acquisition by an applicable exempt organization of a direct or indirect interest in any applicable insurance contract in any case in which such acquisition is a part of a structured transaction involving a pool of such contracts.

merchant acquiring entity.rest: the bank or other organization which has the contractual obligation to make payment to participating payees in settlement of payment card transactions.
merchant acquiring entity.sentence: The term “merchant acquiring entity” means the bank or other organization which has the contractual obligation to make payment to participating payees in settlement of payment card transactions.

participating payee.rest: — in the case of a payment card transaction, any person who accepts a payment card as payment, and in the case of a third party network transaction, any person who accepts payment from a third party settlement organization in settlement of such transaction.
participating payee.sentence: For purposes of this section— The term “participating payee” means— in the case of a payment card transaction, any person who accepts a payment card as payment, and in the case of a third party network transaction, any person who accepts payment from a third party settlement organization in settlement of such transaction.

payment card.rest: any card which is issued pursuant to an agreement or arrangement which provides for— one or more issuers of such cards, a network of persons unrelated to each other, and to the issuer, who agree to accept such cards as payment, and standards and mechanisms for settling the transactions between the merchant acquiring entities and the persons who agree to accept such cards as payment.
payment card.sentence: The term “payment card” means any card which is issued pursuant to an agreement or arrangement which provides for— one or more issuers of such cards, a network of persons unrelated to each other, and to the issuer, who agree to accept such cards as payment, and standards and mechanisms for settling the transactions between the merchant acquiring entities and the persons who agree to accept such cards as payment.

payment card transaction.rest: any transaction in which a payment card is accepted as payment.
payment card transaction.sentence: The term “payment card transaction” means any transaction in which a payment card is accepted as payment.

payment settlement entity.rest: — in the case of a payment card transaction, the merchant acquiring entity, and in the case of a third party network transaction, the third party settlement organization.
payment settlement entity.sentence: For purposes of this section— The term “payment settlement entity” means— in the case of a payment card transaction, the merchant acquiring entity, and in the case of a third party network transaction, the third party settlement organization.

person.rest: any governmental unit (and any agency or instrumentality thereof).
person.sentence: The term “person” includes any governmental unit (and any agency or instrumentality thereof).

reportable payment transaction.rest: any payment card transaction and any third party network transaction.
reportable payment transaction.sentence: For purposes of this section— The term “reportable payment transaction” means any payment card transaction and any third party network transaction.

third party network transaction.rest: any transaction which is settled through a third party payment network.
third party network transaction.sentence: The term “third party network transaction” means any transaction which is settled through a third party payment network.

third party payment network.rest: any agreement or arrangement— which involves the establishment of accounts with a central organization by a substantial number of persons who— are unrelated to such organization, provide goods or services, and have agreed to settle transactions for the provision of such goods or services pursuant to such agreement or arrangement, which provides for standards and mechanisms for settling such transactions, and which guarantees persons providing goods or services pursuant to such agreement or arrangement that such persons will be paid for providing such goods or services.
third party payment network.sentence: The term “third party payment network” means any agreement or arrangement— which involves the establishment of accounts with a central organization by a substantial number of persons who— are unrelated to such organization, provide goods or services, and have agreed to settle transactions for the provision of such goods or services pursuant to such agreement or arrangement, which provides for standards and mechanisms for settling such transactions, and which guarantees persons providing goods or services pursuant to such agreement or arrangement that such persons will be paid for providing such goods or services.

third party settlement organization.rest: the central organization which has the contractual obligation to make payment to participating payees of third party network transactions.
third party settlement organization.sentence: The term “third party settlement organization” means the central organization which has the contractual obligation to make payment to participating payees of third party network transactions.

third-party sick pay.rest: any sick pay (as defined in section 3402(o)(2)(C)) which does not constitute wages for purposes of chapter 24 (determined without regard to section 3402(o)(1)).
third-party sick pay.sentence: For purposes of the preceding sentence, the term “third-party sick pay” means any sick pay (as defined in section 3402(o)(2)(C)) which does not constitute wages for purposes of chapter 24 (determined without regard to section 3402(o)(1)).

large food or beverage establishment.rest: any trade or business (or portion thereof)— which provides food or beverages, with respect to which the tipping of employees serving food or beverages by customers is customary, and which normally employed more than 10 employees on a typical business day during the preceding calendar year.
large food or beverage establishment.sentence: For purposes of this subsection, the term “large food or beverage establishment” means any trade or business (or portion thereof)— which provides food or beverages, with respect to which the tipping of employees serving food or beverages by customers is customary, and which normally employed more than 10 employees on a typical business day during the preceding calendar year.

nonallocable receipts.rest: receipts which are allocable to— carryout sales, or services with respect to which a service charge of 10 percent or more is added.
nonallocable receipts.sentence: For purposes of this subsection, the term “nonallocable receipts” means receipts which are allocable to— carryout sales, or services with respect to which a service charge of 10 percent or more is added.

minimum essential coverage.sentence: For purposes of this section, the term “minimum essential coverage” has the meaning given such term by section 5000A(f).

employer.rest: a person described in section 401(c)(4) and an individual who establishes an individual retirement plan.
employer.sentence: For purposes of this section, the term “employer” includes a person described in section 401(c)(4) and an individual who establishes an individual retirement plan.

special IRP tax.rest: a tax imposed by— section 408(f),11 See References in Text note below.
special IRP tax.sentence: For purposes of this section, the term “special IRP tax” means a tax imposed by— section 408(f),11 See References in Text note below.

return period.rest: the 12-month period beginning on July 1 of each year.
return period.sentence: For purposes of subsection (a), the term “return period” means the 12-month period beginning on July 1 of each year.

Federal agency.rest: an agency within the meaning of section 551(1) of title 5, United States Code.
Federal agency.sentence: The term “Federal agency” means an agency within the meaning of section 551(1) of title 5, United States Code.

State.rest: — any of the 50 States, the District of Columbia, the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico, the Virgin Islands, Guam, American Samoa, and the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands, for purposes of subsections (a)(2), (b)(4), (d)(1), (h)(4), and (p), any municipality— with a population in excess of 250,000 (as determined under the most recent decennial United States census data available), which imposes a tax on income or wages, and with which the Secretary (in his sole discretion) has entered into an agreement regarding disclosure, and for purposes of subsections (a)(2), (b)(4), (d)(1), (h)(4), and (p), any governmental entity— which is formed and operated by a qualified group of municipalities, and with which the Secretary (in his sole discretion) has entered into an agreement regarding disclosure.
State.sentence: The term “State” means— any of the 50 States, the District of Columbia, the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico, the Virgin Islands, Guam, American Samoa, and the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands, for purposes of subsections (a)(2), (b)(4), (d)(1), (h)(4), and (p), any municipality— with a population in excess of 250,000 (as determined under the most recent decennial United States census data available), which imposes a tax on income or wages, and with which the Secretary (in his sole discretion) has entered into an agreement regarding disclosure, and for purposes of subsections (a)(2), (b)(4), (d)(1), (h)(4), and (p), any governmental entity— which is formed and operated by a qualified group of municipalities, and with which the Secretary (in his sole discretion) has entered into an agreement regarding disclosure.

State audit agency.rest: any State agency, body, or commission which is charged under the laws of the State with the responsibility of auditing State revenues and programs.
State audit agency.sentence: For purposes of subparagraph (A), the term “State audit agency” means any State agency, body, or commission which is charged under the laws of the State with the responsibility of auditing State revenues and programs.

State or local child support enforcement.rest: any agency of a State or political subdivision thereof operating pursuant to a plan described in subparagraph (B).
State or local child support enforcement.sentence: For purposes of this paragraph, the term “State or local child support enforcement agency” means any agency of a State or political subdivision thereof operating pursuant to a plan described in subparagraph (B).

applicable government payment.rest: — any Federal payment (other than a payment for which eligibility is based on the income or assets (or both) of a payee) certified to the Financial Management Service for disbursement, and any other payment which is certified to the Financial Management Service for disbursement and which the Secretary designates by published notice.
applicable government payment.sentence: For purposes of this paragraph, the term “applicable government payment” means— any Federal payment (other than a payment for which eligibility is based on the income or assets (or both) of a payee) certified to the Financial Management Service for disbursement, and any other payment which is certified to the Financial Management Service for disbursement and which the Secretary designates by published notice.

applicable student loan.rest: — any loan made under the program authorized under part D of title IV of the Higher Education Act of 1965, and any loan made under part B or E of title IV of the Higher Education Act of 1965 which is in default and has been assigned to the Department of Education.
applicable student loan.sentence: For purposes of this paragraph, the term “applicable student loan” means— any loan made under the program authorized under part D of title IV of the Higher Education Act of 1965, and any loan made under part B or E of title IV of the Higher Education Act of 1965 which is in default and has been assigned to the Department of Education.

applicable year.rest: the most recent taxable year for which information is available in the Internal Revenue Service’s taxpayer data information systems, or, if there is no return filed for such taxpayer for such year, the prior taxable year.
applicable year.sentence: For the purposes of this subsection, the term “applicable year” means the most recent taxable year for which information is available in the Internal Revenue Service’s taxpayer data information systems, or, if there is no return filed for such taxpayer for such year, the prior taxable year.

chief executive officer.rest: , with respect to any municipality, any elected official and the chief official (even if not elected) of such municipality.
chief executive officer.sentence: The term “chief executive officer” means, with respect to any municipality, any elected official and the chief official (even if not elected) of such municipality.

delinquent tax debt.rest: an outstanding debt under this title for which a notice of lien has been filed pursuant to section 6323, but the term does not include a debt that is being paid in a timely manner pursuant to an agreement under section 6159 or 7122, or a debt with respect to which a collection due process hearing under section 6330 is requested, pending, or completed and no payment is required.
delinquent tax debt.sentence: For purposes of this paragraph, the term “delinquent tax debt” means an outstanding debt under this title for which a notice of lien has been filed pursuant to section 6323, but the term does not include a debt that is being paid in a timely manner pursuant to an agreement under section 6159 or 7122, or a debt with respect to which a collection due process hearing under section 6330 is requested, pending, or completed and no payment is required.

disclosure.rest: the making known to any person in any manner whatever a return or return information.
disclosure.sentence: The term “disclosure” means the making known to any person in any manner whatever a return or return information.

exploited child.rest: a minor with respect to whom there is reason to believe that a specified offense against a minor (as defined by section 111(7) of the Sex Offender Registration and Notification Act (42 U.S.C.
exploited child.sentence: For purposes of this subparagraph, the term “exploited child” means a minor with respect to whom there is reason to believe that a specified offense against a minor (as defined by section 111(7) of the Sex Offender Registration and Notification Act (42 U.S.C.

group health plan.rest: any group health plan (as defined in section 5000(b)(1)).
group health plan.sentence: The term “group health plan” means any group health plan (as defined in section 5000(b)(1)).

included Federal loan program.rest: any program under which the United States or a Federal agency makes, guarantees, or insures loans.
included Federal loan program.sentence: For purposes of this paragraph, the term “included Federal loan program” means any program under which the United States or a Federal agency makes, guarantees, or insures loans.

medicare beneficiary.rest: an individual entitled to benefits under part A, or enrolled under part B, of title XVIII of the Social Security Act, but does not include such an individual enrolled in part A under section 1818.
medicare beneficiary.sentence: For purposes of this paragraph— The term “medicare beneficiary” means an individual entitled to benefits under part A, or enrolled under part B, of title XVIII of the Social Security Act, but does not include such an individual enrolled in part A under section 1818.

officer or employee.sentence: For purposes of this subsection, the term “officer or employee” includes a former officer or employee.

qualified employer.rest: , for a calendar year, an employer which has furnished written statements under section 6051 with respect to at least 20 individuals for wages paid in the year.
qualified employer.sentence: The term “qualified employer” means, for a calendar year, an employer which has furnished written statements under section 6051 with respect to at least 20 individuals for wages paid in the year.

qualified group of municipalities.rest: , with respect to any governmental entity, 2 or more municipalities— each of which imposes a tax on income or wages, each of which, under the authority of a State statute, administers the laws relating to the imposition of such taxes through such entity, and which collectively have a population in excess of 250,000 (as determined under the most recent decennial United States census data available).
qualified group of municipalities.sentence: For purposes of subparagraph (A)(iii)— The term “qualified group of municipalities” means, with respect to any governmental entity, 2 or more municipalities— each of which imposes a tax on income or wages, each of which, under the authority of a State statute, administers the laws relating to the imposition of such taxes through such entity, and which collectively have a population in excess of 250,000 (as determined under the most recent decennial United States census data available).

return.rest: any tax or information return, declaration of estimated tax, or claim for refund required by, or provided for or permitted under, the provisions of this title which is filed with the Secretary by, on behalf of, or with respect to any person, and any amendment or supplement thereto, including supporting schedules, attachments, or lists which are supplemental to, or part of, the return so filed.
return.sentence: For purposes of this section— The term “return” means any tax or information return, declaration of estimated tax, or claim for refund required by, or provided for or permitted under, the provisions of this title which is filed with the Secretary by, on behalf of, or with respect to any person, and any amendment or supplement thereto, including supporting schedules, attachments, or lists which are supplemental to, or part of, the return so filed.

return information.rest: — a taxpayer’s identity, the nature, source, or amount of his income, payments, receipts, deductions, exemptions, credits, assets, liabilities, net worth, tax liability, tax withheld, deficiencies, overassessments, or tax payments, whether the taxpayer’s return was, is being, or will be examined or subject to other investigation or processing, or any other data, received by, recorded by, prepared by, furnished to, or collected by the Secretary with respect to a return or with respect to the determination of the existence, or possible existence, of liability (or the amount thereof) of any person under this title for any tax, penalty, interest, fine, forfeiture, or other imposition, or offense, any part of any written determination or any background file document relating to such written determination (as such terms are defined in section 6110(b)) which is not open to public inspection under section 6110, any advance pricing agreement entered into by a taxpayer and the Secretary and any background information related to such agreement or any application for an advance pricing agreement, and any agreement under section 7121, and any similar agreement, and any background information related to such an agreement or request for such an agreement, but such term does not include data in a form which cannot be associated with, or otherwise identify, directly or indirectly, a particular taxpayer.
return information.sentence: The term “return information” means— a taxpayer’s identity, the nature, source, or amount of his income, payments, receipts, deductions, exemptions, credits, assets, liabilities, net worth, tax liability, tax withheld, deficiencies, overassessments, or tax payments, whether the taxpayer’s return was, is being, or will be examined or subject to other investigation or processing, or any other data, received by, recorded by, prepared by, furnished to, or collected by the Secretary with respect to a return or with respect to the determination of the existence, or possible existence, of liability (or the amount thereof) of any person under this title for any tax, penalty, interest, fine, forfeiture, or other imposition, or offense, any part of any written determination or any background file document relating to such written determination (as such terms are defined in section 6110(b)) which is not open to public inspection under section 6110, any advance pricing agreement entered into by a taxpayer and the Secretary and any background information related to such agreement or any application for an advance pricing agreement, and any agreement under section 7121, and any similar agreement, and any background information related to such an agreement or request for such an agreement, but such term does not include data in a form which cannot be associated with, or otherwise identify, directly or indirectly, a particular taxpayer.

return information#.rest: related blood donor records (as defined in section 1141(h)(2) of the Social Security Act).
return information#.sentence: For purposes of applying this paragraph in any case to which subsection (m)(6) applies, the term “return information” includes related blood donor records (as defined in section 1141(h)(2) of the Social Security Act).

taxpayer identity.rest: the name of a person with respect to whom a return is filed, his mailing address, his taxpayer identifying number (as described in section 6109), or a combination thereof.
taxpayer identity.sentence: The term “taxpayer identity” means the name of a person with respect to whom a return is filed, his mailing address, his taxpayer identifying number (as described in section 6109), or a combination thereof.

taxpayer return information.rest: return information as defined in paragraph (2) which is filed with, or furnished to, the Secretary by or on behalf of the taxpayer to whom such return information relates.
taxpayer return information.sentence: The term “taxpayer return information” means return information as defined in paragraph (2) which is filed with, or furnished to, the Secretary by or on behalf of the taxpayer to whom such return information relates.

terrorist incident, threat, or activity.rest: an incident, threat, or activity involving an act of domestic terrorism (as defined in section 2331(5) of title 18, United States Code) or international terrorism (as defined in section 2331(1) of such title).
terrorist incident, threat, or activity.sentence: The term “terrorist incident, threat, or activity” means an incident, threat, or activity involving an act of domestic terrorism (as defined in section 2331(5) of title 18, United States Code) or international terrorism (as defined in section 2331(1) of such title).

appropriate State officer.rest: — the State attorney general, the State tax officer, in the case of an organization to which paragraph (1) applies, any other State official charged with overseeing organizations of the type described in section 501(c)(3), and in the case of an organization to which paragraph (3) applies, the head of an agency designated by the State attorney general as having primary responsibility for overseeing the solicitation of funds for charitable purposes.
appropriate State officer.sentence: The term “appropriate State officer” means— the State attorney general, the State tax officer, in the case of an organization to which paragraph (1) applies, any other State official charged with overseeing organizations of the type described in section 501(c)(3), and in the case of an organization to which paragraph (3) applies, the head of an agency designated by the State attorney general as having primary responsibility for overseeing the solicitation of funds for charitable purposes.

exempt status application materials.rest: the application for recognition of exemption under section 501 and any papers submitted in support of such application and any letter or other document issued by the Internal Revenue Service with respect to such application.
exempt status application materials.sentence: For purposes of paragraph (1), the term “exempt status application materials” means the application for recognition of exemption under section 501 and any papers submitted in support of such application and any letter or other document issued by the Internal Revenue Service with respect to such application.

notice materials.rest: the notice of status filed under section 527(i) and any papers submitted in support of such notice and any letter or other document issued by the Internal Revenue Service with respect to such notice.
