clinic.sentence: The term “clinic” includes— a clinical program at an accredited law, business, or accounting school in which students represent low-income taxpayers in controversies arising under this title; and an organization described in section 501(c) and exempt from tax under section 501(a) which satisfies the requirements of paragraph (1) through representation of taxpayers or referral of taxpayers to qualified representatives.

qualified low-income taxpayer clinic.rest: a clinic that— does not charge more than a nominal fee for its services (except for reimbursement of actual costs incurred); and represents low-income taxpayers in controversies with the Internal Revenue Service; or operates programs to inform individuals for whom English is a second language about their rights and responsibilities under this title.
qualified low-income taxpayer clinic.sentence: For purposes of this section— The term “qualified low-income taxpayer clinic” means a clinic that— does not charge more than a nominal fee for its services (except for reimbursement of actual costs incurred); and represents low-income taxpayers in controversies with the Internal Revenue Service; or operates programs to inform individuals for whom English is a second language about their rights and responsibilities under this title.

qualified representative.rest: any individual (whether or not an attorney) who is authorized to practice before the Internal Revenue Service or the applicable court.
qualified representative.sentence: The term “qualified representative” means any individual (whether or not an attorney) who is authorized to practice before the Internal Revenue Service or the applicable court.

certified individual.rest: any individual for whom a qualified health insurance costs credit eligibility certificate is in effect.
certified individual.sentence: For purposes of this section, the term “certified individual” means any individual for whom a qualified health insurance costs credit eligibility certificate is in effect.

qualified health insurance costs eligibi.rest: any written statement that an individual is an eligible individual (as defined in section 35(c)) if such statement provides such information as the Secretary may require for purposes of this section and— in the case of an eligible TAA recipient (as defined in section 35(c)(2)) or an eligible alternative TAA recipient (as defined in section 35(c)(3)), is certified by the Secretary of Labor (or by any other person or entity designated by the Secretary), or in the case of an eligible PBGC pension recipient (as defined in section 35(c)(4)), is certified by the Pension Benefit Guaranty Corporation (or by any other person or entity designated by the Secretary).
qualified health insurance costs eligibi.sentence: For purposes of this section, the term “qualified health insurance costs eligibility certificate” means any written statement that an individual is an eligible individual (as defined in section 35(c)) if such statement provides such information as the Secretary may require for purposes of this section and— in the case of an eligible TAA recipient (as defined in section 35(c)(2)) or an eligible alternative TAA recipient (as defined in section 35(c)(3)), is certified by the Secretary of Labor (or by any other person or entity designated by the Secretary), or in the case of an eligible PBGC pension recipient (as defined in section 35(c)(4)), is certified by the Pension Benefit Guaranty Corporation (or by any other person or entity designated by the Secretary).

eligible employer.rest: an eligible employer (as defined in section 408(p)(2)(C)(i)(I)) which has at least 1 employee who is not a highly compensated employee (as defined in section 414(q)) and is participating in the plan.
eligible employer.sentence: The term “eligible employer” means an eligible employer (as defined in section 408(p)(2)(C)(i)(I)) which has at least 1 employee who is not a highly compensated employee (as defined in section 414(q)) and is participating in the plan.

pension benefit plan.rest: a pension, profit-sharing, stock bonus, annuity, or employee stock ownership plan.
pension benefit plan.sentence: For purposes of subparagraph (B)— The term “pension benefit plan” means a pension, profit-sharing, stock bonus, annuity, or employee stock ownership plan.

third-party recordkeeper.rest: — any mutual savings bank, cooperative bank, domestic building and loan association, or other savings institution chartered and supervised as a savings and loan or similar association under Federal or State law, any bank (as defined in section 581), or any credit union (within the meaning of section 501(c)(14)(A)), any consumer reporting agency (as defined under section 603(f) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act (15 U.S.C.
third-party recordkeeper.sentence: For purposes of paragraph (1), the term “third-party recordkeeper” means— any mutual savings bank, cooperative bank, domestic building and loan association, or other savings institution chartered and supervised as a savings and loan or similar association under Federal or State law, any bank (as defined in section 581), or any credit union (within the meaning of section 501(c)(14)(A)), any consumer reporting agency (as defined under section 603(f) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act (15 U.S.C.

closed.rest: the date on which the later of the following occurs; all criminal proceedings (other than appeals) are concluded, or covert activities are concluded, whichever occurs later.
closed.sentence: For purposes of paragraph (4)— The term “closed” means the date on which the later of the following occurs; all criminal proceedings (other than appeals) are concluded, or covert activities are concluded, whichever occurs later.

employees.rest: given such term by section 2105 of title 5, United States Code.
employees.sentence: The term “employees” has the meaning given such term by section 2105 of title 5, United States Code.

undercover investigative operation.rest: any undercover investigative operation of the Service; except that, for purposes of subparagraphs (A) and (C) of paragraph (4), such term only includes an operation which is exempt from section 3302 or 9102 of title 31, United States Code.
undercover investigative operation.sentence: The term “undercover investigative operation” means any undercover investigative operation of the Service; except that, for purposes of subparagraphs (A) and (C) of paragraph (4), such term only includes an operation which is exempt from section 3302 or 9102 of title 31, United States Code.

records.sentence: For purposes of this section, the term “records” includes books, papers, and other data.

liquidation of a partner\u2019s interest.rest: the termination of a partner’s entire interest in a partnership by means of a distribution, or a series of distributions, to the partner by the partnership.
liquidation of a partner\u2019s interest.sentence: For purposes of this subchapter, the term “liquidation of a partner’s interest” means the termination of a partner’s entire interest in a partnership by means of a distribution, or a series of distributions, to the partner by the partnership.

partner.sentence: For purposes of this subtitle, the term “partner” means a member of a partnership.

partnership.rest: a syndicate, group, pool, joint venture, or other unincorporated organization through or by means of which any business, financial operation, or venture is carried on, and which is not, within the meaning of this title, a corporation or a trust or estate.
partnership.sentence: For purposes of this subtitle, the term “partnership” includes a syndicate, group, pool, joint venture, or other unincorporated organization through or by means of which any business, financial operation, or venture is carried on, and which is not, within the meaning of this title, a corporation or a trust or estate.

qualified joint venture.rest: any joint venture involving the conduct of a trade or business if— the only members of such joint venture are a husband and wife, both spouses materially participate (within the meaning of section 469(h) without regard to paragraph (5) thereof) in such trade or business, and both spouses elect the application of this subsection.
qualified joint venture.sentence: For purposes of paragraph (1), the term “qualified joint venture” means any joint venture involving the conduct of a trade or business if— the only members of such joint venture are a husband and wife, both spouses materially participate (within the meaning of section 469(h) without regard to paragraph (5) thereof) in such trade or business, and both spouses elect the application of this subsection.

applicable 5-year period.rest: the 5-year period beginning on the date the notice taken into account for purposes of subsection (c)(1) was provided.
applicable 5-year period.sentence: For purposes of paragraph (1), the term “applicable 5-year period” means the 5-year period beginning on the date the notice taken into account for purposes of subsection (c)(1) was provided.

appropriate high-level Treasury official.rest: the Secretary of the Treasury or any delegate of the Secretary whose rank is no lower than that of a principal Internal Revenue officer for an internal revenue region.
appropriate high-level Treasury official.sentence: The term “appropriate high-level Treasury official” means the Secretary of the Treasury or any delegate of the Secretary whose rank is no lower than that of a principal Internal Revenue officer for an internal revenue region.

church.rest: — any organization claiming to be a church, and any convention or association of churches.
church.sentence: For purposes of this section— The term “church” includes— any organization claiming to be a church, and any convention or association of churches.

church records.rest: all corporate and financial records regularly kept by a church, including corporate minute books and lists of members and contributors.
church records.sentence: The term “church records” means all corporate and financial records regularly kept by a church, including corporate minute books and lists of members and contributors.

church tax examination.rest: any examination for purposes of making a determination described in paragraph (2) of— church records at the request of the Internal Revenue Service, or the religious activities of any church.
church tax examination.sentence: The term “church tax examination” means any examination for purposes of making a determination described in paragraph (2) of— church records at the request of the Internal Revenue Service, or the religious activities of any church.

church tax inquiry.rest: any inquiry to a church (other than an examination) to serve as a basis for determining whether a church— is exempt from tax under section 501(a) by reason of its status as a church, or is carrying on an unrelated trade or business (within the meaning of section 513) or otherwise engaged in activities which may be subject to taxation under this title.
church tax inquiry.sentence: The term “church tax inquiry” means any inquiry to a church (other than an examination) to serve as a basis for determining whether a church— is exempt from tax under section 501(a) by reason of its status as a church, or is carrying on an unrelated trade or business (within the meaning of section 513) or otherwise engaged in activities which may be subject to taxation under this title.

examination notice date.rest: the date the notice with respect to a church tax examination is provided under subsection (b) to the church.
examination notice date.sentence: The term “examination notice date” means the date the notice with respect to a church tax examination is provided under subsection (b) to the church.

inquiry notice date.rest: the date the notice with respect to a church tax inquiry is provided under subsection (a).
inquiry notice date.sentence: The term “inquiry notice date” means the date the notice with respect to a church tax inquiry is provided under subsection (a).

computer software executable code.rest: — any object code, machine code, or other code readable by a computer when loaded into its memory and used directly by such computer to execute instructions; and any related user manuals.
computer software executable code.sentence: The term “computer software executable code” means— any object code, machine code, or other code readable by a computer when loaded into its memory and used directly by such computer to execute instructions; and any related user manuals.

computer software source code.rest: — the code written by a programmer using a programming language which is comprehensible to appropriately trained persons and is not capable of directly being used to give instructions to a computer; related programmers’ notes, design documents, memoranda, and similar documentation; and related customer communications.
computer software source code.sentence: The term “computer software source code” means— the code written by a programmer using a programming language which is comprehensible to appropriately trained persons and is not capable of directly being used to give instructions to a computer; related programmers’ notes, design documents, memoranda, and similar documentation; and related customer communications.

software.rest: computer software source code and computer software executable code.
software.sentence: For purposes of this section— The term “software” includes computer software source code and computer software executable code.

tax-related computer software source cod.rest: the computer source code for any computer software program intended for accounting, tax return preparation or compliance, or tax planning.
tax-related computer software source cod.sentence: The term “tax-related computer software source code” means the computer source code for any computer software program intended for accounting, tax return preparation or compliance, or tax planning.

Federal excise tax subsidy.rest: any subsidy— of a kind different from, or in an amount per value or volume of production greater than, the subsidy which Puerto Rico or the Virgin Islands offers generally to industries producing articles not subject to Federal excise taxes.
Federal excise tax subsidy.sentence: For purposes of this paragraph, the term “Federal excise tax subsidy” means any subsidy— of a kind different from, or in an amount per value or volume of production greater than, the subsidy which Puerto Rico or the Virgin Islands offers generally to industries producing articles not subject to Federal excise taxes.

rum.rest: any article classified under subheading 2208.40.00 of the Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States (19 U.S.C.
rum.sentence: For purposes of this subsection, the term “rum” means any article classified under subheading 2208.40.00 of the Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States (19 U.S.C.

specified possession.rest: Guam, American Samoa, the Northern Mariana Islands, and the Virgin Islands.
specified possession.sentence: The term “specified possession” means Guam, American Samoa, the Northern Mariana Islands, and the Virgin Islands.

Attorney General.rest: the Attorney General of the United States.
Attorney General.sentence: The term “Attorney General” means the Attorney General of the United States.

Commissioner.sentence: The term “Commissioner” means the Commissioner of Internal Revenue.

Indian tribal government.rest: the governing body of any tribe, band, community, village, or group of Indians, or (if applicable) Alaska Natives, which is determined by the Secretary, after consultation with the Secretary of the Interior, to exercise governmental functions.
Indian tribal government.sentence: The term “Indian tribal government” means the governing body of any tribe, band, community, village, or group of Indians, or (if applicable) Alaska Natives, which is determined by the Secretary, after consultation with the Secretary of the Interior, to exercise governmental functions.

Internal Revenue Code of 1939.rest: the Internal Revenue Code enacted February 10, 1939, as amended.
Internal Revenue Code of 1939.sentence: The term “Internal Revenue Code of 1986” means this title, and the term “Internal Revenue Code of 1939” means the Internal Revenue Code enacted February 10, 1939, as amended.

Internal Revenue Code of 1986.rest: this title, and the term “Internal Revenue Code of 1939” means the Internal Revenue Code enacted February 10, 1939, as amended.
Internal Revenue Code of 1986.sentence: The term “Internal Revenue Code of 1986” means this title, and the term “Internal Revenue Code of 1939” means the Internal Revenue Code enacted February 10, 1939, as amended.

Secretary.rest: the Secretary of the Treasury or his delegate.
Secretary.sentence: The term “Secretary” means the Secretary of the Treasury or his delegate.

Secretary of the Treasury.rest: the Secretary of the Treasury, personally, and shall not include any delegate of his.
Secretary of the Treasury.sentence: The term “Secretary of the Treasury” means the Secretary of the Treasury, personally, and shall not include any delegate of his.

TIN.rest: the identifying number assigned to a person under section 6109.
TIN.sentence: The term “TIN” means the identifying number assigned to a person under section 6109.

Tax Court.sentence: The term “Tax Court” means the United States Tax Court.

United States person.rest: — a citizen or resident of the United States, a domestic partnership, a domestic corporation, any estate (other than a foreign estate, within the meaning of paragraph (31)), and any trust if— a court within the United States is able to exercise primary supervision over the administration of the trust, and one or more United States persons have the authority to control all substantial decisions of the trust.
United States person.sentence: The term “United States person” means— a citizen or resident of the United States, a domestic partnership, a domestic corporation, any estate (other than a foreign estate, within the meaning of paragraph (31)), and any trust if— a court within the United States is able to exercise primary supervision over the administration of the trust, and one or more United States persons have the authority to control all substantial decisions of the trust.

alternative energy facility.rest: a facility for producing electrical or thermal energy if the primary energy source for the facility is not oil, natural gas, coal, or nuclear power.
alternative energy facility.sentence: For purposes of subparagraph (A), the term “alternative energy facility” means a facility for producing electrical or thermal energy if the primary energy source for the facility is not oil, natural gas, coal, or nuclear power.

cogeneration facility.rest: a facility which uses the same energy source for the sequential generation of electrical or mechanical power in combination with steam, heat, or other forms of useful energy.
cogeneration facility.sentence: For purposes of subparagraph (A), the term “cogeneration facility” means a facility which uses the same energy source for the sequential generation of electrical or mechanical power in combination with steam, heat, or other forms of useful energy.

cooperative bank.rest: an institution without capital stock organized and operated for mutual purposes and without profit, which— either— is an insured institution within the meaning of section 401(a) 22 See References in Text note below.
cooperative bank.sentence: The term “cooperative bank” means an institution without capital stock organized and operated for mutual purposes and without profit, which— either— is an insured institution within the meaning of section 401(a) 22 See References in Text note below.

corporation.rest: associations, joint-stock companies, and insurance companies.
corporation.sentence: The term “corporation” includes associations, joint-stock companies, and insurance companies.

domestic building and loan association.rest: a domestic building and loan association, a domestic savings and loan association, and a Federal savings and loan association— which either (i) is an insured institution within the meaning of section 401(a) 11 See References in Text note below.
domestic building and loan association.sentence: The term “domestic building and loan association” means a domestic building and loan association, a domestic savings and loan association, and a Federal savings and loan association— which either (i) is an insured institution within the meaning of section 401(a) 11 See References in Text note below.

economic substance doctrine.rest: the common law doctrine under which tax benefits under subtitle A with respect to a transaction are not allowable if the transaction does not have economic substance or lacks a business purpose.
economic substance doctrine.sentence: For purposes of this subsection— The term “economic substance doctrine” means the common law doctrine under which tax benefits under subtitle A with respect to a transaction are not allowable if the transaction does not have economic substance or lacks a business purpose.

employee.rest: a full-time life insurance salesman who is considered an employee for the purpose of chapter 21.
employee.sentence: For the purpose of applying the provisions of section 79 with respect to group-term life insurance purchased for employees, for the purpose of applying the provisions of sections 104, 105, and 106 with respect to accident and health insurance or accident and health plans, and for the purpose of applying the provisions of subtitle A with respect to contributions to or under a stock bonus, pension, profit-sharing, or annuity plan, and with respect to distributions under such a plan, or by a trust forming part of such a plan, and for purposes of applying section 125 with respect to cafeteria plans, the term “employee” shall include a full-time life insurance salesman who is considered an employee for the purpose of chapter 21.

employee representatives.rest: any organization more than one-half of the members of which are employees who are owners, officers, or executives of the employer.
employee representatives.sentence: In determining whether there is a collective bargaining agreement between employee representatives and 1 or more employers, the term “employee representatives” shall not include any organization more than one-half of the members of which are employees who are owners, officers, or executives of the employer.

enrolled actuary.rest: a person who is enrolled by the Joint Board for the Enrollment of Actuaries established under subtitle C of the title III of the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974.
enrolled actuary.sentence: The term “enrolled actuary” means a person who is enrolled by the Joint Board for the Enrollment of Actuaries established under subtitle C of the title III of the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974.

exchanged basis property.rest: property having a basis determined under any provision of subtitle A (or under any corresponding provision of prior income tax law) providing that the basis shall be determined in whole or in part by reference to other property held at any time by the person for whom the basis is to be determined.
exchanged basis property.sentence: The term “exchanged basis property” means property having a basis determined under any provision of subtitle A (or under any corresponding provision of prior income tax law) providing that the basis shall be determined in whole or in part by reference to other property held at any time by the person for whom the basis is to be determined.

fiduciary.rest: a guardian, trustee, executor, administrator, receiver, conservator, or any person acting in any fiduciary capacity for any person.
fiduciary.sentence: The term “fiduciary” means a guardian, trustee, executor, administrator, receiver, conservator, or any person acting in any fiduciary capacity for any person.

fiscal year.rest: an accounting period of 12 months ending on the last day of any month other than December.
fiscal year.sentence: The term “fiscal year” means an accounting period of 12 months ending on the last day of any month other than December.

foreign estate.rest: an estate the income of which, from sources without the United States which is not effectively connected with the conduct of a trade or business within the United States, is not includible in gross income under subtitle A.
foreign estate.sentence: The term “foreign estate” means an estate the income of which, from sources without the United States which is not effectively connected with the conduct of a trade or business within the United States, is not includible in gross income under subtitle A.

foreign government-related individual.rest: any individual temporarily present in the United States by reason of— diplomatic status, or a visa which the Secretary (after consultation with the Secretary of State) determines represents full-time diplomatic or consular status for purposes of this subsection, being a full-time employee of an international organization, or being a member of the immediate family of an individual described in clause (i) or (ii).
foreign government-related individual.sentence: The term “foreign government-related individual” means any individual temporarily present in the United States by reason of— diplomatic status, or a visa which the Secretary (after consultation with the Secretary of State) determines represents full-time diplomatic or consular status for purposes of this subsection, being a full-time employee of an international organization, or being a member of the immediate family of an individual described in clause (i) or (ii).

foreign trust.rest: any trust other than a trust described in subparagraph (E) of paragraph (30).
foreign trust.sentence: The term “foreign trust” means any trust other than a trust described in subparagraph (E) of paragraph (30).

individual retirement plan.rest: — an individual retirement account described in section 408(a), and an individual retirement annuity described in section 408(b).
individual retirement plan.sentence: The term “individual retirement plan” means— an individual retirement account described in section 408(a), and an individual retirement annuity described in section 408(b).

international organization.rest: a public international organization entitled to enjoy privileges, exemptions, and immunities as an international organization under the International Organizations Immunities Act (22 U.S.C.
international organization.sentence: As used in sections 682 and 2516, if the husband and wife therein referred to are divorced, wherever appropriate to the meaning of such sections, the term “wife” shall be read “former wife” and the term “husband” shall be read “former husband”; and, if the payments described in such sections are made by or on behalf of the wife or former wife to the husband or former husband instead of vice versa, wherever appropriate to the meaning of such sections, the term “husband” shall be read “wife” and the term “wife” shall be read “husband.” The term “international organization” means a public international organization entitled to enjoy privileges, exemptions, and immunities as an international organization under the International Organizations Immunities Act (22 U.S.C.

joint return.rest: a single return made jointly under section 6013 by a husband and wife.
joint return.sentence: The term “joint return” means a single return made jointly under section 6013 by a husband and wife.

levy.rest: the power of distraint and seizure by any means.
levy.sentence: The term “levy” includes the power of distraint and seizure by any means.

nonrecognition transaction.rest: any disposition of property in a transaction in which gain or loss is not recognized in whole or in part for purposes of subtitle A.
nonrecognition transaction.sentence: The term “nonrecognition transaction” means any disposition of property in a transaction in which gain or loss is not recognized in whole or in part for purposes of subtitle A.

partner.rest: a member in such a syndicate, group, pool, joint venture, or organization.
partner.sentence: The term “partnership” includes a syndicate, group, pool, joint venture, or other unincorporated organization, through or by means of which any business, financial operation, or venture is carried on, and which is not, within the meaning of this title, a trust or estate or a corporation; and the term “partner” includes a member in such a syndicate, group, pool, joint venture, or organization.

partnership.rest: a syndicate, group, pool, joint venture, or other unincorporated organization, through or by means of which any business, financial operation, or venture is carried on, and which is not, within the meaning of this title, a trust or estate or a corporation; and the term “partner” includes a member in such a syndicate, group, pool, joint venture, or organization.
partnership.sentence: The term “partnership” includes a syndicate, group, pool, joint venture, or other unincorporated organization, through or by means of which any business, financial operation, or venture is carried on, and which is not, within the meaning of this title, a trust or estate or a corporation; and the term “partner” includes a member in such a syndicate, group, pool, joint venture, or organization.

qualified blood collector organization.rest: an organization which is— described in section 501(c)(3) and exempt from tax under section 501(a), primarily engaged in the activity of the collection of human blood, registered with the Secretary for purposes of excise tax exemptions, and registered by the Food and Drug Administration to collect blood.
qualified blood collector organization.sentence: The term “qualified blood collector organization” means an organization which is— described in section 501(c)(3) and exempt from tax under section 501(a), primarily engaged in the activity of the collection of human blood, registered with the Secretary for purposes of excise tax exemptions, and registered by the Food and Drug Administration to collect blood.

qualified motor vehicle operating agreem.rest: any agreement with respect to a motor vehicle (including a trailer) which meets the requirements of subparagraphs (B), (C), and (D) of this paragraph.
qualified motor vehicle operating agreem.sentence: For purposes of this subsection— The term “qualified motor vehicle operating agreement” means any agreement with respect to a motor vehicle (including a trailer) which meets the requirements of subparagraphs (B), (C), and (D) of this paragraph.

qualified solid waste disposal facility.rest: any facility if such facility provides solid waste disposal services for residents of part or all of 1 or more governmental units and substantially all of the solid waste processed at such facility is collected from the general public.
qualified solid waste disposal facility.sentence: For purposes of subparagraph (A), the term “qualified solid waste disposal facility” means any facility if such facility provides solid waste disposal services for residents of part or all of 1 or more governmental units and substantially all of the solid waste processed at such facility is collected from the general public.

regulated public utility.rest: — A corporation engaged in the furnishing or sale of— electric energy, gas, water, or sewerage disposal services, or transportation (not included in subparagraph (C)) on an intrastate, suburban, municipal, or interurban electric railroad, on an intrastate, municipal, or suburban trackless trolley system, or on a municipal or suburban bus system, or transportation (not included in clause (ii)) by motor vehicle— if the rates for such furnishing or sale, as the case may be, have been established or approved by a State or political subdivision thereof, by an agency or instrumentality of the United States, by a public service or public utility commission or other similar body of the District of Columbia or of any State or political subdivision thereof, or by a foreign country or an agency or instrumentality or political subdivision thereof.
regulated public utility.sentence: The term “regulated public utility” means— A corporation engaged in the furnishing or sale of— electric energy, gas, water, or sewerage disposal services, or transportation (not included in subparagraph (C)) on an intrastate, suburban, municipal, or interurban electric railroad, on an intrastate, municipal, or suburban trackless trolley system, or on a municipal or suburban bus system, or transportation (not included in clause (ii)) by motor vehicle— if the rates for such furnishing or sale, as the case may be, have been established or approved by a State or political subdivision thereof, by an agency or instrumentality of the United States, by a public service or public utility commission or other similar body of the District of Columbia or of any State or political subdivision thereof, or by a foreign country or an agency or instrumentality or political subdivision thereof.

shareholder.rest: a member in an association, joint-stock company, or insurance company.
shareholder.sentence: The term “shareholder” includes a member in an association, joint-stock company, or insurance company.

stock.rest: shares in an association, joint-stock company, or insurance company.
stock.sentence: The term “stock” includes shares in an association, joint-stock company, or insurance company.

student.rest: any individual— who is temporarily present in the United States— under subparagraph (F) or (M) of section 101(15) of the Immigration and Nationality Act, or as a student under subparagraph (J) or (Q) of such section 101(15), and who substantially complies with the requirements for being so present.
student.sentence: The term “student” means any individual— who is temporarily present in the United States— under subparagraph (F) or (M) of section 101(15) of the Immigration and Nationality Act, or as a student under subparagraph (J) or (Q) of such section 101(15), and who substantially complies with the requirements for being so present.

substituted basis property.rest: property which is— transferred basis property, or exchanged basis property.
substituted basis property.sentence: The term “substituted basis property” means property which is— transferred basis property, or exchanged basis property.

tax return preparer.rest: any person who prepares for compensation, or who employs one or more persons to prepare for compensation, any return of tax imposed by this title or any claim for refund of tax imposed by this title.
tax return preparer.sentence: The term “tax return preparer” means any person who prepares for compensation, or who employs one or more persons to prepare for compensation, any return of tax imposed by this title or any claim for refund of tax imposed by this title.

taxable year.rest: the calendar year, or the fiscal year ending during such calendar year, upon the basis of which the taxable income is computed under subtitle A.
taxable year.sentence: The term “taxable year” means the calendar year, or the fiscal year ending during such calendar year, upon the basis of which the taxable income is computed under subtitle A.

taxpayer.rest: any person subject to any internal revenue tax.
taxpayer.sentence: The term “taxpayer” means any person subject to any internal revenue tax.

teacher or trainee.rest: any individual— who is temporarily present in the United States under subparagraph (J) or (Q) of section 101(15) of the Immigration and Nationality Act (other than as a student), and who substantially complies with the requirements for being so present.
teacher or trainee.sentence: The term “teacher or trainee” means any individual— who is temporarily present in the United States under subparagraph (J) or (Q) of section 101(15) of the Immigration and Nationality Act (other than as a student), and who substantially complies with the requirements for being so present.

terminal rental adjustment clause.rest: a provision of an agreement which permits or requires the rental price to be adjusted upward or downward by reference to the amount realized by the lessor under the agreement upon sale or other disposition of such property.
terminal rental adjustment clause.sentence: For purposes of this subsection, the term “terminal rental adjustment clause” means a provision of an agreement which permits or requires the rental price to be adjusted upward or downward by reference to the amount realized by the lessor under the agreement upon sale or other disposition of such property.

trade or business.rest: the performance of the functions of a public office.
trade or business.sentence: The term “trade or business” includes the performance of the functions of a public office.

transaction.sentence: The term “transaction” includes a series of transactions.

transferred basis property.rest: property having a basis determined under any provision of subtitle A (or under any corresponding provision of prior income tax law) providing that the basis shall be determined in whole or in part by reference to the basis in the hands of the donor, grantor, or other transferor.
transferred basis property.sentence: The term “transferred basis property” means property having a basis determined under any provision of subtitle A (or under any corresponding provision of prior income tax law) providing that the basis shall be determined in whole or in part by reference to the basis in the hands of the donor, grantor, or other transferor.

water treatment works facility.rest: any treatment works within the meaning of section 212(2) of the Federal Water Pollution Control Act.
water treatment works facility.sentence: For purposes of subparagraph (A), the term “water treatment works facility” means any treatment works within the meaning of section 212(2) of the Federal Water Pollution Control Act.

withholding agent.rest: any person required to deduct and withhold any tax under the provisions of section 1441, 1442, 1443, or 1461.
withholding agent.sentence: The term “withholding agent” means any person required to deduct and withhold any tax under the provisions of section 1441, 1442, 1443, or 1461.

church.rest: a church or a convention or association of churches.
church.sentence: For purposes of this subsection— The term “church” means a church or a convention or association of churches.

death benefit.rest: the amount payable by reason of the death of the insured (determined without regard to any qualified additional benefits).
death benefit.sentence: The term “death benefit” means the amount payable by reason of the death of the insured (determined without regard to any qualified additional benefits).

employee.rest: an employee described in section 414(e)(3)(B).
employee.sentence: The term “employee” includes an employee described in section 414(e)(3)(B).

endowment contract.rest: a contract which is an endowment contract under the applicable law and which meets the requirements of subsection (a).
endowment contract.sentence: For purposes of this title (other than paragraph (1)), the term “endowment contract” means a contract which is an endowment contract under the applicable law and which meets the requirements of subsection (a).

existing plan of insurance.rest: , with respect to any contract, any plan of insurance which was filed by the company issuing such contract in 1 or more States before September 28, 1983, and is on file in the appropriate State for such contract.
existing plan of insurance.sentence: For purposes of this subsection, the term “existing plan of insurance” means, with respect to any contract, any plan of insurance which was filed by the company issuing such contract in 1 or more States before September 28, 1983, and is on file in the appropriate State for such contract.

future benefits.sentence: The term “future benefits” means death benefits and endowment benefits.

guideline level premium.rest: the level annual amount, payable over a period not ending before the insured attains age 95, computed on the same basis as the guideline single premium, except that paragraph (3)(B)(iii) shall be applied by substituting “4 percent” for “6 percent”.
guideline level premium.sentence: The term “guideline level premium” means the level annual amount, payable over a period not ending before the insured attains age 95, computed on the same basis as the guideline single premium, except that paragraph (3)(B)(iii) shall be applied by substituting “4 percent” for “6 percent”.

guideline premium limitation.rest: , as of any date, the greater of— the guideline single premium, or the sum of the guideline level premiums to such date.
guideline premium limitation.sentence: The term “guideline premium limitation” means, as of any date, the greater of— the guideline single premium, or the sum of the guideline level premiums to such date.

guideline single premium.rest: the premium at issue with respect to future benefits under the contract.
guideline single premium.sentence: The term “guideline single premium” means the premium at issue with respect to future benefits under the contract.

income on the contract.rest: , with respect to any taxable year of the policyholder, the excess of— the sum of— the increase in the net surrender value of the contract during the taxable year, and the cost of life insurance protection provided under the contract during the taxable year, over the premiums paid (as defined in subsection (f)(1)) under the contract during the taxable year.
income on the contract.sentence: For purposes of this paragraph, the term “income on the contract” means, with respect to any taxable year of the policyholder, the excess of— the sum of— the increase in the net surrender value of the contract during the taxable year, and the cost of life insurance protection provided under the contract during the taxable year, over the premiums paid (as defined in subsection (f)(1)) under the contract during the taxable year.

life insurance contract.rest: any contract which is a life insurance contract under the applicable law, but only if such contract— meets the cash value accumulation test of subsection (b), or meets the guideline premium requirements of subsection (c), and falls within the cash value corridor of subsection (d).
life insurance contract.sentence: For purposes of this title, the term “life insurance contract” means any contract which is a life insurance contract under the applicable law, but only if such contract— meets the cash value accumulation test of subsection (b), or meets the guideline premium requirements of subsection (c), and falls within the cash value corridor of subsection (d).

premiums paid.rest: the premiums paid under the contract less amounts (other than amounts includible in gross income) to which section 72(e) applies and less any excess premiums with respect to which there is a distribution described in subparagraph (B) or (E) of paragraph (7) and any other amounts received with respect to the contract which are specified in regulations.
premiums paid.sentence: For purposes of this section— The term “premiums paid” means the premiums paid under the contract less amounts (other than amounts includible in gross income) to which section 72(e) applies and less any excess premiums with respect to which there is a distribution described in subparagraph (B) or (E) of paragraph (7) and any other amounts received with respect to the contract which are specified in regulations.

qualified 20-pay contract.rest: any contract which— requires at least 20 nondecreasing annual premium payments, and is issued pursuant to an existing plan of insurance.
qualified 20-pay contract.sentence: For purposes of paragraph (1), the term “qualified 20-pay contract” means any contract which— requires at least 20 nondecreasing annual premium payments, and is issued pursuant to an existing plan of insurance.

qualified additional benefits.rest: any— guaranteed insurability, accidental death or disability benefit, family term coverage, disability waiver benefit, or other benefit prescribed under regulations.
qualified additional benefits.sentence: The term “qualified additional benefits” means any— guaranteed insurability, accidental death or disability benefit, family term coverage, disability waiver benefit, or other benefit prescribed under regulations.

amount paid.rest: — the premiums paid under the contract, reduced by amounts to which section 72(e) applies (determined without regard to paragraph (4)(A) thereof) but not including amounts includible in gross income.
amount paid.sentence: For purposes of this section— The term “amount paid” means— the premiums paid under the contract, reduced by amounts to which section 72(e) applies (determined without regard to paragraph (4)(A) thereof) but not including amounts includible in gross income.

contract year.rest: the 12-month period beginning with the 1st month for which the contract is in effect, and each 12-month period beginning with the corresponding month in subsequent calendar years.
contract year.sentence: The term “contract year” means the 12-month period beginning with the 1st month for which the contract is in effect, and each 12-month period beginning with the corresponding month in subsequent calendar years.

material change.rest: any increase in the death benefit under the contract or any increase in, or addition of, a qualified additional benefit under the contract.
material change.sentence: For purposes of subparagraph (A), the term “material change” includes any increase in the death benefit under the contract or any increase in, or addition of, a qualified additional benefit under the contract.

modified endowment contract.rest: any contract meeting the requirements of section 7702— which— is entered into on or after June 21, 1988, and fails to meet the 7-pay test of subsection (b), or which is received in exchange for a contract described in paragraph (1) or this paragraph.
modified endowment contract.sentence: For purposes of section 72, the term “modified endowment contract” means any contract meeting the requirements of section 7702— which— is entered into on or after June 21, 1988, and fails to meet the 7-pay test of subsection (b), or which is received in exchange for a contract described in paragraph (1) or this paragraph.

State long-term care plan.rest: any plan— which is established and maintained by a State or an instrumentality of a State, which provides coverage only for qualified long-term care services, and under which such coverage is provided only to— employees and former employees of a State (or any political subdivision or instrumentality of a State), the spouses of such employees, and individuals bearing a relationship to such employees or spouses which is described in any of subparagraphs (A) through (G) of section 152(d)(2).
State long-term care plan.sentence: For purposes of paragraph (1), the term “State long-term care plan” means any plan— which is established and maintained by a State or an instrumentality of a State, which provides coverage only for qualified long-term care services, and under which such coverage is provided only to— employees and former employees of a State (or any political subdivision or instrumentality of a State), the spouses of such employees, and individuals bearing a relationship to such employees or spouses which is described in any of subparagraphs (A) through (G) of section 152(d)(2).

chronically ill individual.rest: any individual who has been certified by a licensed health care practitioner as— being unable to perform (without substantial assistance from another individual) at least 2 activities of daily living for a period of at least 90 days due to a loss of functional capacity, having a level of disability similar (as determined under regulations prescribed by the Secretary in consultation with the Secretary of Health and Human Services) to the level of disability described in clause (i), or requiring substantial supervision to protect such individual from threats to health and safety due to severe cognitive impairment.
chronically ill individual.sentence: The term “chronically ill individual” means any individual who has been certified by a licensed health care practitioner as— being unable to perform (without substantial assistance from another individual) at least 2 activities of daily living for a period of at least 90 days due to a loss of functional capacity, having a level of disability similar (as determined under regulations prescribed by the Secretary in consultation with the Secretary of Health and Human Services) to the level of disability described in clause (i), or requiring substantial supervision to protect such individual from threats to health and safety due to severe cognitive impairment.

licensed health care practitioner.rest: any physician (as defined in section 1861(r)(1) of the Social Security Act) and any registered professional nurse, licensed social worker, or other individual who meets such requirements as may be prescribed by the Secretary.
licensed health care practitioner.sentence: The term “licensed health care practitioner” means any physician (as defined in section 1861(r)(1) of the Social Security Act) and any registered professional nurse, licensed social worker, or other individual who meets such requirements as may be prescribed by the Secretary.

maintenance or personal care services.rest: any care the primary purpose of which is the provision of needed assistance with any of the disabilities as a result of which the individual is a chronically ill individual (including the protection from threats to health and safety due to severe cognitive impairment).
maintenance or personal care services.sentence: The term “maintenance or personal care services” means any care the primary purpose of which is the provision of needed assistance with any of the disabilities as a result of which the individual is a chronically ill individual (including the protection from threats to health and safety due to severe cognitive impairment).

periodic payment.rest: any payment (whether on a periodic basis or otherwise) made without regard to the extent of the costs incurred by the payee for qualified long-term care services.
periodic payment.sentence: For purposes of this subsection, the term “periodic payment” means any payment (whether on a periodic basis or otherwise) made without regard to the extent of the costs incurred by the payee for qualified long-term care services.

portion.rest: only the terms and benefits under a life insurance contract or annuity contract that are in addition to the terms and benefits under the contract without regard to long-term care insurance coverage.
portion.sentence: For purposes of this subsection, the term “portion” means only the terms and benefits under a life insurance contract or annuity contract that are in addition to the terms and benefits under the contract without regard to long-term care insurance coverage.

qualified long-term care insurance contr.rest: any insurance contract if— the only insurance protection provided under such contract is coverage of qualified long-term care services, such contract does not pay or reimburse expenses incurred for services or items to the extent that such expenses are reimbursable under title XVIII of the Social Security Act or would be so reimbursable but for the application of a deductible or coinsurance amount, such contract is guaranteed renewable, such contract does not provide for a cash surrender value or other money that can be— paid, assigned, or pledged as collateral for a loan, or borrowed, other than as provided in subparagraph (E) or paragraph (2)(C), all refunds of premiums, and all policyholder dividends or similar amounts, under such contract are to be applied as a reduction in future premiums or to increase future benefits, and such contract meets the requirements of subsection (g).
qualified long-term care insurance contr.sentence: For purposes of this title— The term “qualified long-term care insurance contract” means any insurance contract if— the only insurance protection provided under such contract is coverage of qualified long-term care services, such contract does not pay or reimburse expenses incurred for services or items to the extent that such expenses are reimbursable under title XVIII of the Social Security Act or would be so reimbursable but for the application of a deductible or coinsurance amount, such contract is guaranteed renewable, such contract does not provide for a cash surrender value or other money that can be— paid, assigned, or pledged as collateral for a loan, or borrowed, other than as provided in subparagraph (E) or paragraph (2)(C), all refunds of premiums, and all policyholder dividends or similar amounts, under such contract are to be applied as a reduction in future premiums or to increase future benefits, and such contract meets the requirements of subsection (g).

qualified long-term care services.rest: necessary diagnostic, preventive, therapeutic, curing, treating, mitigating, and rehabilitative services, and maintenance or personal care services, which— are required by a chronically ill individual, and are provided pursuant to a plan of care prescribed by a licensed health care practitioner.
qualified long-term care services.sentence: For purposes of this section— The term “qualified long-term care services” means necessary diagnostic, preventive, therapeutic, curing, treating, mitigating, and rehabilitative services, and maintenance or personal care services, which— are required by a chronically ill individual, and are provided pursuant to a plan of care prescribed by a licensed health care practitioner.

electing 1987 partnership.rest: any publicly traded partnership if— such partnership is an existing partnership (as defined in section 10211(c)(2) of the Revenue Reconciliation Act of 1987), subsection (a) has not applied (and without regard to subsection (c)(1) would not have applied) to such partnership for all prior taxable years beginning after December 31, 1987, and before January 1, 1998, and such partnership elects the application of this subsection, and consents to the application of the tax imposed by paragraph (3), for its first taxable year beginning after December 31, 1997.
electing 1987 partnership.sentence: For purposes of this subsection, the term “electing 1987 partnership” means any publicly traded partnership if— such partnership is an existing partnership (as defined in section 10211(c)(2) of the Revenue Reconciliation Act of 1987), subsection (a) has not applied (and without regard to subsection (c)(1) would not have applied) to such partnership for all prior taxable years beginning after December 31, 1987, and before January 1, 1998, and such partnership elects the application of this subsection, and consents to the application of the tax imposed by paragraph (3), for its first taxable year beginning after December 31, 1997.

mineral or natural resource.rest: any product of a character with respect to which a deduction for depletion is allowable under section 611; except that such term shall not include any product described in subparagraph (A) or (B) of section 613(b)(7).
mineral or natural resource.sentence: For purposes of subparagraph (E), the term “mineral or natural resource” means any product of a character with respect to which a deduction for depletion is allowable under section 611; except that such term shall not include any product described in subparagraph (A) or (B) of section 613(b)(7).

publicly traded partnership.rest: any partnership if— interests in such partnership are traded on an established securities market, or interests in such partnership are readily tradable on a secondary market (or the substantial equivalent thereof).
publicly traded partnership.sentence: For purposes of this section, the term “publicly traded partnership” means any partnership if— interests in such partnership are traded on an established securities market, or interests in such partnership are readily tradable on a secondary market (or the substantial equivalent thereof).

qualifying income.rest: — interest, dividends, real property rents, gain from the sale or other disposition of real property (including property described in section 1221(a)(1)), income and gains derived from the exploration, development, mining or production, processing, refining, transportation (including pipelines transporting gas, oil, or products thereof), or the marketing of any mineral or natural resource (including fertilizer, geothermal energy, and timber), industrial source carbon dioxide, or the transportation or storage of any fuel described in subsection (b), (c), (d), or (e) of section 6426, or any alcohol fuel defined in section 6426(b)(4)(A) or any biodiesel fuel as defined in section 40A(d)(1), any gain from the sale or disposition of a capital asset (or property described in section 1231(b)) held for the production of income described in any of the foregoing subparagraphs of this paragraph, and in the case of a partnership described in the second sentence of subsection (c)(3), income and gains from commodities (not described in section 1221(a)(1)) or futures, forwards, and options with respect to commodities.
qualifying income.sentence: For purposes of this section— Except as otherwise provided in this subsection, the term “qualifying income” means— interest, dividends, real property rents, gain from the sale or other disposition of real property (including property described in section 1221(a)(1)), income and gains derived from the exploration, development, mining or production, processing, refining, transportation (including pipelines transporting gas, oil, or products thereof), or the marketing of any mineral or natural resource (including fertilizer, geothermal energy, and timber), industrial source carbon dioxide, or the transportation or storage of any fuel described in subsection (b), (c), (d), or (e) of section 6426, or any alcohol fuel defined in section 6426(b)(4)(A) or any biodiesel fuel as defined in section 40A(d)(1), any gain from the sale or disposition of a capital asset (or property described in section 1231(b)) held for the production of income described in any of the foregoing subparagraphs of this paragraph, and in the case of a partnership described in the second sentence of subsection (c)(3), income and gains from commodities (not described in section 1221(a)(1)) or futures, forwards, and options with respect to commodities.

real property rent.rest: amounts which would qualify as rent from real property under section 856(d) if— such section were applied without regard to paragraph (2)(C) thereof (relating to independent contractor requirements), and stock owned, directly or indirectly, by or for a partner would not be considered as owned under section 318(a)(3)(A) by the partnership unless 5 percent or more (by value) of the interests in such partnership are owned, directly or indirectly, by or for such partner.
real property rent.sentence: The term “real property rent” means amounts which would qualify as rent from real property under section 856(d) if— such section were applied without regard to paragraph (2)(C) thereof (relating to independent contractor requirements), and stock owned, directly or indirectly, by or for a partner would not be considered as owned under section 318(a)(3)(A) by the partnership unless 5 percent or more (by value) of the interests in such partnership are owned, directly or indirectly, by or for such partner.

certified professional employer organiza.rest: a person who applies to be treated as a certified professional employer organization for purposes of section 3511 and has been certified by the Secretary as meeting the requirements of subsection (b).
certified professional employer organiza.sentence: For purposes of this title, the term “certified professional employer organization” means a person who applies to be treated as a certified professional employer organization for purposes of section 3511 and has been certified by the Secretary as meeting the requirements of subsection (b).

work site employee.rest: , with respect to a certified professional employer organization, an individual who— performs services for a customer pursuant to a contract which is between such customer and the certified professional employer organization and which meets the requirements of paragraph (2), and performs services at a work site meeting the requirements of paragraph (3).
work site employee.sentence: For purposes of this title— The term “work site employee” means, with respect to a certified professional employer organization, an individual who— performs services for a customer pursuant to a contract which is between such customer and the certified professional employer organization and which meets the requirements of paragraph (2), and performs services at a work site meeting the requirements of paragraph (3).

foreign income taxes.rest: taxes described in section 901 which are paid or accrued to foreign countries and to possessions of the United States.
foreign income taxes.sentence: The term “foreign income taxes” means taxes described in section 901 which are paid or accrued to foreign countries and to possessions of the United States.

general credits.rest: any credit other than the low-income housing credit, the rehabilitation credit, and the foreign tax credit.
general credits.sentence: The term “general credits” means any credit other than the low-income housing credit, the rehabilitation credit, and the foreign tax credit.

net adjustment.rest: the net adjustment in the items attributable to passive loss activities or other activities (as the case may be) which would result if such items were determined with the adjustments of sections 56, 57, and 58.
net adjustment.sentence: The term “net adjustment” means the net adjustment in the items attributable to passive loss activities or other activities (as the case may be) which would result if such items were determined with the adjustments of sections 56, 57, and 58.

net capital loss.rest: the excess of the losses from sales or exchanges of capital assets over the gains from sales or exchange of capital assets.
net capital loss.sentence: The term “net capital loss” means the excess of the losses from sales or exchanges of capital assets over the gains from sales or exchange of capital assets.

passive loss limitation activity.rest: — any activity which involves the conduct of a trade or business, and any rental activity.
passive loss limitation activity.sentence: For purposes of this section— The term “passive loss limitation activity” means— any activity which involves the conduct of a trade or business, and any rental activity.

tax-exempt interest.rest: interest excludable from gross income under section 103.
tax-exempt interest.sentence: The term “tax-exempt interest” means interest excludable from gross income under section 103.

trade or business.rest: any activity treated as a trade or business under paragraph (5) or (6) of section 469(c).
trade or business.sentence: For purposes of the preceding sentence, the term “trade or business” includes any activity treated as a trade or business under paragraph (5) or (6) of section 469(c).

credit recapture.rest: any increase in tax under section 42(j) or 50(a).
credit recapture.sentence: For purposes of this subsection, the term “credit recapture” means any increase in tax under section 42(j) or 50(a).

electing large partnership.rest: , with respect to any partnership taxable year, any partnership if— the number of persons who were partners in such partnership in the preceding partnership taxable year equaled or exceeded 100, and such partnership elects the application of this part.
electing large partnership.sentence: For purposes of this part— The term “electing large partnership” means, with respect to any partnership taxable year, any partnership if— the number of persons who were partners in such partnership in the preceding partnership taxable year equaled or exceeded 100, and such partnership elects the application of this part.

partner.rest: any individual performing substantial services in connection with the activities of the partnership and holding an interest in such partnership, or an individual who formerly performed substantial services in connection with such activities and who held an interest in such partnership at the time the individual performed such services.
partner.sentence: For purposes of this section, the term “partner” does not include any individual performing substantial services in connection with the activities of the partnership and holding an interest in such partnership, or an individual who formerly performed substantial services in connection with such activities and who held an interest in such partnership at the time the individual performed such services.

disqualified person.rest: , with respect to any partnership taxable year— any person referred to in paragraph (2) or (4) of section 613A(d) for such person’s taxable year in which such partnership taxable year ends, and any other person if such person’s average daily production of domestic crude oil and natural gas for such person’s taxable year in which such partnership taxable year ends exceeds 500 barrels.
disqualified person.sentence: For purposes of paragraph (1), the term “disqualified person” means, with respect to any partnership taxable year— any person referred to in paragraph (2) or (4) of section 613A(d) for such person’s taxable year in which such partnership taxable year ends, and any other person if such person’s average daily production of domestic crude oil and natural gas for such person’s taxable year in which such partnership taxable year ends exceeds 500 barrels.

National Taxpayer Advocate.rest: any designee of the National Taxpayer Advocate.
National Taxpayer Advocate.sentence: For purposes of this section, the term “National Taxpayer Advocate” includes any designee of the National Taxpayer Advocate.

Indian tribe.rest: any Indian tribe, band, nation, or other organized group or community which is recognized as eligible for the special programs and services provided by the United States to Indians because of their status as Indians.
Indian tribe.sentence: The term “Indian tribe” means any Indian tribe, band, nation, or other organized group or community which is recognized as eligible for the special programs and services provided by the United States to Indians because of their status as Indians.

essential governmental function.rest: any function which is not customarily performed by State and local governments with general taxing powers.
essential governmental function.sentence: For purposes of this section, the term “essential governmental function” shall not include any function which is not customarily performed by State and local governments with general taxing powers.

net proceeds.sentence: The term “net proceeds” has the meaning given such term by section 150(a)(3).

qualified Indian lands.rest: land which is held in trust by the United States for the benefit of an Indian tribe.
qualified Indian lands.sentence: For purposes of this paragraph— The term “qualified Indian lands” means land which is held in trust by the United States for the benefit of an Indian tribe.

testing period.rest: , with respect to an issue, each calendar year which begins more than 2 years after the date of issuance of the issue (or, in the case of a refunding obligation, the date of issuance of the original issue).
testing period.sentence: For purposes of this subparagraph, the term “testing period” means, with respect to an issue, each calendar year which begins more than 2 years after the date of issuance of the issue (or, in the case of a refunding obligation, the date of issuance of the original issue).

tribal economic development bond.rest: any bond issued by an Indian tribal government— the interest on which would be exempt from tax under section 103 if issued by a State or local government, and which is designated by the Indian tribal government as a tribal economic development bond for purposes of this subsection.
tribal economic development bond.sentence: For purposes of this section, the term “tribal economic development bond” means any bond issued by an Indian tribal government— the interest on which would be exempt from tax under section 103 if issued by a State or local government, and which is designated by the Indian tribal government as a tribal economic development bond for purposes of this subsection.

amount loaned.rest: the amount received by the borrower.
amount loaned.sentence: The term “amount loaned” means the amount received by the borrower.

below-market loan.rest: any loan if— in the case of a demand loan, interest is payable on the loan at a rate less than the applicable Federal rate, or in the case of a term loan, the amount loaned exceeds the present value of all payments due under the loan.
below-market loan.sentence: For purposes of this section— The term “below-market loan” means any loan if— in the case of a demand loan, interest is payable on the loan at a rate less than the applicable Federal rate, or in the case of a term loan, the amount loaned exceeds the present value of all payments due under the loan.

continuing care contract.rest: a written contract between an individual and a qualified continuing care facility under which— the individual or individual’s spouse may use a qualified continuing care facility for their life or lives, the individual or individual’s spouse— will first— reside in a separate, independent living unit with additional facilities outside such unit for the providing of meals and other personal care, and not require long-term nursing care, and then will be provided long-term and skilled nursing care as the health of such individual or individual’s spouse requires, and no additional substantial payment is required if such individual or individual’s spouse requires increased personal care services or long-term and skilled nursing care.
continuing care contract.sentence: For purposes of this section, the term “continuing care contract” means a written contract between an individual and a qualified continuing care facility under which— the individual or individual’s spouse may use a qualified continuing care facility for their life or lives, the individual or individual’s spouse— will first— reside in a separate, independent living unit with additional facilities outside such unit for the providing of meals and other personal care, and not require long-term nursing care, and then will be provided long-term and skilled nursing care as the health of such individual or individual’s spouse requires, and no additional substantial payment is required if such individual or individual’s spouse requires increased personal care services or long-term and skilled nursing care.

continuing care contract#.rest: a written contract between an individual and a qualified continuing care facility under which— the individual or individual’s spouse may use a qualified continuing care facility for their life or lives, the individual or individual’s spouse will be provided with housing, as appropriate for the health of such individual or individual’s spouse— in an independent living unit (which has additional available facilities outside such unit for the provision of meals and other personal care), and in an assisted living facility or a nursing facility, as is available in the continuing care facility, and the individual or individual’s spouse will be provided assisted living or nursing care as the health of such individual or individual’s spouse requires, and as is available in the continuing care facility.
continuing care contract#.sentence: For purposes of this section, the term “continuing care contract” means a written contract between an individual and a qualified continuing care facility under which— the individual or individual’s spouse may use a qualified continuing care facility for their life or lives, the individual or individual’s spouse will be provided with housing, as appropriate for the health of such individual or individual’s spouse— in an independent living unit (which has additional available facilities outside such unit for the provision of meals and other personal care), and in an assisted living facility or a nursing facility, as is available in the continuing care facility, and the individual or individual’s spouse will be provided assisted living or nursing care as the health of such individual or individual’s spouse requires, and as is available in the continuing care facility.

deferred payment obligation.rest: any market discount bond, short-term obligation, United States savings bond, annuity, or similar obligation.
deferred payment obligation.sentence: The term “deferred payment obligation” includes any market discount bond, short-term obligation, United States savings bond, annuity, or similar obligation.

demand loan.rest: any loan which is payable in full at any time on the demand of the lender.
demand loan.sentence: The term “demand loan” means any loan which is payable in full at any time on the demand of the lender.

forgone interest.rest: , with respect to any period during which the loan is outstanding, the excess of— the amount of interest which would have been payable on the loan for the period if interest accrued on the loan at the applicable Federal rate and were payable annually on the day referred to in subsection (a)(2), over any interest payable on the loan properly allocable to such period.
forgone interest.sentence: The term “forgone interest” means, with respect to any period during which the loan is outstanding, the excess of— the amount of interest which would have been payable on the loan for the period if interest accrued on the loan at the applicable Federal rate and were payable annually on the day referred to in subsection (a)(2), over any interest payable on the loan properly allocable to such period.

gift loan.rest: any below-market loan where the forgoing of interest is in the nature of a gift.
gift loan.sentence: The term “gift loan” means any below-market loan where the forgoing of interest is in the nature of a gift.

net investment income.sentence: For purposes of this paragraph— The term “net investment income” has the meaning given such term by section 163(d)(4).

qualified continuing care facility.rest: 1 or more facilities— which are designed to provide services under continuing care contracts, and substantially all of the residents of which are covered by continuing care contracts.
qualified continuing care facility.sentence: For purposes of this section, the term “qualified continuing care facility” means 1 or more facilities— which are designed to provide services under continuing care contracts, and substantially all of the residents of which are covered by continuing care contracts.

qualified continuing care facility#.rest: any facility which is of a type which is traditionally considered a nursing home.
qualified continuing care facility#.sentence: The term “qualified continuing care facility” shall not include any facility which is of a type which is traditionally considered a nursing home.

qualified continuing care facility##.rest: 1 or more facilities— which are designed to provide services under continuing care contracts, which include an independent living unit, plus an assisted living or nursing facility, or both, and substantially all of the independent living unit residents of which are covered by continuing care contracts.
qualified continuing care facility##.sentence: For purposes of this section, the term “qualified continuing care facility” means 1 or more facilities— which are designed to provide services under continuing care contracts, which include an independent living unit, plus an assisted living or nursing facility, or both, and substantially all of the independent living unit residents of which are covered by continuing care contracts.

qualified continuing care facility###.rest: any facility which is of a type which is traditionally considered a nursing home.
qualified continuing care facility###.sentence: The term “qualified continuing care facility” shall not include any facility which is of a type which is traditionally considered a nursing home.

term loan.rest: any loan which is not a demand loan.
term loan.sentence: The term “term loan” means any loan which is not a demand loan.

fishing rights-related activity.rest: , with respect to an Indian tribe, any activity directly related to harvesting, processing, or transporting fish harvested in the exercise of a recognized fishing right of such tribe or to selling such fish but only if substantially all of such harvesting was performed by members of such tribe.
fishing rights-related activity.sentence: For purposes of this section— The term “fishing rights-related activity” means, with respect to an Indian tribe, any activity directly related to harvesting, processing, or transporting fish harvested in the exercise of a recognized fishing right of such tribe or to selling such fish but only if substantially all of such harvesting was performed by members of such tribe.

qualified Indian entity.rest: , with respect to an Indian tribe, any entity if— such entity is engaged in a fishing rights-related activity of such tribe, all of the equity interests in the entity are owned by qualified Indian tribes, members of such tribes, or their spouses, except as provided in regulations, in the case of an entity which engages to any extent in any substantial processing or transporting of fish, 90 percent or more of the annual gross receipts of the entity is derived from fishing rights-related activities of one or more qualified Indian tribes each of which owns at least 10 percent of the equity interests in the entity, and substantially all of the management functions of the entity are performed by members of qualified Indian tribes.
qualified Indian entity.sentence: The term “qualified Indian entity” means, with respect to an Indian tribe, any entity if— such entity is engaged in a fishing rights-related activity of such tribe, all of the equity interests in the entity are owned by qualified Indian tribes, members of such tribes, or their spouses, except as provided in regulations, in the case of an entity which engages to any extent in any substantial processing or transporting of fish, 90 percent or more of the annual gross receipts of the entity is derived from fishing rights-related activities of one or more qualified Indian tribes each of which owns at least 10 percent of the equity interests in the entity, and substantially all of the management functions of the entity are performed by members of qualified Indian tribes.

recognized fishing rights.rest: , with respect to an Indian tribe, fishing rights secured as of March 17, 1988, by a treaty between such tribe and the United States or by an Executive order or an Act of Congress.
recognized fishing rights.sentence: The term “recognized fishing rights” means, with respect to an Indian tribe, fishing rights secured as of March 17, 1988, by a treaty between such tribe and the United States or by an Executive order or an Act of Congress.
